For that he needs to better maintain his field, that is to say,  to apply fertilizers and fungicides at the opportune moment to hope to have a good production.  It is for this that he is requesting this loan which will allow him to purchase the fungicides in time for a better production.  He would like as well to expand his plantation and become a large developer of the cocoa culture in the future.

name: Anahit
use: to buy two dairy cows, an ox, as well as fertilizer for a rich harvest.
texts:
Get to know Anahit, who is 31 years old and lives in Vardenis with her husband and three children, ages 7, 9, and 11 years.

Alongwith her husband, Anahit runs a large mixed farm. She keeps cows, calves, oxen, and hens, and grows potatoes. By selling milk, eggs, and potatos, this family carries on with living.

Anahit constantly works on her farm and tries to develop it. Now, she has asked for this loan to pay for two dairy cows, an ox, as well as fertilizer for the rich harvest in future.

Anahit has high hopes for this loan and is very graceful in advance.

name: José Ricardo
use: to purchase fertilizers for his crops of basic grains.
texts:
José is forty-nine years old, married and his wife takes care of the household tasks. They have a son who is studying.

José has worked in agriculture for 30 years and learned it from his father.

José wants to guarantee a good harvest, so he needs a loan to purchase fertilizers for his crops of basic grains.

His dreams are that his crops are productive and that they develop in good condition and that his income improves to continue getting his family ahead.

name: Fermín
use: to buy two corn mills in order to continue providing service to his clients.
texts:
Fermín studied through high school. He lives with his partner and they have an 11 year-old daughter.

Fermín has been providing service with his corn mill for more than 15 years, and he learned this from his father. He gets up every day at 3:00 in the morning so he can tend to his clients, since most of them are merchants of corn-derived products.

He needs the loan to buy two corn mills so he can continue providing service to his clients.

Fermín wants to improve his business and he would also like to have a car in order to provide transportation services.

name: Kevin Ulises
use: to buy string for making hammocks.
texts:
Kevin studied through high school. He is single and lives with his mother and two younger brothers, who are attending school.

Kevin has been making hammocks for two years and he learned how from his mother. He also distributes propane gas. He makes the hammocks in his house and then sells them in town.

He needs a loan to buy string for making hammocks.

His dream is grow the business and to buy a motorcycle so he can travel to sell the hammocks.

name: Mimilyn
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts: Mimilyn is 44 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school.  Mimilyn is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Mimilyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.  Mimilyn has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Mimilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Hayatan
use: to procure stitching inventory like threads, buttons, laces and pearls.
texts:
Hayatan is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives in Hafizabad, Pakistan. She supports her family through her tailoring business. She has been working as a tailor for the past 15 years.

She is extremely well-known for her work and gets a lot of appreciation from her clients. Currently, she needs to buy some additional raw materials for her business, like threads, buttons, laces and pearls etc., but due to financial constraints, she and her family are unable to do that.

Therefore, she has asked for a loan from JWS Pakistan, a field partner of Kiva. Hayatan is very grateful to Kiva and to JWS Pakistan for their help.

name: Nosheen
use: to buy clothing stitching inputs like fabrics, thread, zips and buttons.
texts:
Nosheen is a professional tailor. She learned the art of stitching at a very young age from her mother.

Nowadays, she's the trusted tailor of hundreds of residents in her town to whom she offers her services. She stitches all kinds of clothing. She has been doing this job for three years, and thanks to this, she is able to contribute to the household economy.

She is currently requesting a loan from JWS Pakistan to invest in clothing stitching inputs like fabrics, thread, zips and others.

Her future goal is to produce more and set up a boutique at her home.

She and her family are very thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Sehrash
use: to buy new textiles and accessories like thread, buttons, pearls, and lace.
texts:
Sehrash is 25 years old and married. She lives in an undeveloped area of Hafizabad, Pakistan, with her husband and one child.

She is a talented tailor as well as an artistic embroider. She has been working in this type of business for three years. She produces different clothing designs and embroidery. She is well known in her town; all her clients are very satisfied with her work and designs.

At the moment, Sehrash wants to borrow money from JWS Pakistan to purchase new textiles and accessories like thread, buttons, pearls and lace to increase her productivity and meet her customers' demands.

She tends to achieve more improvements and enhancements in her life to reach her goals, particularly financial-wise, and help her family.

Sehrash is thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Sajida
use: to buy sewing inventory including laces, buttons, threads and artificial gems.
texts:
Sajida is 32 years old woman, living with her family in the area of Mandi Bahauddin, Pakistan. She runs a women's cloth tailoring business at her home. She has been working in this sphere of services since 2012. Her relatives helped her to initiate her business and since then, she worked very hard to make it grow and flourish as it does now.

Currently, she needs to purchase some raw material items for her business including laces, buttons, threads and artificial gems for designing purpose but, finds it difficult for her to buy them due to financial constraints. Therefore, she has requested for a loan from JWS Pakistan field partner of Kiva.

She is thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Sonia
use: to buy a new sewing machine, colorful thread, cloth, buttons, and needles.
texts:
Sonia is 27 years old and married, with five children. She lives in a town of Gujranwala, Pakistan. She is striving hard to support her family by providing food, education and healthcare.

She is very familiar with sewing techniques, and she is celebrated for her designs as well. She learned these skills from a vocational training institute.

Currently, Sonia is requesting a loan from JWS Pakistan to buy a new sewing machine, along with some colorful thread, cloth, buttons, and needles. All this would help her to meet the demands of her customers in efficient manner.

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Asima
use: to purchase raw material including cloth, colorful threads, needles, buttons, and laces for cloth stitching.
texts:
Asima is a women entrepreneur and struggling to bring prosperity to her family. She is 28 years old and lives in a small house with 5 family members. She is a skilled woman and has adopted cloth stitching as a source of livelihood. She has around 5 years of experience in cloth designing and stitching.

She works at her home and provides tailoring services to the women of her community. Her stitching quality has earned her a good fame within few years of service. She is very eager and wants to promote her business with the passage of time.

At the moment she is lacking finance to purchase raw material including cloths, colorful threads, needles, buttons, and laces for cloth stitching. She therefore has requested a loan from JWS Pakistan, field partner of KIVA, to finance the raw material for her business.

Asima is very thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Zarina
use: to invest in her scarf making business and increase production.
texts:
Zarina is 40 years old and a mother of four children. She makes scarves at home. She has a small unit for making scarves in different colors. The basic raw material she uses is thread to make these scarves.

Her family's living conditions are not so good, and that worries her all the time. She manages to pay for the daily household expenses with her meager income.

In order to have increased production, she has decided to buy more raw material and start making more scarves.

She is applying for a loan from BRAC Pakistan for the purchase and hopes that her living conditions will improve.

name: Jesus Arnulfo
use: to pay for the birth of his child.
texts: Jesus is 32 years old, married to Rosalba, and lives in a municipality close to the city of Monterrey. He has worked at a business which sells tools for 5 years and his wife takes care of the home. Rosalba will soon make him a father, since she is in the last months of pregnancy. He wants the birth of his child to happen in a private hospital to have the peace of mind that both his wife and baby will receive good medical attention. Jesus is very happy and anxiously awaits the arrival of his baby.

name: Jesus
use: to pay for his mother-in-law's eye surgery.
texts: Jesús is from Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, a city where he lives with his wife, Bertha, and a 5-year-old son. To get his family ahead, he has worked at a transportation business for 15 years. His wife is worried about her mother's health because they diagnosed her with an illness which prevents her from seeing. This has caused her several accidents which put her well-being at risk. The lady urgently needs surgery, so Jesús asked for a loan with which he will pay for his mother-in-law's surgery and, so, she will be able to recover her sight. With this, Jesús also looks for his wife to be more at peace since her mother will be able to take care of herself and not worry that she could suffer a severe accident.

name: Marife
use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.
texts:
As a married parent of five children already, Marife works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and food vending. Marife is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marife has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Silvia Lourdes
use: to buy fertilizers so she can provide good maintenance to her corn crop.
texts:
Silvia is 28 years old. She studied through second grade. She has 2 daughters and is a single mother.

Silvia is a merchant. She sells snacks and has been in this business for 5 years. She is also a seamstress, raises pigs, and farms basic grains.

She needs this loan to buy fertilizers so she can provide good maintenance to her corn crop.

She wants to continue working for the wellbeing of her family.

name: Rosita
use: for the purchase of grocery stock.
texts:
Rosita is 47 years old, married, and lives at Tinotungan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer. That is their source of income. They plant rice and corn on their farm. Aside from their farm, Rosita engage in grocery selling.

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008, availed a loan and payed on time. Now she took another loan for purchase of grocery stocks for her store..

She wants to save money for future needs.

name: Rany's Group
use: to buy pesticide for protecting her farm from insects.
texts:
Rany is age 43 years old and a married mother of six children. Rany is living with her family in a rural village located in Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. To overcome her family’s hard-ship, she is growing rice while her husband is driving a taxi to earn income for supporting the family.

Insects have threatened her farming business is the main challenge for her. To save her business she is now leading this group of two to request for a supportive loan in order to buy pesticide for protecting her farm from insects. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her crop healthily as well as to gain more returns.

name: Zahida
use: to buy a new sewing machine, colorful threads, laces, buttons and artificial gems.
texts:
Zahida is a 37-year-old woman. She lives with her family in Mandi Bahauddin. To help her family meet their living expenses, she has been stitching clothes for the past 5 years.

Zahida's current sewing machine is out-dated and requires replacement, along with her inventory of colorful threads, laces, buttons and artificial gems. However, due to limited finances available, she has been unable to do so.

To meet this challenge, Zahida has requested a loan, so that she can buy a new professional sewing machine and some additional threads and cloth for her business.

Zahida is very grateful to KIVA and JWS Pakistan.

name: Malliga
use: to install q water connection to her household.
texts:
Malliga is a 43-year-old woman from Tiruchirappalli district, Tamil Nadu. Like many rural households, her family has struggled with the water crisis in India.

Under the water supply projects initiated by Guardian, Milaap’s partner in the region, Malliga now has the option to install a water connection and obtain a clean water connection to her home.

Wanting a better life for her family, Malliga seeks a loan of US$125 from Guardian to bring water to her home by installing water pipes. Malliga and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Humaira
use: to buy bedsheets in bulk to increase sales and have  better income.
texts:
Humaira is 27 years old and has one child. She has established a small set up at home for selling bed sheets. Young as she is she is focused and has come a long way since she started it 2 years ago.

She sells bed sheets to neighborhood ladies and is polite with her customers. She wants to provide better standard of living to her child and is striving to generate more income that she can invest in a house.

She has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy more bed sheet with the hope to have more sales and increased income.

She hopes to expand her business in the future and have clothes to sell as well.

name: Jamila
use: to buy supplies such as fabric, threads, elastic, needles, and buttons.
texts:
This is Jamila, who lives in Gujranwala, Pakistan. She is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. She stitches clothes and has been working for more than 3 years in this business. She learned to stitch clothes from her mother.

Currently, she lacks resources to buy supplies such as fabric, threads, elastic, needles, and other items. Therefore, she has requested a loan from JWS Pakistan. She intends to use this loan to streamline her business processes and improve her inventory in the coming days.

She also dreams of starting a stitching training center for local unskilled and helpless women. All she needs is help from JWS Pakistan to transform her dreams into reality.



She is thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Uzma
use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, laces and fabrics.
texts:
Uzma is 34 years old and from Gujranwala, Pakistan. She is a hardworking mother of two young children. She is working hard to ensure a good life for them. Her husband’s income is very limited, therefore he cannot cover all the needs of his family. She wants to help him in any way she can.

Hence, she decided to start her clothing stitching and designing business four years ago. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore, she has requested a loan from JWS Pakistan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, laces and fabrics to increase her income.

She and her family are thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Esmeralda Saraí
use: to buy more basic products for sale in her store.
texts:
Esmeralda is thirty-four years old. She lives with her partner, who works in construction. She has two children, of whom only the older one goes to school.

Esmeralda has a store and she’s been in this business for three years. She has the business in her house and her partner is also involved in the work.

The loan will be used to purchase more basic products for sale in the store.

Her dream is to improve her business and provide a better quality of life to her family.

name: Heidi Marisela
use: to buy more pigs in order to fatten them and sell them at a good price.
texts:
Heidi is 32 years old and studied through ninth grade. Her partner is employed with a company that distributes dairy products, working as a driver. She has two children, who appear with her in the photo.

Heidi raises pigs and chickens, which she learned from her parents. She also farms basic grains for her family’s consumption.

She was previously supported via 3 Kiva loans, which she invested in the raising of pigs. Through hard work, she repaid them completely. She needs a new loan to buy more pigs in order to fatten them and sell them at a good price.

She dreams of providing a good education to her children and, in the future, to generate greater income through her work.

name: Gina
use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Gina is 52 years old, married, and has six children.

Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Sana
use: to register her grocery store and buy groceries to meet the holy month of Ramadan well-prepared to increase her income.
texts:
Sana owns a grocery store. Her business began at home and later on, within three years, she opened a store. She has many customers and knows their needs well.

As the holy month of Ramadan approaches, certain items become in demand. She is working on securing these goods for her customers. Also, she wants to register her business. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to have the capital needed to perform the latter tasks.

name: Jopelen
use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Jopelen is 30 years old and single. She earns a living by a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jopelen is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jopelen has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

name: Jose Jomar
use: to purchase additional stock like salt, sugar, noodles, canned goods and beverages.
texts:
Jose Jomar is a hardworking man from Barili town. He is married and has no child yet.

He started to run a sari-sari (variety) store four years ago, serving local inhabitants in his place.

To improve his earnings and continue to meet the family's daily needs, he wants to acquire funds to maintain the content of his shop.

A loan of 10,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional stock like salt, sugar, noodles, canned goods and beverages.

With the help of the loan, Jose Jomar is full of hope to manage his daily income and start to save for future expansion.

name: Muhabat
use: to purchase feed for livestock to fatten and sell on the market, and thereby gain profit from the sale of fresh meat.
texts: Muhabat lives in the Isfara region. She is 46 and works in animal husbandry. Muhabat plans to buy feed for livestock to fatten and sell on the market, and thereby gain profit from the sale of fresh meat, with the help of this loan. She believes that in this way, her business will bring in a good profit, which will improve her living conditions and standard of living.

name: Iglesias De Cieza
use: to  buy a new stove and some furniture for her food sales business at the door of her house.
texts:
Consuelo is 55 years old and lives in a rented house in the El Huito sector of the city of Jaén, Perú. She had a daughter at the age of 33, and lives separately from the father of her daughter, so she has sole responsible for supporting her family. Consuelo has worked for 5 years selling food outside of her house in El Huito. In order to grow her food sales business, Consuelo needs to buy a new stove and some furniture.

This loan will allow Consuelo to improve her business by buying a new stove and some furniture. She has dedicated a part of her space to food sales and to providing a pleasant place for her clients while increasing her sales. Her dream is to see her daughter become a professional. She works very responsibly with Norandino and this is her first loan. She feels very grateful for the trust placed in her.

name: Faiza Shaheen
use: to buy raw materials for her business, like threads, buttons, laces and pearls.
texts:
Faiza Shaheen is a 22-year-old young woman who lives in Mandi Bahauddin, Pakistan. She supports her family through her tailoring business. She has been working as a tailor for the past two years.

Faiza Shaheen is extremely well known for her work and gets a lot of appreciation from her clients. Currently, she needs to buy some additional raw materials for her business, like threads, buttons, laces and pearls etc. but due to financial constraints, she and her family are unable to do that. Therefore, she has asked for a loan from JWS Pakistan, field partner of Kiva.

Faiza Shaheen is very grateful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan for their help.

name: Kousar
use: to acquire raw materials like needles, thread, buttons and cloths.
texts:
Kousar is a working woman. She is the mother of four children and lives with her family in a town in Mandi Bahauddin, Pakistan.

She has been providing the service of cloth stitching in her locality for the last five years. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Her work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

She now wants to acquire some raw materials like needles, thread, buttons and cloths so that she will gain some additional revenue from it. Unfortunately, she lacks financing to do so. Therefore, she has requested a loan from JWS Pakistan, field partner of Kiva.

Kousar and her family are very appreciative of Kiva and JWS Pakistan.

name: Parveen
use: to purchase raw materials such as threads, cloth, needles, laces and buttons.
texts:
Parveen is a married lady and lives with her husband in Mandi Bahauddin, Pakistan. She is 35 years old and a tailor by profession.

Parveen started her tailoring business in 2015 and until now she continues to operate it. She is a skillful tailor who brings the best to her clients. She has been able to support her family from this business.

One challenge Parveen often faces is the lack of material to meet her sale orders. With this loan, she will buy materials to make clothes and position her business to offer better services.

Parveen is very grateful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan for their help.

name: Rukhsana Parveen
use: to purchase raw materials including cloths, colorful threads, needles, buttons and laces.
texts:
Rukhsana Parveen is a women entrepreneur and struggling to bring prosperity to her family along with her husband. She is 40 years old and lives in a small house with 7 family members. She is a skilled woman and has adopted clothes making as a source of livelihood. She has around 2 years of experience in clothes designing and stitching.

At the moment she is lacking finance to purchase raw material including cloth, colorful threads, needles, buttons and laces for clothes making. She therefore has requested loan from JWS Pakistan, field partner of KIVA to finance raw material for her business.

She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her business and family.



She is grateful to KIVA & JWS Pakistan for the kind help.

name: Argelio
use: to buy a young cow in order to raise it and later sell it.
texts:
Argelio is a farmer and raises cattle. He also works in construction.

He keeps his cattle at home and is careful about their feed.

He needs a loan to buy a young cow so he can raise it and later sell it. His previous loan from Kiva was for cattle too and he has repaid the debt.

He very much wants to have cattle so his business can grow and earn him more income when he sells the animals.

name: Sylvia
use: to buy a water tank.
texts:
Hello Kiva community! This is Sylvia. She is very hardworking and very passionate about farming. She is a mother of lovely children. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a region known for growing maize and dairy farming.

Sylvia was raised in challenging circumstances. Her basic needs were never covered, so she vowed she would turn her life around and live a comfortable life. That is why she started mixed farming, and she has been farming for the past five years. Through dedication, hard work and commitment, she has been able to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Although she makes some profit, she has the challenge of inadequate water for irrigating her crops and even for her home consumption. Most of the rain water is wasted, and Sylvia wants to harvest that water. That is why she is kindly requesting a loan to buy a water tank.

The Chuka area has no piped water, and this means that you have to travel for long distances in search of “this precious commodity.” But, with the loan, she will be able to store water for home consumption.

The loan will also help Sylvia irrigate her farm. She plans to buy more water tanks so that she can catch as much water as possible.

Sylvia awaits your kindness.

name: Ali
use: to buy a machine for manufacturing boxes for clothes to increase his production and improve his income.
texts:
Ali partnered with his father to start a business. He manufactures boxes for clothes. His father worked once in a factory that made these boxes. So he taught his son the trade and together they embarked on a successful business.

Today Ali is very happy with what he accomplished in this business. He is able to pay his dues and also make a profit. This came after hard work and constant modernization of his work. He bought a couple of machines to increase his production and plans to buy another one to meet customer demand.

name: Gilma
use: grow cocoa beans.
texts:
Gilma has made a living growing cocoa beans for a year, which she sells at the school in her community. She uses the profits from this business to cover her children's school expenses.

However, she needs more working capital to buy supplies such as seeds, bags, and fertilizer, among other things, so she is requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC to buy these materials and make a better income to improve the wellbeing of her family.

name: Geraldine
use: to purchase food ingredients and powder juices to use in her business.
texts:
Geraldine, is aged 34, married and they have three children. She owns and manages a food vending business in their village for almost 1 year and earns a net income of PHP 250 daily. Her net income on this business was spent on their daily expenses at home and school allowances of their children.

Due to insufficient capital on her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase food ingredients and powder juices to use her business. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

name: Dilafruz
use: to buy a kitchen set.
texts:
Dilafruz is a 25-year-old young woman. She is unmarried.

Dilafruz lives poorly, with her parent. She has been busy sewing national women's dresses for more than five years. She provides services to her clients in her house. She tries to create high quality goods to attract more clients. She uses her income from her business to provide for her parent and herself with all necessary things.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a kitchen set for her household.

She awaits your support and thanks you in advance.

name: Khumorbi
use: to pay for her son's university tuition.
texts:
Khumorbi is hard-working woman. She is from the Dushanbe town. Khumorbi is married and is the mother of 4 children. They are 21, 17 and 13 years old. The youngest son became a student this year. For three years, Humorbi has been engaged in sewing women's clothing. Her husband is a teacher at the Lyceum.

Khumorbi applied for a loan because she needs to pay her son's university tuition. With this in mind she requests a loan. You can help Khumorbi!

name: Santhi
use: to fund a water connection to be installed at her home.
texts:
Santhi’s family resides in Tiruchirappalli district, Tamil Nadu. Her family is one of the thousands impacted by the water crisis in India. They have no water connection in their home. Like most households around them, they rely on water from the public tap in the village. Situated a long walk away from their home, the tap runs only a few hours each day. Often, after spending the morning in a queue, Santhi is unable to get sufficient water for her family’s needs. With insufficient water to drink and practice hygiene, they run the risk of frequent illness.

Now, Santhi has a chance to bring water in her home. Through Guardian, Milaap’s partner in the region, she can install a water connection right in her home. Hence, she has applied for a loan of INR 10,000 from Guardian. Your loan will help Santhi and her family access clean drinking water, resulting in better health, productivity, and savings. This will be a crucial step for them in improving their living standards and uplifting themselves. Santhi and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Chandra
use: to fund a water connection to be installed at her home.
texts:
Chandra’s family lives in a small village in Tiruchirappalli district in Tamil Nadu. They are one of the thousands impacted by the water crisis in India. They have no water connection in their home. As they don't have a water connection at home, Chandra treks about 1 kilometer daily to get water from the public tap. Families like Chandra’s often enlist their children’s help to fetch the water back home, and the children end up missing school. Often, the water collected is not enough. Due to inadequate water, her family has to compromise on hygiene, and is frequently ill.

Now, Chandra has a chance to bring water in her home. Through Guardian, Milaap’s partner in the region, she can install a water connection right in her home. Hence, she has applied for a loan of INR 7,000 from Guardian. Your loan will help Chandra get relief from carrying heavy water pots every morning. It will help her have extra hours in a day to work and earn more. With adequate water and good hygiene, her family will also enjoy better health and improved savings.

name: Anam
use: to procure stitching inventory such as threads, cloth, laces, buttons, and needles.
texts:
This is Anam, a young lady living in Mandi Bahauddin, Pakistan, with her family. She is a hardworking lady and has been working as a tailor for many years. She is a professional tailor who stitches all types of ladies wear. Her skill in stitching clothes has attracted many clients to her.

Her challenge has been to manage the demand of a growing number of clients. She believes that with this loan, she will buy more materials and threads to stitch clothes as per the demand of clients. This will increase her profit and earnings, which she will use to pay her loan and support her family.

She is very thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan for their assistance.

name: Claudia Veronica
use: to repair a leaking pipe.
texts:
Claudia is a 23-year-old woman, who is single and living with her parents in a place that they rent. She enjoys reading and watching movies, and she likes to help her parents with the household expenses as much as she can.

In order to earn a living, Claudia works for a logistics enterprise. She has been in this line of work for a long time. Claudia is applying for a loan of 8,000.00 MXN which she will be using to repair a leaking pipe in her house.

name: Ana Gaudalupe
use: to buy more perfumes so she can continue selling.
texts:
Ana is 23 years old. She studied through high school and lives with her partner, who is employed. They have a child who is one year old.

Ana sells perfumes and is also a homemaker. She needs a loan to buy more perfumes so she can continue selling.

She wants to continue working for her family’s wellbeing, even more so now that she has a young child.

name: Narine
use: to pay for design supplies for conducting parties (birthdays, baby showers, weddings, etc.) as well as to repair her car to reach her clients more easily.
texts:
Narine, 34, is a designer and a businesswoman. She has a small firm of design and special-occasion arrangement services. Narine organizes birthdays, baby showers, weddings, and other parties. She gets up to 6 orders a month. She loves her job since she is always surrounded by happy people.

Narine wins her daily bread thanks to her job. She lives with her husband, her in-laws, and her son.

Now, Narine has applied for this loan to pay for design supplies for conducting parties (birthdays, baby showers, weddings, etc.) as well as to repair her car to reach her clients more easily. This loan will be so helpful for her business.

name: Ladislao
use: to buy building materials to build a toilet for his home.
texts:
Ladislao is a rice farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He is married and works hard for his family. He always wishes the best for them, including giving them a beautiful home.

He is asking a loan to buy blocks, cement, sand, gravel, coco lumber, bamboo matting, tie wire, and PVC pipes to build a decent toilet.

Ladislao is excited for something new to offer to his family to give them comfort in their daily living. A toilet is very important to him because it promises a cleaner surrounding.

name: Lusine
use: to pay for two dairy cows and hire several workers for soil plowing service.
texts:
Lusine, 37, is an agronomist from Ararat region. She slives there with her husband, her three children, aged 8 (twins) and 12, and takes care of her retired in-laws. Lusine and her hsuabnd run a farm to meet family's basic needs. Lusine's livestock consists of cows, oxen, mother pigs, and piglets. She also grows tomatoes, greens, beans, potatoes. Through harvest and dairies sales, Lusine gathers income essential for her childrens' living.

Now, she has applied for this loan to pay for two dairy cows and hire several workers for soil plowing service. Lusine hopes for the lenders' trust and understanding.

name: Limhi Franco
use: to pay for tuition and fees for his studies.
texts: Limhi is 23 years old. He is single and is currently working in the healthcare system in his town. He is studying nursing and is in the fifth cycle. He will use this new loan to pay the final fees for the fifth cycle and to pay for tuition for the sixth cycle. With this, he will be able to continue studying and working hard without any worries. He is certain that through his hard work and good grades, he will be a great professional and his parents will be proud of him. They are grateful for the trust and support of the Kiva lenders.

name: Sudha
use: to install a water connection at home.
texts:
Sudha is a 28-year-old woman from the Tiruchirappalli district, Tamil Nadu. Like many rural households, her family too has been impacted by the water crisis in India. Like most households around them, they rely on water from the public tap in the village. Situated a long walk away from their home, the tap runs only a few hours each day. Often, after spending the morning in the queue, Sudha is unable to get sufficient water for her family’s needs. With insufficient water to drink and practice hygiene, they run the risk of frequent illness.

Sudha has been trying to change this situation for a long time now. So, Sudha has applied for a loan amount of INR. 10,000 from Guardian, one of Milaap's field partner. Sudha wants to use the loan amount to install water connection in her home. Sudha and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Thenmozhi
use: to install a water connection at home.
texts: Thenmozhi is residing in Tiruchirappalli district, Tamil Nadu. Her family has no water connection in her home. As they don't have a water connection at home, she treks about 1 kilometer daily to get water from the public tap. Families like Thenmozhi’s often enlist their children’s help to fetch the water back home, and the children end up missing school. Often, the water collected is not enough. Due to inadequate water, her family has to compromise on hygiene and is frequently ill.  Thenmozhi has wanted to change this situation for a long time now. Thenmozhi has applied for a loan of INR. 10,000 from Guardian, one of Milaap's field partner. She will use the amount to install water pipeline in her household. Your loan will help her reduce labor to carry water and to practice proper hygiene. Thenmozhi and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Phakdey's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Phakdey’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. He works as a factory worker and also makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Phakdey safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sokun's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Sokun’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Sokun works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sokun safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Maribel
use: to buy agricultural supplies to prepare her cornfield.
texts: Maribel is married, and her 2 children attend school. Maribel works in agriculture. She grows her crops close to her house, and her children help her. She needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies to prepare her cornfield. Her last Kiva loan was used for agriculture, and she repaid her debt punctually. She dreams of having a better quality of life to be more comfortable with her family.

name: Esterlita
use: to purchase empty gallons for water retailing.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

texts: Esterlita was already 68 years old, a widow and has 1 adult son. Even at her age,she still striving to earned a living, so she supplies drinking water in her neighborhood.  She joined GDMPC last 2008,availed many cycles and now she take another loan in the amount of Ten Thousand Pesos Only(php10,000.00) to finance her water retailing.  Esterlita plan to save more money to expand her business.

name: Agnes
use: to buy farming tools and equipment.
texts:
Agnes is a small-holder farmer who is very passionate about farming. She has been engaged in crops, dairy and poultry farming for not less than ten years. Her primary sources of income are maize, milk and eggs. She lives in Kitale area in Kenya.

Agnes developed the urge for farming from her parents, who were maize farmers. She has done remarkable work through farming; she has sent her children to a local private school, the one she recognizes most. Agnes values farming as her core economic activity.

Agnes has been using the same farm tools and equipment over and over for her ten years of farming. Some of her tools are worn out, and she needs a loan so that she can buy new tools and replace the worn ones.

Agnes is confident that her work will be made easier, and her output will increase. She is therefore appealing for Juhudi Kilimo, a partner with KIVA lenders, to lend her some money so that she can increase her profits and pay back her loan.

She is thankful to all her lenders.

name: Nigina
use: to buy cattle and mineral fertilizer for her business.
texts:
The woman in this photo is Nigina. Nigina was born in 1970. She is married and has a daughter. Nigina is a very kind and responsible woman who is always looking out for the well-being of her daughter.

She wants to increase her harvest income for next year. Nigina has seven years of experience in agriculture. She cultivates rice, peppers, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and wheat. Nigina is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS in order to buy fertilizers for her farm and cattle. Also she deals with animal husbandry feed cattle at the barn. She is married to a good man who is very kind to her and he helps with this business.

Nigina is a returning client and has positive credit history. She is applying for a loan for the second time with Kiva’s field partner IMON International. She hopes to reach her goal with the help and support of the lenders.

name: Hussein
use: to buy new items and supplies to further improve his motorcycle repair business.
texts: Hussein is a 22-year-old young man who lives with his family and helps them with their house expenses through his motorcycles repair business, which he established almost 4 years ago. He is a second-time borrower from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua and he wishes to use this loan in order to buy new items and supplies to further improve his business. By contributing to this loan, you would be helping Hussein to build a sustainable and solid business.

name: Samnang's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Samnang’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Samnang works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Samnang safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Jean Baptiste
use: to purchase a sprayer, 10  of Ridomil, and 1 of Lamuta Gold for his cacao crop.
texts:
JEAN BAPTISTE is a 45-year-old man who is married and the father of five. After primary school, he decided to commit himself to the cacao field inherited from his father. Thanks to this field, he manages to meet family needs. So he puts all of his time and energy into maintaining it.

His dream is to have better production. For this, he needs maintenance products on time in order to avoid insects and plant diseases, as well as to clear the land. For these reasons, he is requesting this loan, with which he will be able to pay for a UN sprayer and other plant care products, thus avoiding loan sharks who often take a good part of his production.

The money from his sales will let him expand his plantation, cover his children’s schooling costs, and meet family needs.

name: Gafforhuja
use: to buy more fruit to increase his stock.
texts:
Gafforhuja is a young, cheerful 20-year-old man who lives in a rural area. Gafforhuja is not married and lives with his parents. Since Gafforhuja grew up in a poor family, he wasn't able to receive a suitable education.

Having gradually gained experience, Gafforhuja independently became involved in the purchase and sale of fruits. He trades apple, grapes and other fruits at the local market. At this point in time, Gafforhuja wants to expand his business. He decided to turn to Arvand for financial support to be able to purchase more fruit and increase his sales.

name: Pha's Group
use: to cover farming expenses such as buying seed and fertilizer to grow her crop well.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

texts:
At the age of 32, Pha is a mother of one small child. She is now living with her beloved family in a local village of Banteay Meanchey Province.

To overcome her family’s hardship, she has been growing rice for over 10 years to earn the main income to support her family. Through this business, Pha could save about $5 USD each day for emergency needs.

Drought is the challenge for her nowadays. To save her business, she is now leading this group of three to request this first loan via VisionFund Cambodia.

Pha is willing to manage her loan portion to cover farming expenses such as buying seed and fertilizer to grow her crop well. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income in order to better support her living condition.

name: Walinase
use: to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent so that she can provide financial services to her community.
texts:
Walinase is a young woman who is a student studying Accounting-CIFA. In order to ensure she is able to pay her fees, Walinase has become an entrepreneur.

Walinase provides her community with a safe means of moving around cash within Malawi. Via a mobile transaction, customers can do cash in/cash out transactions while Walinase earns an income. With her business, she will immediately be able to use her accounting knowledge to have proper reconciliation of her day-to-day activities. Walinase appeals to Kiva lenders for her start-up business as she and her family do not have the finances to sustain her business. A loan will help her attain a branded kiosk to trade from and the needed funds to ensure her customers' transactions are processed in a timely manner.

Walinase's business helps create employment and is a means for her to pay for her studies without burdening the family financially.

name: Ahadi Group
use: to stock up on fabrics and rolls of poplin.
texts:
Masika is a tailor who sells sewing supplies at a market in town. The vice-president of the 'banc villageois' called “Ahadi”, she is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima who is 41 years old, married, and the mother of six children, all attending school.

She is going to stock up on fabrics and rolls of poplin to bolster her business. She started her business with capital from her husband 23 years ago. Her wish is to become a wholesaler and to provide an education and food for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

name: Jelimo
use: to buy cereals and sell them in her village.
texts:
Jelimo has been farming for the past nine years. Over this time, she has gathered much knowledge, skills and experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming.

Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Eldoret area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Jelimo could increase her profits by satisfying the demand.

Jelimo believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Jelimo to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children. Jelimo and her whole family are very grateful for your understanding and the impact of the loan you will lend to her.

name: Azhar
use: to pay her university tuition for a bachelor's degree in Accounting.
texts:
Azhar is a university student. She is studying Accounting in her junior year. She is 20 years old, and her dad is retired from the military.

Her family doesn't have the money to pay her tuition fees. This is why Azhar is reaching out to pay for her education and not delay her studies.

She is eager to graduate with her friends and to move on in the world and find a good job with a good salary that she can live on. Just like any other student she works hard to earn her grades to finally receive her degree.

name: Zebuniso
use: to buy more fabrics and sewing supplies to sew more dresses for customers and expand her business.
texts:
This is Zebuniso, who lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. Zebuniso is married and has two children. She is 46 years old. Her husband works as a construction foreman in their district.

She has been sewing "kurpa" (traditional bed covers) and "kurpacha" (traditional mattresses) for more than two years. Kurpa are used as comforters and kurpacha are long mattresses used in sofas.

She runs her business out of her home. She says she feels comfortable sewing in her home.

Zebuniso is taking out a loan to buy more fabric. This way she can do more sewing and correspondingly make more money. This will allow her to advance her business to a new level.

Her goal is get a loan to improve and expand her business. Zebuniso plans to attract many customers in the future.

name: Padma
use: to expand her husband's furniture business by purchasing more wood and raw materials.
texts: Padma resides in the South Dinajpur district, West Bengal. She wants to support her husband in his furniture business. Her husband purchases tree wood from the local area, cuts the wood, and makes furniture. Sometimes he sells the rest of the wood to other customers. She has a household size of 6 members and a monthly income of INR 8,500, with savings of INR 4,000. Hence, she wishes to increase the monthly income. Padma has applied for a loan of INR 25,000 from Gram Bikash Kendra, one of Milaap's field partners. Padma and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Amna
use: to buy material for the making of synthetic flowers to sell to increase her income.
texts: Amna is a housewife, but she wanted to make an income. She didn't want to rely on anyone. So she began making synthetic flower arrangements. She filled her time with the hobby and as she became better at it she began to exhibit her work to neighbors and friends. She is ambitious and plans to open a store in the near future. For now, she wants to buy some material needed to make the synthetic flowers. Then she wants to expand with more products such as souvenirs. This will increase her income and bring her closer to opening a store. The area she is from was affected by the war on Syria and the prices soared because traffic was cut off because the borders were shut down. Therefore nothing goes in or comes out.

name: Mary
use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds, to enable her to grow more vegetables.
texts:
Greetings from Kerugoya, Kenya!

Mary is a hardworking farmer from a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Thanks to her daily efforts, she has managed to give her children a good start by providing them with a good quality education.

Mary has a farm where she grows crops and raises livestock; she also earns some income from a personal business. She never had a formal education and is content with the farming lifestyle.

The Kerugoya area is a favorable one for farming, so she is seeking a 40,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo, to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to enable her to grow more vegetables, reap maximum profits, and increase her business.

Being a woman and accessing funds in Kenya, especially around Kerugoya, is very challenging, but Mary feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like herself.

She is always working to improve her family’s living conditions, but her biggest dreams are to become independent and support her family by herself, secure her children’s future, and buy a home.

name: Elvira
use: to buy a packet of sustainable solar products (battery, controller, 4 LED lights) which will reactivate her solar energy system.
texts: Elvira is 60 years old and cultivates beans, coffee, and potatoes to support her household expenses. She lives with her husband Vicente, who also is a farmer, and two children, who are her motivation to work hard every day. She wants to be able to leave them a good inheritance and a better quality of life. Unfortunately the community of Intibuca, Honduras - where they live - does not have access to electricity service.  Because of this she acquired a solar electricity system awhile back. This allows her to eliminate the use of candles or kerosene lamps, which are harmful to one's health. The solar electricity system also facilitates housework at night, and her children can do their homework for school. With the weather, some of the components were damaged. For these reasons Elivra is aking for a loan from Soluz Honduras to buy a packet of sustainable solar products (battery, controller, 4 LED lights) which will reactivate her solar electricity system and to once again enjoy the benefits of solar energy.

name: Delia Emilia
use: to continue and finish her studies in Industrial Management.
texts:
Delia Emilia is the oldest of 4 children. She lives in the town of Huarura situated to the north of Lima together with her siblings and her mother, who makes a living from farming. She is the only child in higher education. She is studying for a degree in industrial management and has a year and half to go. She explains that she chose this degree given that there are several areas in which she can work and there is a high demand for work.

On finishing her degree she is thinking of working for a company which exports asparagus. She explains that she became pregnant when leaving high school, and for this reason she spent her time looking after her daughter. However, this did not prevent her from following her dream of becoming a professional, of having her own business and through this, the desired job and financial stability.

Unfortunately, financial problems forced her to leave her studies for a year. However, her desire to improve herself remains unaffected, given that her daughter has become her greatest motivation.

For this reason, she has turned to Kiva to ask for support through an education loan, which will provide her with the peace of mind to focus on her career.

"Thanks to you, I will not have to stop studying. I am happy to know that there are people who invest in education and help many young people achieve their dreams".

name: Lovell
use: to buy canned goods, personal care products, and snack foods to sell.
texts:
Lovell is 49 years old and married with three children. All of her children are still in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lovell runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, personal care products, and snack foods to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Lovell would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Genoviva
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, spices and other snack foods.
texts: Genoviva is 44 years old, married with one child.  Genoviva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, spices and other snack foods.  Genoviva has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Genoviva aspires to save money to expand her business.

name: Leah
use: to purchase fried fish, maize flour, cooking fat, and baking flour for her hotel.
texts:
Leah is 44 years old and married, with 3 children. She has had a food business for 4 years, selling food in her community, earning KES 150,000.

This is her second borrowing with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase fried fish, maize flour, cooking fat, and baking flour for her hotel.

With the anticipated profit, she will be able to pay the school fee for her children and provide sufficient drinking water for the family.

Her hopes and dreams for the future include venturing in new income-generating projects and improving the living standards of her family.

name: Jane
use: to purchase additional stock of household products such as washing powder, cooking oil, toothpaste, shoe polish, and cereals for resale.
texts:
Jane is 28 years old, single, and blessed with one child.

She sells food at her cafe, a business she has done for several years.

She has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase additional stock of household products for sale like washing powder, cooking oil, toothpaste, shoe polish, and cereals for resale.

With the anticipated income, she will be able to improve her standard of living and pay the school fee for her child.

Her hope and dream is to live a successful life together with her family.

name: Kipruto
use: to purchase more stock, like sugar, flour, snacks and milk, for sale to the customers.
texts:
Kipruto is 38 years old. He is married with six children.

He has had a retail shop business for two years.

He will be using the loan to purchase more stock, like sugar, flour, snacks and milk, for sale to the customers.

With the anticipated income, Kipruto will be able to open a wholesaler so that he can satisfy his customers' needs.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children at a higher level and improve their living standards.

name: Oraly Shania
use: pay university tuition installments.
texts:
Oraly Shania is 18 years old and single. She is a student getting a degree in industrial engineering. She chose this major because she considers it to be the most complete, encompassing some elements of other majors, and she can use her skills to work in a variety of companies afterwards.

She started studying 2 years ago and has 3 years to go before finishing. It would help her very much if she could work for a textile firm or food producer after finishing her degree.

The loan will go towards paying for university tuition installments so that she can continue taking classes without worrying about owing money for tuition.

name: Yorn's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: The members of Yorn’s Group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province, Cambodia. Yorn works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Yorn safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sakorn's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Sakorn’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Sakorn works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sakorn safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Vibian
use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.
texts:
Vibian is a mother from the rural Eldoret area in the Rift valley of Kenya. She is a determined woman who wants a bright future for her children. She and her husband work on their farm and practice mixed farming to afford a decent lifestyle for their lovely children. Vibian decided to start mixed farming with the hope of giving her family a better quality of life.

Vibian is seeking a loan of 35,000 KES to buy seeds and start horticultural farming on her farm. She is a wise woman who wants to reap more profits by taking advantage of her area's favorable weather patterns, the good road network in her village, good soil, and a ready market for horticultural products.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva to help hardworking women like Vibian make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Please help this woman, who has dreams and goals to achieve.

Your loan will help a rural couple to develop their farming business and secure their family's future.

name: Men's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Men’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Men works as a factory worker, seller and makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Men safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Carmen Ricardina
use: to maintain her avocado crop in order to have a more productive harvest.
texts: Carmen is a hardworking 65-year-old woman. She lives alongside her 2 children in the area of Colohuache, which is located in Moquegua. She works as a farmer and she likes to grow tropical fruits with seeds and skins. She grows them on her land. She is asking for a microloan to maintain her avocado crop in order to have a more productive harvest. Carmen hopes in the future to be able to improve her house so than her children can live comfortably and to keep enjoying good health.

name: Marielita
use: start a business selling clothing for women, men, and children, taking advantage of the father's day season.
texts:
Merielita is 30 years old and has lived in the residential area of Santa Clara, Jaén, Perú for 4 years. Marielita it the mother of 2 beautiful daughters. She currently does social work selling clothing part time. She works with her husband who helps her support the family. She used her savings from work to start the clothing business.

She has had a small business in a rented space for 2 years where she sells clothing for women, children, and men. This is how she has moved her family forwards and now her dream is to expand her clothing sales business and have her own home for the wellbeing of her family.

This is her first loan from Norandino and she is thankful that they have given her the opportunity to show that she is a responsible woman.

name: Judith
use: to buy cement, blocks, a toilet bowl, GI sheets, PVC pipe, PVC elbow and nails.
texts:
Judith is a woman married to a fisherman. They have three children together. To help him, she sell snacks to earn an income.

Aside from looking after her children, Judith is also worried about her home not having a decent toilet to use. She is asking for a loan to buy cement, blocks, a toilet bowl, GI sheets, PVC pipe, PVC elbow and nails. By having a concrete toilet, Judith can be assured of a healthier family and clean surroundings.

name: Mona
use: to buy more cosmetic products so that she can offer greater variety to her customers.
texts:
Mona is a 29-year-old Lebanese married woman and mother of three school-age children. Her husband is the main income provider for their family. He is a soldier in the Lebanese army, but his income is not enough due to the bad circumstances in the country. In addition, school fees for their children are very expensive.

Mona decided to help her husband by starting her own business of selling cosmetics such as perfumes, crémes, accessories, and other items. She offers good-quality products to her customers at fair prices. Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner Vitas so that she can continue investing in her business and increasing her inventory of merchandise. She says this loan will help her to purchase all the needed products to offer greater variety to her customers.

name: Phally
use: to buy cashews to cultivate on her land.
texts:
Phally is 31 years old. She is a worker who is working for a rubber plantation. Currently, she is living in the Chamkar Leu District, Kampong Cham Province with her husband and one child. Her husband is also working in this career. They are making a net salary of about USD 350.00 per month.

This season, Phally wants to cultivate some cashews on her land in addition to her current job. Due to the demand of capital, she and her husband decided to request a loan from Kiva via HKL to buy some cashews to cultivate on her land. This first loan cycle will help her to increase their net profits and help to improve her standard of living. In the future, she wants to have a nicer house than now and buy more farmland. She would like to say thanks to all lenders for their kindness in sharing their funds to all the poor people in the world.

name: Gulchehra
use: to purchase rice seeds and mineral fertilizers to increase the crop yield on her farm.
texts:
This friendly and cheerful woman is Gulchehra. She was born and raised in the Nisiri Khusrav region. She is a loving wife and a devoted mother of three children. Gulchehra works in agriculture to earn a living and raise her child.

Gulchehra loves her work and is happy that she can have her own income. Despite the fact that she does not have a higher education, she has achieved a lot on her own. Currently Gulchehra is preparing the soil for planting a new harvest and for this reason she applied for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and rice seeds. Gulchehra relies on your support!

name: Zeddy
use: to purchase stock for her grocery store.
texts: Zeddy is 22 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She has recently started a business, and she will use her loan to buy more stock to earn more income. She will use her income to improve her living standards and pay school fees for her child.

name: Oun's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Oun’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Oun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Oun safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Stellamaris Mutindi
use: to buy new clothes for sale.
texts:
Stellamaris is 47 years old and is blessed with 2 children. She has a boutique where she sell clothes and she likes her job.

Over the years Stellamaris has come to know her customers needs and she meets their desires accordingly. To expand her fast growing business, she is requesting a loan to buy new clothes to sell.

Stellamaris will increase her business profit which will be used to pay her loan quickly. Her dream is to be a great business woman.

name: Lilian Margarita
use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.
texts: Lilian, 50 years old, is a widowed mother who lives with her daughter in the area of La Esperanza, Intibuca. She plants and sells coffee. She has her own land where she has grown excellent quality coffee for the past 8 years. She is asking for her first loan in the sum of 20,000 Lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer for her crops. This will help to increase her production in order to grow her earnings. Her goal is to increase the area of land she cultivates and to increase her earnings to give her family a better quality of life.

name: Mayssam
use: to buy a tattoo machine to better satisfy her customers' demands.
texts: Mayssam is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. She works in the beauty care domain specializing in make up and tattoos to cover her family's needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a tattoo machine to better satisfy her customers' demands. She hopes to open her own salon in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

name: Abigail
use: repair a home.
texts:
Abigail wants to repair her home and offer her daughter a more comfortable and pleasant place to live.

In order to do so, she is requesting a loan of a million colones, which she will use to buy materials and pay for the labor necessary for the repairs.

name: Hassan
use: to cover expenses needed for his dental treatment.
texts:
Hassan is a 39-year-old married father of two who is a previous borrower from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. This is his 5th cycle of loan borrowing from the association.

Hassan started his own bakery almost 8 years ago in order to provide for his family. Hassan wishes to use this entrepreneur loan in order to cover expenses needed for his dental treatment.

name: Gulchehra
use: to pay her daughter's tuition for a degree to become a teacher and provide education to more Tajik children.
texts:
This woman is Gulchehra, who is 44 years old. She is married and has three children - oll of them daughters. Gulchehra and her children live in the city of Dushanbe. Her daughters attend school and university. Gulchehra's has been in the sewing business for 10 years. She likes her work and her daily income. She earns an income and feeds her family. Gulchehra' is a very hardworking and joyful woman.

She is currently requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's education. She is studying to become a teacher and without this payment, her daughter will be expelled from her university. Gulchehra' really needs your support. She trusts in you and your support.

name: Sylvie Haingo Tiana
use: to buy lipstick, nail polish and perfume to resell.
texts:
Haingo is a 29-year-old widow. She has two children who are both in school. In order to pay her family's expenses, Haingo has to work hard.

As a source of revenue, she has been selling costmetic products since 2005. Her business is going well but in order to attract more customers and follow market trends, she needs to offer a diverse range of products--which is why she is asking for this loan. The loan will allow her to buy lipstick, nail polish and perfumes.

Her priority is her children's success in school.

name: Geeta
use: to expand her weaving business by selling more hand-woven saris, towels etc.
texts:
Geeta, a 28-year-old married woman from the Balangir district, Odisha. She is engaged in a weaving business to make and sell saris, towels etc. She has a household of 4 members and a monthly income of INR. 7,000.

She wants to expand her weaving business by purchasing raw materials like threads, cloth etc. She has applied for a loan of INR. 25,000 from Mahashakti Foundation, one of Milaap's field partners.

Geeta and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Bol's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Bol’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Bol works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Bol safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Yen's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Yen’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Yen makes a living cultivating rice and she works as a farmer to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Yen safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Jhon Neyser
use: to continue and finish his degree in graphic design.
texts:
Jhon is the younger of two brothers and lives with his parents in the Cono Norte of Lima. His father is an operator in a factory and his mother works occasionally in artwork.

Jhon is currently in his third semester studying graphic design. He mentions that he chose this specialty because he has a talent in graphic art, which he inherited from his mother. He will finish his studies in only two more years.

Currently, his family is going through some financial difficulties, and the income they generate only covers their basic needs. For this reason, Jhon left school last semester to work and help his parents support the family. He knows that the only way to leave this situation is to keep going to school and to put in his greatest effort.

He does not want to drop out of school, and so he has turned to Kiva for the support of a student loan. He is very excited and grateful since with this loan he will not have to leave school again due to lack of resources, and will fulfill his dreams of finishing his degree and starting his own publicity and graphic art company.

Jhon sends this message: "I thank the people with great heart who are trusting me, and I promise them that I will put in my biggest effort to become a great professional."

name: Merlinda Maggi
use: to buy chicken feed in order to feed and sell them.
texts:
Merlinda is a hard-working 45-year-old woman. She lives with her partner in San Francisco, which is located in Moquegua. She makes a living by raising and breeding poultry.

She is requesting a microloan to buy chicken feed in order to feed and ultimately sell them. Merlinda hopes in the future to improve her home in order to live comfortably and maintain good health.

name: Sabina Sonia
use: to buy fertilizer in order to have a more productive potato harvest.
texts:
Sabina is a hardworking, 24-year-old woman. She lives with her daughter in the town of Acari, which is located in Arequipa. She works in agriculture and currently has the pleasure of growing potatoes. She is requesting a small loan to buy fertilizer in order to have a more productive potato harvest.

Sabina hopes in the future to improve her house so that her daughter may live comfortably. She also makes a great effort to have a promising harvest and to be known for the quality of her crop.

name: Kamsort's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Kamsort’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Kamsort works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Kamsort safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Seurn's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Seurn’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Seurn makes a living cultivating rice and she works as a factory worker to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Seurn safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Lean's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Lean’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom  Province in Cambodia. Lean makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In HER village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Lean safeguard the health of HER family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Dobrila
use: to renovate the bathroom of her house because it has been a very long time since it was renovated last.
texts: Dobrila is a sweet 64 year old woman who lives with her husband and her son. She is a very hardworking woman who always does her best to take care of her family. She and her husband are now retired and they are enjoying their life in retirement. They now spend most of their time working in their land planting different crops to cover their expenses. They also receive a decent pension and that is their only source of income. Dobrila has requested a loan to renovate the bathroom of her house because it has been a very long time since it was renovated last. She wants to have a cleaner and a healthy home to live. She wants to improve the living conditions for her family. She and her husband are very thankful for the support!

name: Mao's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.
texts: The members of Mao’s Group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Mao safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Ce's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Ce’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Ce makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In hervillage there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Ce safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sreymao's Group
use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay a plowing fee which is expected to increase productivity of her crop yield.
texts:
A 32-year-old mother of three dependent children, Sreymao lives in a local village of Kouk Khmum commune, Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. Growing rice and working as a paid worker have been the main sources of her family’s income for many years. Since the rice crop has been threatened by insects and drought, she could not gain as much income as before.

This will be the second loan cycle for her with VisionFund Cambodia. Sreymao is willing to manage her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay a plowing fee which is expected to increase productivity of her crop yield. She believes that this supportive loan will help her to grow her crop well and return her more income.

name: Ann
use: to pay for farm inputs and hired labour in order to grow more crops on her horticultural farm.
texts:
Hello lenders! Meet Ann (pictured in her house above), a smallholder farmer from a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She’s a happily married woman who has beautiful children who have transformed her life to a better one.

Ann started farming five years ago on a small plot she acquired. On the farm she has dairy cows and a small garden.

Ann is seeking a KES 40,000 loan, which she will use to pay for farm inputs and hired labour in order to grow more crops on the horticultural farm. It takes a lot for a smallholder farmer to risk limited resources to expand a farm business.

With your help, Ann will be able to settle the high cost of farm inputs necessary for expansion. A significant portion of the profit will be reinvested into the business to fuel growth.
