Ann dreams of being able to give her children an excellent education so that they grow up to be amazing professionals, and also, she dreams of buying a house where she will live with her family.

Support this loving mother and lend now.

name: Soeurn's Group
use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to support his farming.
texts:
Soeurn is 42 years old and a father of three children, one of whom is in school while the other two are too young for school. Growing rice and working as a paid worker have been the main sources of his family’s income for ten years. Through these businesses, he is able to earn about 8 USD per day and he is able to save about 4 USD each day for future needs.

Drought is the main challenge for Soeurn these days. To save his business, he is now leading this group, which consists of two members, to request a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to support his farming. This will be the fourth loan cycle for him with VisionFund. He hopes this supportive loan will help him to increase his crop yield and earn him more income to save for future needs.

name: Jose Alfredo
use: to buy agricultural inputs to plant basic grains.
texts:
José is 31 years old. He studied until 4th grade. He is married and his partner is a housewife. They have two small children.

José has made a living in agriculture for 20 years. He learned this work thanks to his parents. He also works as a day laborer in a corn cooperative in his community. The plot of land where he farms is 25 minutes from his house on foot. He works from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm.

José is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs to plant basic grains. What he wants most is to improve his home and that his children go to school.

name: Rosalinda
use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.
texts:
Rosalinda is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalinda has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Maria Lina
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts: Maria Lina works hard to support her family. Maria Lina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Maria Lina has been in this business for 5 years now.  In the future, Maria Lina would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Rhea
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts: Rhea is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhea is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.  Rhea has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rhea requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.  Rhea has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Rhea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Ma.theresa
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts: Ma.Theresa is 27 years old, married and has three children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Theresa requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.  Ma.Theresa has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Ma.Theresa would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

name: Roxana De Los Ángeles
use: to buy animals and supplies.
texts:
Roxana has made a living from raising cattle for approximately 15 years. She buys the calves and tends to them so that they grow to be healthy and then sells them at cattle markets or through other means.Her two children are also dependent on this activity.

With a view to increasing her business, she is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 Costa Rican Colones in order to buy five calves and the necessary supplies to raise them.

name: Maksuda
use: to buy cattle for her animal sales business.
texts:
This energetic woman with the beautiful name of Maksuda lives in Dangara, Tajikistan. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children.

Maksuda deals in farming and animal husbandry. She has been working in cattle breeding for more than two years and is in this field to this day. She likes to take care of cattle as her craft because she is very fond of animals.

Maksuda is now preparing to buy cattle for her animal sales business. She can expand her business this way, but she needs to take out a loan in order to do so. She is relying on your help in this endeavor by asking for a loan for the first time through Kiva’s field partner IMON.

name: Chantha's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Chantha’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Chantha works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Chantha safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Marija
use: to renovate her bathroom, to change the tiles and other appliances because the old ones are corroded.
texts:
Marija is a 23 years old and comes from the Serb minority community. She lives with her husband and her 1 year old child. She is a very caring young mother trying her best to look after her child and keep her safe and healthy. Her husband is the only one who works in her family and he does odd jobs, mainly in construction. She and her husband also receive a social assistance and this hers them provide for the family.

Marija has applied for a small loan to renovate her bathroom, to change the tiles and other appliances because the old ones are corroded. She wants to improve her family’s welfare and wants to raise her child in a healthy home. She is very grateful for the help from all the lenders!

name: Sokkheng's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Sokkheng’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Sokkheng works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sokkheng safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Dina Esmeralda
use: to buy four pigs to fatten and sell them at a good price.
texts:
Dina is 38 years old. She is married and her partner is a mechanic. They have four children who are in school.

Dina has made a living raising farmyard animals like pigs and hens for 20 years. She also grows corn, and the plots are 35 minutes away from her house on motorcycle. She gets up at 5:00 am to do housework, then takes care of her animals and works in the corn field.

She needs a loan to buy four pigs to fatten and sell them at a good price.

Dina hopes that her children study at university since she did not have that opportunity.

name: Ludy
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.
texts: Ludy is 51 years old and married with two children, one child in school, Ludy works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .  Ludy has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future Ludy would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

name: Rebecca
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts: As a married parent of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from crab meat vending.  Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.  Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Rowena
use: to buy fishing nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts:
Rowena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Rowena has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Yobes
use: to buy more stock of wine, beer and soda.
texts:
Yobes is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be creative. He operates a retail business where he sells beer, wine and soda. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of wine, beer and soda. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

name: Alma
use: to buy materials to build a new toilet.
texts: Alma is hails from Ubay, Bohol. She is 32 years old with three children aged 7-12. Alma's family live in a small and humble home. She is worried because her toilet is not yet made from concrete materials. She is asking a loan to buy materials for renovation. It will be used for sand, cement, blocks, lumber, nails, GI sheets, steel bar and bamboo matting. Alma shared that she believed having a clean surroundings can help keeping her family healthy.

name: Lorena
use: to purchase additional pigs, feed, and assorted groceries for the store.
texts:
Lorena is a married woman from Carcar City. Her income relies on the sale of basic commodities and also raising hogs. Her husband works abroad to help defray the family's daily expenses.

This time, Lorena would like to continue to boost both of her sources of income. To do so, Lorena has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase additional pigs, feed, and assorted groceries for the store.

In the future, Lorena is looking forward to continuing to strive hard to generate more stable income that she will use to support her family.

name: Iman
use: to pay her child's university tuition fees majoring in Medicine.
texts:
Iman, 51, is a married woman, the mother of two children. She makes and sells handmade souvenirs and antiques. She is well known in the region for her special talent in her business and her good communications skills.

Iman is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay her child's university tuition fees majoring in Medicine. She dreams of moving it to other premises in the future, in order to attract more customers, which will be a very important step forward.

name: Mirzokhid
use: to pay for his tuition to get a degree in finance.
texts: This is Mirzokhid. He is from Nosiri Khusrav district. Mirzokhid is a young unmarried man who is 22 years old. He is a student and is currently studying in the capital at the Institute of Finance and Economics. He is studying with diligence and with great interest. Unfortunately, he will not be able to continue his studies unless he pays an annual tuition. For this reason, Mirzokhid asks for a loan. His hope is in you, dear Kiva lenders.

name: Vique Eliance
use: to pay for a bale of jackets and a bale of used quilts.
texts:
Vique says thank you for the loan you accorded her the last time. The loan enabled her to add to the secondhand clothing at her sales outlet. Her daily sales figures have experienced a slight increase. The revenues earned from this loan allowed her to cover the main household expenses and to invest in home improvements.

Vique would like to develop her business further. For this winter season, jackets and quilts are selling well, thus the request for a second loan for supplies.

name: Paradiso Group
use: to stock up on hair extensions and some thread for her salon with the aim of growing her business and providing her children an education.
texts:
This client, Jeanette, is the owner of a hair salon in her home on the main road in town. The president of the 'banc villageois' called “Paradiso”, she is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima who is 28, married, and the mother of four children, of whom three are in school.

She is going to stock up on hair extensions and some thread to bolster her business. She started her business with capital from her husband ten years ago.

Her wish is to grow her business and to provide an education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs. It should be noted that certain clients are carrying their babies.

name: Santos Simón
use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and poisons to grow basic grains.
texts:
Santos studied until 9th grade. He is married. His partner is a housewife and they have 3 children.

Santos has made a living farming corn and beans for 31 years. He learned this occupation from his father. When he got married, he decided to continue doing this job to support his family. His work day begins at 6:00 in the morning and ends at 2:00 in the afternoon.

The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, and poisons to grow basic grains.

His dream is to have his own home and continue helping his family through his work.

name: Milagros Giovana
use: to buy construction materials in order to provide her family with a safe home.
texts:
Milagros is a hardworking, 30-year-old woman. She lives with her 3 children and her partner in the town of Huanca, which is located in Arequipa. She works selling groceries in her store, which she managed to open with great effort. She is requesting a small loan so she can buy construction materials to provide her family with a safe home.

Milagros hopes that in the future she can improve her family's quality of life. She also makes an great effort so that her children receive a good education and become principled people.

name: Andrea
use: to buy more crab meat to sell.
texts: Andria is a married woman with  six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Andria has a crab meat vending business in the Philippines. Andria requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crab meat to sell.  Andria has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Andria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Jessica
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts: Jessica is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 45 years old and has seven children who are in school.  Jessica  has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jessica  requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.  Jessica  has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Jessica  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Jiji
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts: Jiji is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jiji is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.  Jiji has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jiji requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.  Jiji has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jiji would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Minalie
use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Minalie is a 33-year-old married woman and has three children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Minalie requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 7 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Minalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Tahminahon
use: to sell fresh fruit, start a new business and bring in income for her family.
texts: This  woman name is Tahminahon. She is 39 years old and lives with her family in the district of Isfara. Before Tahminahon sold products in a store, but unfortunately it was not a good business for her. Therefore, Tahminahon wants to open a new business. She wants to take a loan and engage in the purchase and sale of fruit, because now is the season of fruits and she can make a good profit from it. Tahminahon's son helps her. Her main problem is that she does not have money. Tahminahon looks forward to your help and promises that in the future she will repay her loan on time.

name: Ly
use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farmland to produce more yield.

location.town: Prey Veng province, Kanh Chreach district

texts:
Aged 42 years, Ly is married and lives with her family in a rural village of Prey Veng province. She is a mother blessed with three children. For the last two years, she has been growing rice as the main source of income for her family condition. The main challenge of her rice farming to grow well is lack of water.

Ly is with VisionFund for this cycle and she will manage her loan to buy more fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farmland to produce good yield. She hopes this loan will enable her to get higher yield and earn more income so as to have a better standard of living.

name: Mary Anyango
use: she wants to buy more fish to expand her business and increase her income.
texts:
Mary is a married lady and she is blessed with children who are schooling. She has been selling fish for many years and she has had a good rapport with her customers over time.

To grow her business, she is requesting for a loan to buy more fish. She will increase her business and profit which she will use to pay her loan in a short period of time. Her dream is to meet all the needs of her customers.

name: Ann's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Ann’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom  Province in Cambodia. Ann makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In HER village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Ann safeguard the health of HER family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Yan's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: Yan’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom  Province in Cambodia. Yan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Yan safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sandra Marcela
use: to purchase a tent because she cannot conduct her business when it rains.  She will also purchase tables and stainless steel display cases.
texts:
Sandra is a 25 year old young woman, and the mother of two children; the older one is seven and the younger one is four. She lives with her partner in the city of Argelia, where she has her food sales business, an activity born from financial need that has greatly helped her improve her family’s quality of life.

She comes to the Kiva community requesting financial support to purchase a tent because she cannot conduct her business when it rains. She will also purchase tables and stainless steel display cases, and the remainder will be designated for supplies to make fast food meals.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: María Luisa Bartola
use: to buy agricultural supplies for sowing basic grains.
texts:
María went to school until high school. She is married and appears in the photo with her husband. Her husband works in agriculture and they have 3 children who do not live with them.

María has worked with her husband in agriculture for over 22 years, which has taught her much about the work. She has another source of income, which comes from lending the services of a mill. She walks to where she farms because it is nearby.

She needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies to sow basic grains.

María dreams of being able to produce more basic grains, thereby earning better income. She also hopes to improve her milling business in order to keep offering its services.

name: Ana Balbina
use: to buy a new oven for preparing the corn-based snacks, and to buy metal sheets to improve the shop where she sells.
texts:
Ana is 37 years old. She is in a relationship and her partner works in fishing. They have 3 children who go to school.

Ana has a small business on the perimeter of her house. For 10 years she has sold corn-based snacks and sweets. She gets up every day at 5 a.m. to make preparations for selling, and finishes her work at 5 p.m.

Ana needs a loan to buy a new oven for preparing the corn-based snacks, and to buy metal sheets to improve the shop where she sells.

She dreams that her children have a better life, since it is difficult to move ahead without a profession.

name: Alpha Group
use: to stock up with beans, cassava, rice, and palm oil.
texts:
This client, Micheline, is a woman who sells food provisions in her home on an avenue in town. The president of the 'banc villageois' called “Alpha”, she is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima who is 55, married, and the mother of seven children, of whom three are in school, and four are no longer in school.

She is going to stock up on bean, cassava, rice, and palm oil to bolster her business. She started her business with capital from her husband fifteen years ago. Her wish is to build a house to rent out and to provide an education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

name: Guadalupe
use: to purchase additional spices to sell.
texts: Guadalupe works hard to support her family. Guadalupe is married and has a buy and sell food spices business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spicies to sell.  Guadalupe has been in this business for 3 years now.  In the future, Guadalupe would like to repair and renovate her family home.

name: Ma. Analyn
use: to buy more coconuts to sell.
texts:
Ma. Analyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Analyn is 37 years old and has six children who are in school.

Ma. Analyn has a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines. Ma. Analyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconut to sell.

Ma. Analyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Jessie
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Jessie is 27 years old, married and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jessie requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jessie has been pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jessie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

name: Lilita
use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.
texts:
Lilita is 51 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming tobacco in the Philippines. Lilita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilita has been farming tobacco for five years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Vinh
use: to purchase farming tools.

location.town: thôn 2  quảng bình quảng xương thanh hóa

texts:
Vinh is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture for more than ten years. Vinh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and her job is unstable.

In 2016, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Vinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community and is the leader of her solidarity group.

The main hardship that Vinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase farming tools. With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

Thiếu vốn đầu tư mua máy móc nông nghiệp

name: Mahliyo
use: to pay for her treatment at the medical clinic.
texts: Mahliyo, pictured here, is a very kind and responsible woman. She was born in 1978, is married, and has two daughters. Her husband's income is not large: he deals with buying and selling cattle. Mahliyo helps her husband with this business.  The main income of her family is from animal sales business. Mahliyo works hard to provide her family with necessary things. Sadly, she has become ill and needs treatment. She doesn’t have money to buy the needed medicine. She needs Kiva lenders' support and mercy.   She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS for her treatment. Mahliyo is a returning client and has a positive credit history. She is requesting a loan for the second time through Kiva’s field partner IMON International.

name: Pinki
use: to expand weaving business by purchasing more raw materials like thread and make more saris.
texts: Pinki is a 25-year-old married woman residing in the Nadia district of West Bengal. She wants to support her husband to make saris and sell them. Her husband collects raw thread from the market, makes the thread into the finished material and fits the threads in to a tana (a part of handloom machine) and makes saris. She has a household size of 4 members and a monthly income of INR. 8,500 with savings of INR. 4,500 monthly hence wishes to increase her monthly income. The loan amount of INR. 25,000 from Gram Bikash Kendra, a field partner of Milaap, will help her to support her husband to make and sell more saris in the local market.

name: Maria Cristina
use: to buy fleece fabrics, plush fabrics, felt cloth, zippers, and key chains to assemble different products which she sells from her stall.
texts:
Maria Cristina is a single parent of two children aged 8 and 10. Maria Cristina can rely only on herself to support the needs of her children for everything, including education.

To earn a living, Maria Cristina has ventured into selling in-season items that include hats, slippers, bags, blankets, and other novelty items. She saw how fast these items could be sold, so Maria Cristina thought of manufacturing her own products to include character-inspired hats, stuffed toys as key chain accessories, face masks, and blankets. This has been her business for the last 5 years.

Maria Cristina is requesting a PhP 21,000 loan to buy fleece fabrics, plush fabrics, felt cloth, zippers, and key chains to assemble different products which she sells from her stall. Maria Cristina is hopeful that these additional materials will help her distribute her products to other stalls as well, and in so doing, she will be able to earn and continuously support her two children.

name: Sokry's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: Sokry’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Sokry works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sokry safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: María Irma
use: to buy potatoes, cabbages, bananas, oil, condiments, drinks, etc. to sell traditional food.
texts:
María studied until 6th grade in school. She is married and her spouse is a farmer. Two of their children live at home.

María sells hot and cold drinks and traditional foods. She has been in this business for approximately two years. She travels approximately 2 km to arrive at her place of work. She sells from 2:00 to 6:00 pm.

María needs support from a loan to buy potatoes, cabbage, bananas, oil, condiments, etc. to sell traditional foods. In addition, she will buy drinks.

She hopes to have a strong business and to have larger sources of income so that her family can enjoy a better life.

name: Heriknaz
use: to buy a mini truck in order to easier deliver the harvest to the marketplace.
texts:
Heriknaz, 46, is a farmer from Tavush conflict zone. She stays there with her husband Varuzhan, 51, and son Erick, 13. Alongside with her husband, Heriknaz runs a farm for the family's daily living. She keeps 4 cows, and cultivates potatoes, apples, plums, hazelnuts, cornels, and grape vines. Heriknaz and Varuzhan deliver the harvest to the nearby marketplaces. However, they are unable to reach farther markets because of high transportation expenses.

So, Heriknaz has applied for this loan to buy a mini truck in order to easier deliver the harvest to the marketplace. She do hopes for the lenders' help and consideration since this purchase will have a lasting impact on her farming business.

name: Elinetha
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.
texts: Elinetha is 40 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .  Elinetha has been in this business for 25 years.  In the future Elinetha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

name: Gaudenzia
use: to purchase more stock of drugs to sell so that the generated income will help her pay her children's school fees.
texts:
Gaudenzia is 40 years old. She is married with five children.

She has had a pharmacy business for the past 17 years.

She will be using the loan to purchase more stock of drugs for sale and hopes to use the generated income to help her pay her children's school fees.

With the anticipated income, Gaudenzia will be able to repay her loan and restock her pharmacy.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to build a good house and buy a car.

name: Salve
use: to invest in materials like pandan leaves.
texts:
Salve is an industrious woman and a mother of two young children. To support her family, she engages in a basket weaving livelihood.

Her partner-in-life works as farm maintenance to help defray the family's daily expenses.

This time, she would like to grab the opportunity to cater to the high demand, but the challenge is a lack of capital to finance the current project.

That is why Salve applied a loan, which was used to invest in materials like pandan leaves. These funds will increase her production, thus she will be able to gain a higher yield.

name: Ana Isabel
use: to buy tools and materials for making furniture.
texts: One year ago, Ana started her business making wooden furniture with the goal of generating income for herself and her family. Currently she needs to buy some tools and materials that will enable her to grow her project. She wishes to become a successful businesswoman and grow professionally. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1.055.000 colones to help her achieve her goals.

name: Munira
use: to buy more children's clothes for her retail business.
texts: Munira is a very kind and responsible woman. She is 53 years old and married, with three daughters and a son who is a student. She buys and sells children’s clothes, but her income is not enough to support her four children.   In order to provide her family with food and clothes, Munira works hard. She has been working for more than nineteen years in this industry and is now managing her business alone. Her husband's income is not much.  Munira wants to renew her assortment of clothing for the summer season, but she lacks financial support. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 somoni (TJS) with this aim.   Munira is a returning client and has a positive credit history. She is asking for a loan for the second time from Kiva field partner IMON, and she promises to pay back her loan on time. She hopes Kiva lenders support her, as this help is very important to her.

name: Thủy
use: to purchase baby livestock cattle.

location.town: thôn 2 quảng bình quảng xương thanh hóa

texts:
Thủy is 54 years old and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than ten years. Thủy lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thủy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future. This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the nhóm 12 thôn 2 quảng bình, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

Thiếu vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi

Vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà thịt

name: Jayanti
use: to purchase more hens so she can expand her poultry business.
texts:
Jayanti is a 25-year-old married woman from Balangir district, Odisha. She has a household of 3 members and a monthly income of INR 6500. She is engaged in a poultry business. She purchases hens from the main market and sells them in the local market.

She wants to expand her business, so she has applied for a loan of INR 20,000 from Mahashakti Foundation, one of Milaap's field partners. With this amount, she can purchase more hens to expand her business. Jayanti and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Yan's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Yan’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom, Cambodia. Yan makes a living cultivating rice and she works as a farmer to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Yan safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Lorng's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.
texts:
The members of Lorng’s Group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Lorng makes a living cultivating rice, and he works as a farmer to support his family.

In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Lorng safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Leonarda
use: to purchase a solar-powered freezer system that will improve her grocery store's income.
texts:
Leonarda, 54 years old, is a persistent woman who lives in Intibuca, Honduras. Since she was very young, she has dedicated herself to working to provide for her two daughters, who are now her greatest support.

She makes a living from cultivating potatoes and beans and also has a business selling basic home products. She aspires to boost her business since she likes it a lot owing to that she can connect with many people.

However, owing to that in her community there is no electrical service, Leonarda has found herself limited by not being able to offer her customers products that require freezing, such as meats, lunch meats, and soft drinks.

For this reason, Leonarda has decided to request financing from Soluz Honduras to purchase a solar-powered freezer, which will allow her to have a greater variety of products to provide better attention to her customers and at the same time increase her income.

name: Marcial De Jesús
use: to purchase inputs to cultivate corn and beans.
texts:
Marcial had the opportunity to study until second grade. He is married and his wife is engaged in domestic work.

Her children have already formed their own homes.
Marcial has been engaged in farming all his life. His uncles taught him to work in the field and to this day, he continues cultivating the land. He travels one kilometer on foot to the parcel of land where he cultivates his corn and beans. Generally, he works six hours a day.

Marcial needs a loan to purchase inputs to cultivate corn and beans. His goals are to continue working the land, and cultivate a larger area of land. He will make good use of the profits to live well with his family, and invest in the next crops.

name: María Catalina Del Carmen
use: to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land and plant basic grains.
texts:
María studied until the 6th grade. She is single and lives with three of her four children. Her mother also lives with her.

María has made a living by cultivating maize and beans for several years. She learned this occupation from her former partner. To go to work in her fields, she walks 2 km from her home. Her children help. She begins her day at 6:00 in the morning and finishes at noon.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land and plant basic grains.

María wants to continue cultivating basic grains and with this to be able to support her children with their studies.

name: Divina
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts: Divina is 47 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Divina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Divina has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

name: Emalyn
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.
texts:
Emalyn is 29 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Emalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Emalyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Emalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Juan
use: to buy a heifer and rolls of wire to make improvements to his fence.
texts:
Juan is a farmer who also works in construction. He would like to thank Kiva and MiCrédito for the prior loans he has been granted. Thanks to them, he can buy his agricultural supplies.

Juan is requesting a new loan to buy a heifer and rolls of wire to make improvements to his fence. In the future, Juan hopes to see his children graduate from the university so that they may have better living conditions.

name: Joan
use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, snack food and feed.
texts:
Three years ago Joan started running a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities ranging from noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, soap and beverages. She is a mother of a 9-year-old child. Her partner in life provides taxi transportation services for a living.

She wants to continue to enhance her income, but the problem is the shortage of funds. Therefore, she has decided to join CEVI and wants to use this loan to buy soft drinks, canned goods, snack food and feed.

With your support, Joan could be able to acquire more inventories to be displayed, thus attract more customers. That could augment her earnings and would be able to provide her child with a healthy diet and finance her child's education as well.

name: Rosila
use: to buy blocks, sand, gravel, cement, steel bars, PVC piping, a PVC elbow and a toilet bowl.
texts: Rosila is living in her humble home in Ubay, Bohol. She is married with four children. It was quite a struggle for this mother to live without a decent toilet to use by her family. She is asking a loan to buy blocks, sand, gravel, cement, steel bars, PVC piping, a PVC elbow and a toilet bowl. These are necessary to make improvements on her toilet and make it beautiful. She is committed to paying her loan through the income that she gets from farming rice and hog raising.

name: Sharifmo
use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for her retail outlet to meet customers’ demand.
texts:
This industious woman is Sharifmo. She is 33 year old married woman with four children. Her husband is a home repairmen. Sharifmo is engaged in trading to earn income for her family. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 7 years and really enjoys what she does. Sharifmo is committed to providing high quality goods to her customers.

At present she would like to take a loan from Kiva for her retail outlet. She plans to use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and to expand her business. Sharifmo is greatful for Kiva lenders’ support and is confident about paying off the loan with her hard work!

name: Nemaat
use: to buy modern mobile accessories.
texts: Nemaat is 48, married, and has four children. Her husband is a laborer and she has a small mobile accessories shop. Her husband helps her with the project and they want to buy modern mobile accessories. Nemaat is requesting this loan to buy modern mobile accessories and attract more customers.

name: Yasmin
use: to buy a head of cattle.
texts: Yasmin is 21, married, and has one child. She has a small cattle fattening business and sells dairy products and calves and her husband works as a farmer for land lords. She is requesting this loan to buy a head of cattle to expand the business and increase her sales of dairy products and calves.

name: Khom's Group
use: to renovate her old house to get it better for her family members living.
texts:
Originally from Takeo province, Khom is 40 years old and married. She is the mother of four dependent children, one of whom is still in school and another who is too young. She covers her daily cost of living via rice growing. Moreover, she is working as a construction worker to get more income.

For 22 years, she has been with her farming and it has helped her to keep about 5 USD per day for daily savings. This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund. Khom has managed her past loans wisely to improve her living condition better than before. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to renovate her house to get it better. With this loan, she hopes that she can provide her family members with a nice house to live in.

name: Chanthorn
use: to purchase more rice seed and fertilizer to support her rice farming to increase good yields.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Peam Ror District

texts:
Chanthorn, 31, lives with family members in a village located in Prey Veng province. She is a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is still in school while the other one is still too young.

She struggles for a living via rice cropping and selling grocery items to supplement her income. With her family’s business, she has been engaged in it for ages and it has enabled her to keep up about 3 U.S. dollars per day as her daily savings. The rice’s price has dropped while she got the yield crop from her farming; it is her family’s business challenge.

This is a first-time loan for Chanthorn with VisionFund and she will spend her loan to purchase more rice seed and fertilizer to improve her rice farmland to gain good yields.

She hopes that she can get higher yields with good income, so she can upgrade her living conditions to be better than before.

name: Seurn's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Seurn’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Seurn works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice  to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Seurn safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Juan Carlos
use: to buy a stainless steel stand, a tent, and better burners.
texts:
Juan Carlos is a single, 37-year-old man who works selling fried foods. He is the father of two children who are minors and depend on him financially. He has worked in the streets of Medellín for about 15 years. He is a well known and loved person who comes to the Kiva community today requesting a loan to buy a stainless steel stand, a tent, and better burners. His goal is to increase his production and generate more income in order to increase his quality of life and that of his loved ones.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: María Cándida
use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk, candy, spices, etc.
texts:
María did not have the opportunity to go to school because she helped her mother at work since she was very young. She is married and her husband is a salesman. Her children are adults and work.

María runs a basic goods store from her home. She buys the merchandise in the city and runs the business from 6 in the morning to 7 at night.

Thanks to the prior Kiva loan, she was able to invest in her business and she is about to finish paying off the debt. She needs a new loan to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk, candy, spices, etc. to sell in her store.

She dreams that her business will grow, and she hopes to achieve it with the help of these loans.

name: Liza
use: to buy materials needed in her business.
texts:
Liza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Liza has a souvenir making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed in her business.

Liza has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Gaudencia
use: to buy drums for water storage.
texts:
Gaudencia is a resident woman from Ubay, Bohol.

At her age, she is actively finding ways to earn a living. She sells dried tobacco leaves and she also weaves mats to sell.

For her, it is important to have enough storage for water as she does not have enough time to gather from far away, considering her age of 72. She is asking for a loan to buy more empty drums to fill with water during the rainy season.

Gaudencia finds this very helpful in her daily living as it will lessen her physical exhaustion of gathering water for daily use.

name: Zeina
use: to buy newly released cosmetics and tools to better satisfy her customers' demands.
texts: Zeina is a 19-year-old single lady who works in the beauty care domain from her parents' house to cover her needs and expenses. She gained experience in this domain from college. She is working hard to develop her business and attract more customers. Today, she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy newly released cosmetics and tools to better satisfy her customers' demands. Zeina hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

name: La Union Group
use: to purchase tables and to paint the shop.
texts:
The communal bank “La Unión” is made up of 6 members who are setting out on their second cycle. They have demonstrated themselves to be members who are very responsible and committed to their communal bank.

One of them is Victoria. She is 56 years old and lives with 1 child. She has made a living for more than 2 years from selling juanes, stuffed potatoes, and picadillo soup from a small space set up in her home. She performs the sales at night.

With this small business, little by little she has managed to improve her family’s quality of life. One of Victoria’s dreams is to expand her business and to be able to offer a greater variety of her zone’s traditional dishes.

She will use the loan requested to purchase new tables and to paint her business’s façade.

Victoria is dressed in a black skirt and white blouse with small flowers. Victoria is very happy to be a part of the communal bank “La Unión” and is thankful to the Kiva investors for the support received.

name: Jean Claude
use: to purchase various products for his hair salon, including shampoo, hair masks, and rinses.
texts:
Claude is a divorced father of two children, both of whom attend school. To earn a living, he runs a hair salon in the neighbourhood where he lives. Claude has been passionate about hairdressing since childhood, and this drove him to become trained in the field. Previously, he worked for a large company, but he resigned due to low salary and decided to dedicate himself to running his salon.

To ensure a high level of service, Claude needs to have a variety of products in stock such as shampoos, masks, and rinses, which is why he is requesting this loan. His long-term goal is to rehabilitate the family home.

name: Willingtone Mwirotsi
use: to buy another motorbike to increase his income.
texts:
This is Willingtone, a happily married man aged 26 years and a father of one daughter.His wife is a hairdresser by profession and they support one another to meet the needs of the family.

He is a motorbike operator with many years of experience in this business. He enjoys interacting with his clients as he ferries them from one place to another and understands their needs well.

To increase his income, he is requesting a loan to buy another motorbike.He will create employment and enrich the lives of people in the community. This is his second loan and he repays well.

His dream is to buy land and a public service vehicle soon.

name: Ronalyn
use: to purchase additional Tupperware products to sell.
texts:
Ronalyn is 36 years old with one child who is in school. Ronalyn works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a direct-selling Tupperware business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional Tupperware products to sell. Ronalyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ronalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

name: Veronica
use: to stock up on American merchandise (shoes, lotions, creams, vitamins, clothing, and more).
texts:
Veronica is a lovely 26-year-old woman. She is the mother of a 1-year-old little girl. She lives with her daughter in the town of Itagüí. She has a "department store" located in her home, where she sells clothing, perfumes, and personal products.

She began this work selling merchandise because she was looking to generate income to support her daughter. Thanks to this business, she has had a better quality of life and a flow of income in order to be economically independent.

She is requesting a loan to stock up on American merchandise (shoes, lotions, creams, vitamins, clothing, and more). She wants to give her customers something that they typically don't find in the department stores in her residential area.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Tomas Simon
use: to purchase more tools for his auto repair workshop.
texts:
Tomas has lived in the city of Ibarra with his partner for thirteen years. They wish to form a home, but unfortunately they haven’t been able to do so due to health issues. Tomas, 45, completed his high school education and for this reason, he began working at a very young age.

Tomas is an auto mechanic and his workshop has been located at his own home for fifteen years. He has always had many customers because of the good work he does, and he is requesting a loan to purchase more tools for his workshop. He will be very grateful for your support.

name: Maria Nieva
use: to cover the cost of motorcycle maintenance for delivering products to her customers.
texts:
Maria Nieva settled for a living in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez with her family. For many years she has been running her retail business, selling ready to wear clothes and cosmetics, and has been able to make improvements on their house and has paid the school tuition fees of her son. She has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Recently, she took a new loan amounting to 8,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to cover the cost of motorcycle repair, which is used in delivering the products to her customers. She is hopeful for an expansion of her business in the future.

name: Caridad
use: to maintain her grocery stock.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga del sur

texts:
Caridad is 53 years and married, and she has 4 children. She lives in the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is involved in fish and grocery selling.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 for the purchase of grocery stock such as detergent and powder soap, powder milk, soft drinks, sugar, sauce, cooking oil, and different kinds of finger foods.

Caridad plans to save money for future other business.

name: Yom
use: to purchase a motorbike for her son.
texts:
Yom is widowed. She lives with her children at Lvea Em District, Kandal Province of Cambodia.

She has been a mat weaver for 5 years and her son is a chef at a restaurant.

Yom wishes to purchase a motorbike for her son's transport to work, but she does not enough money to purchase one, so she decided to apply for a loan from Maxima Microfinance Plc. Using this loan she will able to purchase a motorbike for her son.

name: Nelia
use: Nélia to buy a variety of products to re-sell.
texts:
Nélia is 40 years old and a retailer. She is the single mother of three children ages 20 (in the 11th grade), 18 (also in the 11th grade) and 15 (in the 9th grade). She also lives with a 13-year-old niece who is in the 8th grade. She lives in a house she owns and does not play a role in the community.
She says that she intends this loan to strengthen the volume of merchandise in her store, acquiring bran, flip flops, peanuts, oil, flour, beans, sugar, and rice.
This is her fourth loan at Hluvuku; with the previous loans she built a stall, since she used to sell on a bench outdoors, and she increased the volume of her merchandise.
Her dream is to improve her living conditions and to move forward in her business.

name: Sunita
use: to expand the supply of copper items in her copper shop by purchasing more raw materials.
texts: Sunita, is a 51-year-old married woman from the Nadia of West Bengal. She wants to support her husband's copper items shop. She wants to secure her family's future so she wishes to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of INR. 25,000 from Milaap's field partner Gram Bikash Kendra. She wants to purchase more raw materials to increase her supply of copper items. The shop will expand and increase the family income. Sunita and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

name: Kung's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Kung’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia.

Kung works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Kung safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Yeam's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Yeam’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia.

Yeam makes a living cultivating rice and she works as a factory worker to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Yeam safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Gulnora
use: to pay her son's university tuition.
texts:
Gulnora is a kindhearted woman of 53. She is married with two children. Her son has entered university. She works as a doctor in the local hospital and everything she earns goes toward family expenses. She doesn't have the means to save for other goals since her income is only sufficient for essentials.

Gulnora needs to pay her son's university tuition but doesn't have the money to do so. For this reason she has approached Arvand for a loan to pay her son's tuition. She and her son are very thankful to Arvand and Kiva for their support and trust.

name: Phou
use: to buy a decent motorcycle in order to have transportation to and from her house.
texts:
A resident from Kampot province, Phou is 33 years old and married. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are still studying in high school.

To improve her family’s living, she is growing rice and working as a construction worker to earn extra income. She has been with her current business for 10 years and she can save from her daily income about 7 U.S. dollars per day for future needs.

Her rice crop did not grow well because of the drought and being destroyed by insects. That is the main challenge.

For Phou, this is her first time with VisionFund and she is going to use this loan to buy a decent motorcycle to support transportation for her family.

She dreams that her family’s business runs smooth with good income.

name: Sophy
use: to buy more rice seed and fertilizer for her rice farming to gain a good yield.
texts:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province, Sophy is 43 years old and a mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support four children, one of whom is still in school.

For the last ten years, she has been growing rice as the main source of her family’s income. Moreover, she can make extra income via working as a construction worker.

Sophy could not get a good yield from her crop because insects have destroyed her rice farming. She is with VisionFund for her second loan cycle, including this one, with a successful repayment of her past loan, which enabled her to improve her lifestyle to get better than before.

She will spend her loan to purchase more rice seed and fertilizer as inputs for her rice farmland to grow well. Sophy wishes that she can gain a higher-yield crop via this loan.

name: Idimoh
use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to make higher-quality dresses for her customers and earn more income to support her family.
texts:
Idimoh has been attracted to cutting and sewing since she was a child. She learned the trade from her mother and helped her. Now she is 58 and lives in Khuroson. She is married and has three wonderful sons. After getting married, she was busy raising her children, but as they got older she decided to work in her beloved trade. She has been sewing professionally for three years and has enough customers in her town.

Now she has decided to expand her business, with the help of a computerized sewing machine for embroidery. She needs some financial support to buy this sewing machine, and so she is turning to you with great hope that you will help her out. Please help her!

name: Mao's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.
texts:
Mao’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Mao safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Albeiro De Jesus
use: loan to purchase poultry manure, organic fertilizer, and tubs to maintain his crops.
texts:
Albeiro is a farmer who has been devoting his body and soul to the field since his youth. He learned this activity thanks to his father. Today he has 80 avocado trees, and he distributes these products to a wholesaler.

He came to the Kiva community requesting a loan to purchase poultry manure, organic fertilizer, and
tubs to maintain his crops. His dreams are to continue growing his land, purchase more land, and expand his crops.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Mahfirathon
use: to buy mineral fertilizer, to receive a good harvest and income.
texts:
Mahfirathon is from the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 47 and married with four children. She is a farmer who has been working in agriculture for 10 years. She decided to work in this field because her parents were also farmers and taught her how to grow crops and manage the work.

Mahfirathon currently needs a loan to buy mineral fertilizer to amend the soil and plant this year's crops. This loan will allow her to plant on time and receive a quality harvest. She awaits your kindness and support.

name: Sahar
use: to start her own makeup artistry business.
texts:
Sahar is a 30-year-old youth who lives with her large family and tries her best to help them with household expenses. She has been working as a saleswoman for a makeup and cosmetics store.

She wishes to use this entrepreneur loan in order to start her own makeup business, for she has always wanted to become a makeup artist. Through this loan, she will buy a new makeup kit to start her business.

By contributing to Sahar's first-time loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, you will be supporting her dream of becoming a makeup artist.

name: Khairinisso
use: to buy a range of goods such as scotch tape, glue, brushes, rulers, TV remotes, etc.
texts:
Khairinisso is a divorced woman with one child. She lives with her small daughter in her parents' house in the Vose district.

In order not to be a burden to her parents and to provide for her child Khairinisso started her trading business two years ago. She has a retail outlet in the market in her district where she sells different things such as scotch tape, glue, brushes, rulers, TV remotes, etc. Now she would like to increase her assortment of goods, but she does not have enough funds.

Khairinisso asks you to help her. She gradually wants to expand her business and improve the financial situation of her family.

name: Ikromkhon
use: to pay for his wife’s treatment at the medical clinic.
texts:
Ikromkhon is a kind man. He was born in 1994 into a laborer's family. He is clever and always tries to secure the well-being of his family. He is married and has no children.

Ikromkhon deals with buying and selling cattle. He has been doing this work for five years. He does his job well, and he is capable. He earns a low income and lives modestly.

Ikromkhon needs financial support now because his wife is ill. He loves his wife and takes care of her by himself. He must buy medicine for her, but his low income is not enough to have his wife treated at a medical clinic.

Ikromkhon is asking for a loan of 100 USD, which he will use to buy medicine for his wife’s treatment.

He is a repeat client and has a positive credit history. He is asking for a loan for the third time through Kiva's field partner, IMON. He awaits your mercy.

name: Alla
use: to buy fertilizers for her cherry trees and apricots this season.
texts:
Alla lives with her husband and two children in an older house that was built well and has modern furniture and appliances. She and her husband are farmers, growing cherries and apricots. Since cherry season is approaching, Alla needs to buy high-quality fertilizer that she can put in her soil and the trees will need nutrients for the harvest that's coming soon.

Alla plans to the fertilizer she needs for 15,000 hryvnas so she can spread it on her cherry trees in the near future. She hopes that this fruit harvest will be nice and big and that it will give her the chance to earn more so she can buy some of the things she needs.

name: Ri
use: to buy more land to expand her rice farmland so that it is bigger than before.
texts:
A local farmer living in Kampot Province, Ri is 32 years old and the mother of three children. Nowadays, she needs to support her two schoolchildren. She earns income to improve her family’s living conditions by growing rice and working as construction worker to supplement her income.

For ages, she has been involved with her farming, and it has enabled her to keep up to about six USD as her daily saving. The drought and destruction from insects are the main challenges for her rice farm to grow well. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund. She has paid back her past loans on time. She improved her family's living conditions with a decent household appliance with the previous loans.

Ri will spend this loan to buy more land to expand her rice farmland and make it bigger than before. She hopes that she can gain more yields and earn more income so that she can help her children’s studies so that they graduate on time.

name: Waleed
use: to buy modern metal frames to make windows.
texts:
Waleed is 39, married, and has three sons. He lives with his aging parents in the same house and has a workshop that makes metal windows.

He is requesting this loan to buy modern metal frames to meet the demands of his customers and increase his income.

name: Pinky
use: to purchase additional items to sell like milk, noodles, eggs, etc.
texts:
Pinky is 33 years old and has two children who are in school. Pinky works very hard to provide for them.

Pinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

Pinky has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Pinky would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Masilinda
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Masilinda is 55 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Masilinda works very hard to provide for them.

Masilinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Masilinda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Masilinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Susan
use: to buy more chickens.
texts:
Susan is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more chickens. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

name: Rose
use: to buy more stock of clothes.
texts:
Rose is a married woman with 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add stock.

name: Esborone
use: to buy more stock of clothes.
texts:
Esborone is a single man. He describes himself to be polite.

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

name: Nelson De Jesus
use: to update all of his construction equipment since it is in very bad condition.
texts:
Nelson is a foreman who lives in the town of Argelia. He has a family made up of his partner and four children, ages 17, 13, 9, and 2, who are financially dependent on him.

He comes to the Kiva community requesting a loan to update all of his construction equipment, since what he has is in very bad condition. To do his jobs, he has had to resort to loans and rental equipment.

This loan will allow him to have new equipment, which will be more efficient.

Nelson's dream is to be able to improve the financial conditions of his home, to pay for education for his children, and to give them a good quality of life.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: June Marie
use: to buy more scrap to sell and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
June Marie is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 28 years old and has four children who are in school.

June Marie has a business buying and selling scrap in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

June Marie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Marilou
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal-care products, etc.
texts:
Marilou is 50 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal-care products, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Mary Ann
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Mary Ann is 37 years old, with four children. With three of her children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Caroline
use: to pay tuition fees for her children.
texts:
Meet 48-year-old Caroline!

She is a beautiful and humble woman who is honest and hardworking. She is from the Kerugoya area of Kenya and has been a farmer for six years.

Caroline is experienced and practices animal and crop farming to take care of her family’s needs and provide a good education for her children. She believes that education is the key to success for her children. Caroline is requesting a loan to pay for school fees for her children. She will use her loan to help her children learn comfortably, knowing they will never be sent away because of the lack of tuition fees. Caroline wants her children to have a bright future and with this loan, she will be able to achieve this.

Lend to her now so that her children can have a brighter future. This loan will surely have an enormous impact on Caroline and her children’s well-being.

name: Mary
use: to buy farm inputs to boost production.
texts: Mary is a married woman. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs to boost production. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

name: Salma
use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.
texts: Salma is a married woman. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

name: Fatemah 236 Group
use: to pay for her maternity health care.
texts:
Fatemah 236 is a group consisting of three women who wish to benefit from this loan to cover expenses needed for their maternity health care and improve their living conditions. They are all first-time borrowers from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua.

Hayat, the woman on the right, is the featured borrower of this group. She is a 26-year-old youth and a married mother of one who is currently expecting. Hayat managed to start her own business in chocolate decorations and crafts in order to help her husband with house expenses. She now wishes to benefit from this loan in order to pay for her maternity health care.

Group members are mentioned in order from left to right: Yousra, Sobheye, Hayat.

name: Len
use: to purchase beauty products such as lotion, face cream, shampoo, and collagen to resell in the factory.
texts:
Len, 39, is a garment factory worker and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. She has been operating in the garment factory to make money to support her family for the past six years, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. This couple typically makes around 14 USD per day.

In order to increase her profits, she is now asking for a loan to purchase cosmetic products such as lotion, face cream, shampoo, and collagen to resell in the factory. She sees this as a good opportunity to add a source of income and improve her family's living condition. In the future, she is going to enlarge her business, build a bigger house, and help her children to get a higher education.

name: Samnang
use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rice.
texts:
Samnang is 38 years old and appears in the photo. She is married and lives with her husband and two school aged children in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. For the past five years, she has been working as a garment factory worker in a local village to earn income to support their living expenses, while her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn around 13USD.

Due to the shortage of finances, she is now asking for a loan to purchase farmland for cultivating rice. She sees this purchase will allow her to grow rice to support her family’s living and increase her family profits as well. In the future, she is going to expand her farmland, build a fence around her house, and help her children go to college.

name: Hayam
use: to buy some grocery products such as sugar, rice, oil, flour and pasta.
texts: Hayam is 42, married, and has three children. Her husband is a laborer, and she has a small grocery store business. She is requesting a loan to buy some grocery products such as sugar, rice, oil, flour and pasta to expand her small business.

name: Tong's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.
texts:
Tong’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Tong works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Tong safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time otherwise spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Ny's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Ny’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Ny makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Ny safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Juan Pablo
use: to buy agricultural inputs for the sowing oft basic grains.
texts:
Juan is a hard-working person. He studied until sixth grade. He lives in a relationship and his partner takes care of the domestic tasks. His daughter is little and does not study yet.

Juan has been working in agriculture for all his life. His father taught him this activity and he likes it a lot. Currently he has to walk two kilometres on foot to the plot where he plants.
His partner helps him with some agricultural tasks. In addition, when its not the time for sowing, Juan works as a mason.
He needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs for the sowing of basic grains.
He wants to continue to work in agriculture, because it's an activity he is passionate for.

name: Diana Karina
use: to buy more basic products to stock her store so that she can move forward with the earnings, as she is a single mother.
texts:
Diana is the single mother of a four year old girl. She only attended school through the ninth grade as she lacked the economic conditions to continue in school, and preferred to help her parents.

Diana has a store where she sells staple goods. Three years ago she decided to start her business in order to provide for her daughter's daily needs. Since she separated from her partner things haven't been easy, but with effort she has moved forward with her daughter. She has her business in her home, and is open from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.
