Diana needs a loan to buy more staple goods to stock her store. With the earnings she will move forward, as she is a single mother. She dreams that her daughter will become a professional in the future, and that she will have her store better stocked.

name: Maria Luz Angela
use: to purchase poultry manure, organic fertilizer, and bathtubs to maintain her crops.  This loan will help her improve production in her business and increase her income.
texts:
Luz Angela is a farmer who lives in the town of Sonson with her husband and two children, ages fifteen and eight. She works with her husband on a plot of land she owns, where she plants avocadoes, peas, scallions, “zapote“ [an oval brown sweet fruit, typical of Mexico and Central America] and marigolds that she sells at the market in the plaza.

She is applying for a loan to purchase poultry manure, organic fertilizer, and bathtubs to maintain her crops. This loan will help her improve production in her business and increase her income. Her dreams are to be able to make improvements to her home and to pay for her children’s education.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Rosa Maria
use: to start a beauty salon business.
texts:
Rosa is a 35-year-old married woman. She comes to the Kiva community requesting financial support to start a business that will be a beauty salon.

Rosa already has some things for her business. She needs the support since she needs to accommodate the locals and buy supplies to make dyes and permanent hair straighteners which are currently highly requested. With your help, she will be able to have her own business.

Her dream is to be able to pay for the education of her children and improve living conditions.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Amada De Jesus
use: to buy a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.
texts:
Amada is a friendly and generous woman. She operates a tailoring business in Medellin that provides work for three employees and says that she expects to continue working hard to grow the business because it is her means of supporting her family and generating employment for local people.

Amada is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a business-grade sewing machine. The investment will help her to deliver a better product faster and easier. When we asked her what she most wants for the future, she told us that she wants a house of her own one day.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Gerly
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Gerly is 43 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Gerly is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gerly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Joy
use: to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
Joy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joy is 36 years old and her two children are in school.

Joy has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her business.

Joy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Josefina
use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.
texts:
Josefina is 66 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Luz
use: to purchase more stocks to sell.
texts:
Luz is 46 years old and married with five children. Luz works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. Luz has borrowed and repaid past loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from manicure and pedicure services.

Luz aspires to saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Marites
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Marites is 37 years old and is married with six children. With three children still in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Lydia
use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, soap, rice, sugar, and other items.
texts:
Lydia is a married woman. She describes herself as humble. Lydia operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice, sugar, bread, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

Lydia will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, soap, rice, sugar, and other items. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

name: Mary
use: to buy more stock of charcoal.
texts:
Mary is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as determined. Mary operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

Mary will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loans successfully.

name: Ruth
use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, soap, rice and other items.
texts:
Ruth is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, soap, rice and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

name: Mamisoa
use: to buy bags of rice, oil, soap and candles for his grocery store.
texts: At 20 years of age Mamisoa is married and the father of two children. His wife sells bottled milk. As to Mamisoa he has had a grocery store since 2014. It is a business inherited from his mother which he has operated since he finished his studies. Having a diversified and sufficient stock allows him to satisfy the needs of his customers and consequently win their loyalty. For this reason he is requesting a loan to stock up. His goal is to create another sales location which his wife will manage.

name: Heurng's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Heurng’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Heurng makes a living cultivating rice, and she works as a farmer to support her family.

In Heurng's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Heurng safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Anusaya
use: Anusaya to expand her grocery business by adding more stocks of sugar, tea, etc. and selling them.
texts:
Anusaya, is a 32-year-old, married woman, residing in Balangir district, Odisha.

She is engaged in a grocery business. She sells sugar, rice, pulses, tea, etc. in her grocery store. She has a household of four members and a monthly income of INR 6,500.

She wants to purchase more amounts of sugar, rice, tea, etc. to sell in the local market and to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of INR 25,000 from Mahashakti Foundation, one of Milaap's field partners.

Anusaya and her family will be thankful to the lenders.

name: Gloria Group
use: to stock up with sacks of corn and millet.
texts:
Hermana is a merchant selling the local drink in her home on an avenue in town. The president of the 'banc villageois' called “Gloria”, she is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima who is 51, married, and the mother of seven children, of whom four are in school, and three are adults.

She is going to stock up with sacks of corn and millet to bolster her business. She had received initial funding from her husband fifteen years ago.

Her wish is to build a house and to provide an education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima and its partners for supporting unbanked entrepreneur.

name: Maisha Group
use: to stock up with antibiotics, ointments, anti-malarials, and anti-inflammatories to sell with the aim of building a house and providing an education for her children.
texts:
Jacqueline sells modern medicines on the main road. The president of the 'banc villageois' called “Maisha”, she is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima who is 53, a widow, and the mother of eleven children, of whom seven are in school and four are not.

She is going to stock up with antibiotics, ointments, anti-malarials, and anti-inflammatories to bolster her business. She started her business with capital nine years ago from her husband when he was alive.

Her wish is to build a house and to provide an education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneur.

name: Nom's Group
use: to purchase more grocery items to expand her business and get more customers.
texts:
Living in a rural village in Svay Reang Province, Nom is 60 years old and a mother blessed with five children.

She can earn income to support her living condition via rice cropping and make extra income selling grocery items. The main challenge for her family’s business is losing customers.

This is the second loan cycle for Nom with VisionFund and she has paid back her past loan. With the previous loan, her family life has improved with decent household supplies to use.

She leads a group of three members applying for this new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan to purchase more grocery items to expand her business more than before.

She hopes that this loan can help her to get more customers, so she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

name: Bebie
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
Bebie is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Bebie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Merlita
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Merlita works hard to support her eight children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Merlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family. She is aware that by using a sanitary toilet she is reducing health risks for her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.

name: Peter
use: to pay tuition fees for his children.
texts:
Dear Kiva lenders,

Peter is a handsome and humble farmer who is honest and hardworking. He is from the Nyahururu area of Kenya and plans to succeed in life. Peter has been a farmer for six years. He is experienced and practices animal and crop farming to take care of his family’s needs and provide a good education for his children.

Peter believes that education is the key to success for his children. He is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. His loan will help his children learn comfortably and know they will never be sent away because of lack of tuition fees. Peter wants his children to have a bright future and, with this loan, he will be able to achieve this. Lend to him now so that his children can have a brighter future.

name: Joelito
use: to buy materials like scissors and clippers and also to buy piglets for a hog raising start-up.
texts:
For almost two years, Joelito has privided hair cut services to locals in his area. In addition, he also provides motor cycle transportation services to help defray the family's daily expenses. He is a married man.

This time, he needs sufficient funds to boost his livelihood. Running a barber shop is a lucrative business, and he is seeking ways to make it more productive.

Therefore, Joelito has decided to join CEVI and requested a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP, to be used used to buy materials like scissors and clippers and also to buy piglets for a hog raising start-up .

He is grateful to CEVI and Kiva for the continued support, and he is more determined to open his own barber shop someday.

name: Antony
use: Antony to service and maintain his motorcycle.
texts:
Antony is a married man. He describes himself as being God-fearing.

Antony operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

Antony will use the KES 40,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

name: Abeer
use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.
texts:
Abeer is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her children's (featured in the photo) school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, which is designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

Abeer hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs and developing their social situation.

name: Heng
use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rice.
texts:
Heng, 46, is a married father of four school-aged children. He lives in the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Heng is a hardworking man and has been working as a construction worker to earn income to support his family for the past 17 years. His wife also contributes to their family by working in a garment factory.

In order to increase his family's income, Heng has now decided to ask for a loan from KREDIT. He would like to use his loan to purchase farmland for cultivating rice. With the profit from this season’s harvest, Heng is going to enlarge his farm, build a bigger house, and help his children go to college.

name: Pharo
use: to purchase one hectare of farmland for cultivating rice.
texts:
Pharo, 47, is a blacksmith and lives with his wife and only child in a village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2014 to earn income to support his family, while his wife is a housewife.

Due to a shortage of income, Pharo is now asking for a loan to purchase one hectare of farmland for cultivating rice. He sees this as a way to reduce his rice purchases for everyday use and improve his family's living conditions. In the future, Pharo is going to enlarge his farmland, complete his house, and help his child get a higher education.

name: Chheang's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.
texts:
Chheang’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province, in Cambodia.

Chheang works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Chheang safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Jameela Bibi
use: to buy raw materials for her brother's embroidery business in order to get it more established.
texts:
Jameela Bibi is a 49-year-old woman who lives with her brother in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children.

Jameela Bibi's brother is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family, and he has been running an embroidery business for two years. Her brother's embroidery business is very famous in the market, and that is the reason her brother business is doing well. He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance, in order to have it in stock. He requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand. The challenge her brother is facing is to have sufficient capital to run the business and be able support her family in its present form.

Therefore, Jameela Bibi humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, her brother will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors that he needs.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

name: Chanbo's Group
use: to purchase more goats for raising in order to improve her business.
texts:
A 44 years old, living in Kampong cham province, Chanbo has five children who are still dependent on her.

To support her family’s living, she raises goats. But goat prices are getting lower, so she can’t earn more income to support her family. This is her third loan cycle and she has repaid her past loans successfully. Her previous loans helped her to get more income. Now she is leading a group of two members to request this loan.

As a group leader, she will use her loan to purchase more goats to raise in order to improve her business. She wishes she can increase her income to support her family’s living.

name: Neang's Group
use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farming.
texts:
In a village of Koh Krorlor district, Battambang province, Cambodia, Neang is a widower. He has two children who are in school.

Neang is a farmer who has been growing rice for almost eight years. He has been working very hard to support his children’s education.

This is the fifth loan cycle for Neang with VisionFund Cambodia. He has used the past loans wisely and successfully paid back those loans.

Now Neang is leading this group to request a loan via VisionFund Cambodia. He will use his loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farming.

He hopes this loan will help him to gain more crop yields, increase his income, and support his children’s education.

name: Dany's Group
use: to buy more fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve on her rice farming and produce a good yield.
texts:
Aged 27 years, Dany is married with one child. She lives in a rural area located in Takeo province.

She is growing rice as her single main source of income to support the family. For ages, she has been involved in farming, and it has enabled her to save from the daily income about 8.00 USD per day for future needs. Destruction by insects and drought have been her main challenges.

Dany has been with VisionFund for a second cycle already. She fully paid back the past loan, which has helped her to improve her standard of living. Now, she is asking for a new loan as part of a group of two members.

As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy more fertilizer and organic pesticide for her rice farming to produce a good yield. She wishes to grow more healthy rice to increase her family’s income, to make a better living and to keep sending her child to school.

name: Deysi Del Carmen
use: to buy a refrigerator to properly store her milk products.
texts:
Daysi only attended school through the seventh grade, due to her parents' economic need. Nevertheless, she has always fought to get ahead. She is the single mother of three children, only one of whom lives with her.

Daysi has worked selling cheese, cream and cheese curds for approximately six years. She learned this trade from her mother. Today she has many customers and is proud of always moving forward. She also sells quesadillas which is another source of income. She sells by the side of the road. Her work schedule is from 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Daysi needs a loan to buy a refrigerator to properly store her milk products. She dreams of improving her home and will achieve it through her work.

name: Succès Group
use: to pay for wheat flour, sugar, and oil for her food stall with the aim of buying land and providing an education for her children.
texts:
Henriette is a merchant and the president of the community bank called “Succès”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 57, married, and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school, and one is an adult.

Henriette is a vendor of beignets in her home in town. She is going to purchase some wheat flour, sugar, and oil to bolster her business. She started her business with capital from the tontine two years ago.

Her wish is to purchase a parcel of land and to provide an education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneur excluded from the traditional banking system. It should be noted that certain clients are carrying their babies.

name: Soley Paola
use: to buy office-related equipment and supplies for her parking and car wash services business.
texts:
Soley is an enterprising young woman who operates a parking and car wash services business. She started the business because she didn't want to depend on anyone else to make her way in the world. She needed a way to help her family with household expenses and to pay her school fees and she hit on a business that is now growing and provides work for two employees.

Soley wants to put her business on a firmer footing and is applying to Kiva lenders for a loan that she will use to buy the equipment and supplies she needs to set up an office from which she can manage her business.

When we asked Soley about her hopes for the future, she told us that she wants to continue growing her business and to provide work for even more employees.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Cesar Augusto
use: to buy wood, cement, blocks, metal roofing, and other materials to build a pigpen.
texts:
Cesar is an inhabitant of the Santa Barbara municipality. He works independently in the business of breeding and selling pigs. This occupation has allowed him to generate support for his family and has given them quality of life.

Cesar wants to request a loan to buy wood, cement, blocks, metal roofing, and other materials to build a pigpen.

This loan will allows him to accommodate a larger number of pigs, which will generate greater income since he will have more pigs to sell.

His dream is to be able to buy a home and that his business will be larger.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Enyanya Group
use: to stock up with antibiotics, anti-malarials, and anti-inflammatories for her pharmacy.
texts:
This client, Jeanette, is the owner of a pharmacy, where she sell modern medicines on the main road in town. The president of the 'banc villageois' called “ Enyanya”, she is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima who is married, 31 years old, and the mother of four children, of whom three are attending school, and one is still very young.

She is going to stock up with antibiotics, anti-malarials, and anti-inflammatories to bolster her business. She started her business with capital from her husband four years ago. Her wish is to complete her house and to provide an education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

name: Regina
use: to buy fishing materials like gasoline for her boat, fish net, rope and other materials needed for her business.
texts:
Regina is a married woman. She is 57 years old with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Regina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials like gasoline for her boat, fish net, rope and other materials needed.

Regina has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Lyn
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
As a parent of one child, Lyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. Lyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Margie
use: to buy more fish to sell and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
Margie is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has one child currently in school.

Margie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

Margie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Lorena
use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.
texts:
Lorena works hard to support her family. Lorena is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lorena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for 19 years now. In the future, Lorena would like to build and expand her business to secure financial stability for her family.

name: Calebasse De L Emergence 32 Group
use: to buy fabric to sell.
texts: Calebasse De L Emergence 32 is a group made up of ten women who belong to the same tontine (saving group) and work in commerce. Fatou is their representative (she has her hand raised in the photo). She is married and has made a living in commerce for 3 years. She is a daily employee in a factory that makes hair extensions and at the same time she carries out her sales of a variety of fabric. Her work day begins at 8 in the morning and continues until 5 in the afternoon. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 XOF. She plans to use her financing to buy fabric to resell. She takes care of the education of the children in her household. She also would like to expand her business to save money and make improvements on her house in the future.

name: Modeste
use: to pay for flour, wheat, oil, coffee beans, and charcoal for his different activities with the aim of buying land on which to build a house.
texts:
Modeste, aged 37, is a man married for ten years. The couple have three children, of whom two are in school. His wife takes care of the grocery store. The income sources are diversified. Aside from charcoal, the main business is an eatery (selling coffee and beignets), which was established in 2011. It is necessary to have a significant inventory of basic supplies for regular operation at the eatery. And selling charcoal also requires significant funding, thus the request for a loan.

This loan will enable him to pay for sacks of flour, wheat, oil, coffee beans, and sacks of charcoal. The goal is to acquire a plot of land in town on which to build a house.

name: Thoeum
use: to buy a walking tractor to help her farm get a good yield.
texts:
A local farmer living in Preah Vihear Province, Thoeum is 40 years old and is married. She is the mother of six children, five of whom are still studying in high school. She is growing rice as her single main source of her income to support the family. She has been with her business for 22 years old, and it enables her to keep up to about 8 USD per day after expenses.

This is the third cycle loan for Thoeum with VisionFund, and she has repaid her past loans back on time. She can earn more income and improve her conditions thanks to the previous loans. With this loan, she will use it to buy a walking tractor to help her rice farmland gain good yield.

Thoeum hopes that this loan can help her rice farm to grow with higher yield and more income so that she can improve her lifestyle and support her children’s education.

name: Salvacion
use: to buy fertilizers, farm supplies, and pay for the laborers' salaries to maintain her business.
texts:
Salvacion is 58 years old and is married with two children.

Salvacion earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, farm supplies, and pay for the laborers' salaries to maintain her business.

Salvacion has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Salvacion is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

name: Lorna
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
Lorna is a woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorna is 49 years old and all of her children are in school.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Alfredo
use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for growing staple grains.
texts:
Alfredo attended school through high school. He is single and lives with his brother.

Alfredo has been a farmer since he was very young. He learned this trade from his father. He has to travel approximately five kilometers from his house to arrive at his fields. He starts his work at 5:00 a.m. and ends at noon. His brother works with him.

Alfredo will use the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his crops of staple grains. He dreams of having his own land to farm, and of continuing to make money in order to get ahead.

name: Juan Jesús
use: to buy supplies for his farming business.
texts:
Juan, 55, is married. His wife takes care of the family.

Juan learned farming from his father and has always made a living on the land. He has his own farming business now and also works on a neighboring estate. He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies for his next grain crop. He used his last loan to support his business, a loan that he has now repaid.

When we asked Juan what he most wants for the future, he told us that he would like more land to farm.

name: Loida
use: to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Loida is 33 years old and single.

Loida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Loida has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loida would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Loice
use: to buy more stock of maize.
texts:
Loice is a married woman. She describes herself as determined.

She operates a posho mill, where she offers maize milling services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

name: Johan Leandro
use: cultivate tomatoes, sweet peppers, and green beans.
texts:
For a great part of his life Don Johan has earned a living harvesting vegetables, especially tomatoes, sweet peppers, and green beans. He sells his harvest to people who have shops in the market, and he wants to grow his business which is why he requests a loan of one million Colones. This will allow him to acquire a greater quantity of seeds and of better quality.

Moreover, this will provide sufficient working capital to perform the different tasks that these crops require. Having more capital to invest would mean an increase in production and quality of the harvest, but also will allow him to increase his income and improve the quality of life of his family.

name: Em's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: Em’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Em works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Em safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: José Armando
use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, etc., for growing his corn crop.
texts:
José didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He has a partner, who cares for their home. Three of their four children live with them and depend on him economically.

José is a farmer, and he's done this kind of work since he was very small. He learned from one of his uncles, with whom he often went to the coffee fields to learn. He walks approximately 4 km to the place where he farms, and his schedule is from 6:00 am until 12 noon.

José will use this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, etc., for growing his corn crop.

He dreams of having a larger area to plant, so that he can have the capacity to earn more income so that his entire family will have a better life.

name: Wilmer Javier
use: to pay to have his taxi repaired.
texts:
Wilmer lives with his grandparents. They gave him his education and cared for him when he most needed it as his parents had separated and had other homes. Wilmer is 28 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra. He had the opportunity to complete his secondary studies. After that he had to find work to help his grandparents as due to their age they could no longer work. Wilmer has a son but because of his living conditions he pays $50 support and only sees him on weekends.

Wilmer has been a professional driver for 5 years. The vehicle he uses to work has some mechanical problems. So Wilmer is requesting a loan to pay for the repairs of his vehicle. In this way he can continue to work and continue to help his grandparents.

name: Wilma
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Wilma works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Wilma is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing the health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.

name: Carmen Helena
use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.
texts:
Carmen, 53, found that setting up her own business was the best means of ensuring the well-being of her family. She started a cafe in her Mosquera neighborhood in a storefront where the owner before had only sold hot drinks. She decided that it was the perfect place to sell prepared foods and--with help from one of her children--bought the space from the previous owner.

Carmen's star product is a locally-made chorizo that she sells as a "combo" meal: chorizo, potatoes and a soft drink. She wants to make her own chorizo and is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first Kiva loan so that she can buy the supplies--pork, vegetables, etc.--she needs. The loan will allow her to buy supplies at wholesale prices, an investment that will increase the margin on her sales.

Please support Carmen's efforts to grow her business.

name: Esther
use: to purchase sewing thread and clothing materials.
texts:
Esther is 44 years old. She is married with seven children. She has had a tailoring business for 20 years. She will be using the loan to purchase sewing thread and clothing materials.

Esther hopes this will help her to pay her children's school fees. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to employ others in her business.

name: Flor De Sapaqui Group
use: to buy seed wholesale.
texts:
The Flor de Sapaqui communal association will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana branch. It is made up of eight members, and is led by a board of directors of which Noemi is the president.

The loan they are seeking will benefit small entrepreneurs including Noemi. She currently has a business selling vegetables. She says she learned this business on her own initiative several years ago.

The loan she will receive is to increase her capital by buying seeds wholesale that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will later plant them and harvest their crops, which will serve as a means of production. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, as she is single and has a son.

name: Bushra Bibi
use: to buy commodities for her husband's general store to enhance it and grow the business.
texts:
Bushra bibi is a 35-year-old married woman living in Lahore, Pakistan, with her family, and she is standing with her husband.

Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Bushra bibi is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health expenses. She wants to grow the business of her husband, so she requested a loan from Kiva's Field Partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits.

She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan and she is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future.

She is very thankful to Kiva's Field Partner BRAC.

name: Sophea's Group
use: to purchase more fertilizer and pay for plowing to improve her cassava farm so that it grows well.
texts:
A mother of four children, Sophea is 49 years old and lives in the Preah Vihear Province. To support her family, she is growing cassava and selling grocery items to earn extra income. She has been with her businesses for five years, and it has enabled her to save from her daily income about 8 USD per day after expenses.

This is Sophea’s second cycle with VisionFund. She has fully repaid her past loan. Her family has improved thanks to the previous loan. Now, she is leading this group of four members to apply for this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more fertilizer and pay for plowing so that her cassava farmland will gain more yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain higher yields than last year.

name: Juan Antonio
use: to buy cement posts to enclose the land where he will grow corn and beans, in order to prevent animals from passing through and damaging his crops.
texts:
Juan was only able to attend school through the first grade. He is married, and his wife takes care of the home. His children are now grown and live apart.

Juan is a farmer and has twelve years' experience in his work. He grows corn and beans. He also raises cattle. He learned to work through the teachings of his father.

Juan decided to apply for a loan to buy cement posts to enclose the land where he's going to plant corn and beans. This will prevent animals from crossing through and damaging his crops.

His dreams are to have more cattle for work, and that his earnings improve little by little.

name: Felipe De Jesús
use: to buy supplies for his farming business.
texts:
Felipe and his wife have two young children, both in school. He also has a 20-year old daughter from a previous relationship.

Felipe has a farming business. He grows maize and beans and tells us that he learned farming from his father. He decided on farming because he couldn't find other employment and looked to farming as a way to ensure that he would always be able to feed his family. He works mornings and depends on his wife for help.

Felipe used a previous Kiva loan to support his business and is applying for a new loan that he will use to buy supplies for his next crop. When we asked what he most wants for the future, he told us that he hopes for a good yield.

name: Jesús
use: to buy inputs for raising corn and beans.
texts:
Jesús didn't have the opportunity to study. He's married, and his wife cares for the home. One of his children lives with him, and is a farmer.

Jesús works growing staple grains. He also has a pair of oxen, from which he also earns some income. He lives 4km from the land he farms. He works in the mornings, and his son helps.

Jesús needs this loan to buy inputs for raising corn and beans. In this way, he'll have staple grains for feeding his family and to sell.

Jesús dreams of expanding his businesses and is confident that, with dedication and the support of loans, he will be able to attain what he proposes.

name: Irene
use: to pay school fees for her children.
texts:
Irene is a woman who is honest and hardworking. She adores her lovely family and will do anything to keep them from going to bed hungry. Irene is from the Nkubu area of Kenya.

She did not have the opportunity to advance her education to get a white collar job. She plans to succeed in life and has farmed for nine years. She is experienced and has many farming techniques at her fingertips. Irene practices animal and crop farming to take care of her family's needs and provide a good education.

She believes that education is the key to success for her children. It’s for this reason that she is seeking a loan that she will use to pay the school fees for her children.

Through the loan, her children will learn comfortably and they will never be sent away because of a lack of tuition fees. Irene wants her children to have a bright future, and with this loan, she will be able to achieve this. Lend to her now so that her children can have a brighter future.

name: Orlando De Jesús
use: to buy more chairs and electric hair clippers in order to continue working in his barber shop.
texts:
Orlando lives with his two children and wife, who works in business.

For 15 years Orlando has had a barber shop in the downtown area of the city. He's acquired a good deal of experience, and has been developing his business in an excellent manner. For that reason he has a large number of customers who choose him.

Orlando really needs the help of a loan to buy more chairs and electric hair clippers in order to continue working in his barbershop. His prior loan from Kiva helped in his business, and he is about to pay it off 100%.

His dream is to have a larger more professional barbershop.

name: Hugo Abiel
use: to purchase organic fertilizer, insecticides, and pay rent on the land where he farms.
texts:
Due to financial reasons, Hugo only attended school until the second grade. He is in a common-law marriage, and his wife in engaged in domestic work.

Hugo makes his living in farming, sowing corn and beans, and he already has twenty years’ experience in this activity, which he learned from his parents. The place where he farms is quite far from his home, but he is happy because he always has good harvests. He works daily form 5:30 am to 1:00 pm.

He will use the current loan to purchase organic fertilizer, insecticides, and pay rent on the land where he farms.

His greatest desire is to always have his health so that he can work and get his children ahead.

name: Elena
use: to buy bamboo sticks, silk, and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elena is 59 years old.

Elena has a rope-making business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy bamboo sticks, silk, and other supplies needed in her business.

Elena has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Jocelyn
use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.
texts:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with two children in school, She works very hard to provide for them. Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Eliza
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Eliza is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Eliza has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Elsa
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Elsa is 43 years old and single with two children in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Elsa has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Felixberta
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Felixberta works hard to support her two children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Felixberta requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet. Felixberta is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

name: Nada
use: to pay her necessary medical treatment expenses.
texts:
Nada is a 54-year-old married mother of three children who works as a saleswoman in a clothes shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her necessary medical treatment expenses. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

name: Ayawoa
use: to buy 20 sacks of corn.
texts:
Ayawoa is 51 years old , divorced and has four children to support; she lives in Tokoin. She retails corn from her home and at the market, and she gets her supplies from the market four times a month.

Ayawoa is requesting this loan to stock up with sacks of corn so that she can provide for her children's needs.

name: Abla
use: to buy six sacks of corn.
texts:
Abla is a married woman who lives in Tokoin and has five children to support. She is 41 years old and sells corn dough in front of her home. She buys her goods from the market three times a month.

Abla would like this loan to buy sacks of corn so she can make a profit and improve her family's situation.

name: Roun
use: to buy fertilizer and spend on plowing so that his rice farm will gain a good yield.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

texts:
Living in a rural area of Preah Vihear Province, Roun is 46 years old and is a father blessed with one school-aged child. He provides for the needs of his family via rice cropping.

Roun has been involved with his rice farm for 25 years, and it has enabled him to save from his daily income about 8 USD per day for his future needs. Because of the drought, his rice did not grow well this year, which has been his main challenge.

For Roun, this is his sixth microloan with VisionFund, and he has already paid back his past loans. With the previous loans, he improved his family's living conditions with a decent household appliance.

Roun is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and to spend on plowing to improve his rice farmland so that it grows well. Roun hopes that this loan can help his rice farm gain more yields with better income than before.

name: Anafe
use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, soap, canned goods, rice, sugar and other groceries.
texts:
Anafe is 53 years old and married with six children. Anafe works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, soap, canned goods, rice, sugar and other groceries. Anafe has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan.

She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Anafe aspires to saving money to expand her business.

name: Lazaro
use: Lázaro to buy construction material.
texts:
Lázaro is 34 years old and a track layer who works at a railway company. He lives with his partner and is the father of two children. His oldest is 9 years old and in the 4th grade, and his second child is 4 years old. He also lives with a 12-year-old niece who is in the 5th grade. He lives in a house he owns.
He says that with this loan he intends to continue with the construction of his house, acquiring 15 zinc sheets, 8 joists and 5 boards to put a roof on his house with the objective of living in a house in better conditions.
This is his second loan at Hluvuku; with the previous loan he also bought construction material for his house. He plans to continue asking for loans to continue with the construction of his house.
His dream is to improve his living conditions and to continue working without difficulties.

name: Ama
use: to buy 80 pairs of shoes.
texts:
Ama is a 52-year-old married woman who has four children and lives in Tokoin. She sells shoes on a door-to-door basis and buys her goods at the market three times a month.

Ama is requesting this loan so she can buy tens of pairs of shoes and make enough profit to help her husband to organise their children's schooling.

name: Carlos Enrique
use: to purchase organic fertilizer and herbicides to apply to his corn crops as well as to pay the rent on his land.
texts:
Carlos has a high school education. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children, but only one of them is attending school. His partner makes her living selling products by catalog.

Carlos is a police officer. He has also been cultivating corn and millet since he was 12 years old. He learned farming from his mother.

He will use the loan to purchase organic fertilizer and herbicides to apply to his corn crops as well as to pay the rent on his land.

His greatest desire is to get his family ahead and purchase land to build his own home because he is currently living on his mother-in-law’s property.

name: Concepción Cruz
use: to buy more clothes to continue selling.
texts:
Concepción completed her studies through the third grade of school. She is married and her partner works as a security guard. Only one of their children lives with them, along with their daughter-in-law.

Concepción has made a living by selling clothes for 10 years. She learned this occupation out of the necessity to generate income. She goes out to sell all around the community from 9:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon.

The use of this loan is to buy more clothes to continue selling.

Her goals are to have a strong business, improve the conditions of her home, and to meet the basic needs of her family.

name: José David
use: to buy farming supplies and prepare the soil for planting staple grains.
texts:
José graduated high school. Now he is married and his wife is a homemaker. They do not have children yet.

José is a farmer. He has been in this business for 10 years, and he learned it because when he came home from school he would help his father with his work. His father was always strict about this, and now he is grateful because he can do the work the right way. His wife also works with him, helping him bring water and doing other light work.

This financing will be invested in buying farming supplies and preparing the soil for planting staple grains.

José's dream is to have his own house to live comfortably as their family grows.

name: Susana
use: to pay workers and buy agricultural supplies in order to plant staple grains.
texts:
Susana attended school until the ninth grade. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have a daughter who works as a secretary.

Susana is a housewife. She also grows and sells corn and beans in the town. She previously had a store, but got sick and couldn't continue in that job. She starts work at 6:00 a.m. and ends at 2:00 p.m.

She will invest the loan in paying workers and buying agricultural supplies to plant staple grains. She wants to continue on in her work in order to improve her family's earnings.

name: María Victoria
use: to buy agricultural supplies to plant corn so that with the earnings from the harvest she can move forward, as she is a single mother.
texts:
María is 39 years old. She is the single mother of two children who appear in the photograph with her. They are 8 and 6 years old, and she fights every day so that they lack nothing.

María works in agriculture. She plants cornfields every year in order to move forward with her children. The earnings from her work pay for their schooling costs, and to feed and clothe them. María's cornfield is approximately one half hectare in size. She saves part of the corn for her family's consumption, and sells the rest for income.

María needs the help of a loan to buy agricultural supplies to plant corn. With the earnings from her harvest she will move forward, as she is a single mother. The previous loan she received from Kiva allowed her to continue working. She paid of the debt punctually.

In the future she plans to see her children become good people. For that reason she will continue working and fighting for them.

name: Maria Asucena
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Maria Asucena is 69 years old and is widowed with four children. Maria Asucena works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Asucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maria Asucena has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maria Asucena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Calebasse De L Emergence 53 Group
use: to buy soaps and body lotion to sell.
texts:
"Calebasse de l émergence 53" is a group of ten women who live in the same district and are active traders. The group is represented by Aissata (who has her hand raised in the photo). She has been building up her business for more than three years, and she buys and sells cosmetics. She has already repaid a previous loan to the UIMCEC branch where she is a member.

She is now requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, which will be used to buy cosmetics (soaps, body lotions) as well as detergent (Omo) to resell. She contributes to the daily outgoings in her household. Her aim is to build up her business, increase her profits and save money. She intends to boost her shack with products in the future.

name: Srey Pov's Group
use: to buy fertilizer and more organic pesticide to improve her rice farm and gain a good yield.
texts:
Srey Pov is a 35-year-old woman from Preah Vihear Province with one school-aged child. She is growing rice and cassava, which is the main source of her family’s income. She has been farming for five years, and it has enabled her to save up about five US Dollars for her future needs.

For Srey Pov, this is her third loan cycle with VisionFund and she has already paid her past loans on time. The previous loans have helped her family with a decent home appliance.

In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to purchase more fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve her rice farmland so that it grows well. Srey Pov hopes that she can gain more yields than before via this loan.

name: Vevencia
use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
texts:
Vevencia is 67 years old, married and has six children.

Vevencia is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Vevencia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Vevencia has been farming sugarcane for 16 years now and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vevencia would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Daniel
use: to buy coffee plants, fertilizer and manure for planting.
texts:
Daniel is 37 years old and in a common law marriage. He has two children and lives with his family in a community in the town of Gracias, Lempira.

He has worked growing coffee for ten years. His farm is located on his property, and he sells in the community and in neighboring areas. He also grows staple grains for his family's consumption.

He is seeking a second cycle of loans from the institution in the amount of 10,000 lempiras that he will use to buy coffee plants, fertilizer and manure in order to plant on more land. This will allow him to obtain better earnings and improve his farm. His goal is to improve the quality of his crop and to plant more coffee.

name: Simón Pedro
use: to buy clothes in order to continue selling.
texts:
Simón attended school until the fifth grade. He is married, and has three children who are 8, 12 and 19 years old and are currently in school.

Simón is a businessman. He sells clothes in the market with his wife. He has approximately eight years' experience in his business. He is also a mason. He begins work at 6:00 a.m. and ends at 2:00 p.m.

He will invest the funds in buying clothes so that he can continue selling. He has received loans from Credicampo, and has paid off all of them punctually. His dreams are to continue working in order to provide a better quality of life to his family, and that his children stay in school.

name: Calebasse De L Emergence 43 Group
use: to buy fruit and shoes to sell.
texts:
"Calebasse de l émergence 43" is a group of ten women who live in the same neighborhood and are active traders. The group is represented by Adiara (who has her hand raised in the photo. She is married and has been building up a business for over five years. She sells a variety of fruits and shoes. Her work day begins at nine o'clock in the morning and finishes at four thirty in the afternoon.

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, which will be used to buy fruit and shoes for resale. Her aim is to build up her business, increase her profits, save money and boost her working capital in the future.

name: Eleuterio
use: to buy fertilisers for the coffee farm.
texts:
Eulaterio is 41 years old and is married with 3 children. He lives with his family in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has worked in agriculture all his life. He has had his own coffee farm for 7 years, which provides him with a better income. He sells this coffee both wet and dried in the same area.

The loan he is requesting is for the sum of 32,000 Lempiras, which he will use to buy fertilisers for the coffee farm, with the aim of having a better yield. His goal is to extend his coffee crops to make more income and help his family.

name: Juana Alicia
use: to buy rice, beans, corn, oil, and other items to stock her store.
texts:
Juana went to school until the 5th grade. Her husband is a farmer, and they have a son who lives on his own. She has a grandson living with her who is in the 1st grade.

For over 5 years, Juana has had a small store. She has this business in her home, and her husband helps her in his free time. They wait on customers from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm.

This financing will be invested in buying rice, beans, corn, oil, and other items to stock the store and improve sales. This will also give her grandson a better standard of living.

Her dream is to have a very prosperous business, and for her grandson to stay in school and have a professional career.

name: Santos Pablo
use: to buy everyday products to sell in his store.
texts:
Santos is married and his wife is a businesswoman. They have three daughters; one works and two are in school.

Santos makes a living farming and raising pigs. He learned this work from his father and he has many years of experience. He is also a driver and he has a store selling basic products.

He has now paid off his previous Kiva loan and he invested it in farming. He needs a new loan to buy everyday products to sell in his store.

His dream is for his daughters to have a good job in the future and for them to continue their education.

name: Prak's Group
use: to purchase more fertilizer and rice seed in order for her rice farmland to gain more yields.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

texts:
Prak is a rural villager from Preah Vihear Province where rice growing has been a common business in the area for 10 years. She is 63 years old and is also one of the breadwinners in her family, which consists of two schoolchildren. Because of the drought, her rice did not grow well this year, and that has been her main challenge.

Prak is leading a group of three members to apply for this loan with VisionFund as her first loan. As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan to buy more fertilizer and rice seed so that her rice farmland will gain good yield. With this loan, she hopes that her rice farm will produce more yields and earn her a good income so that she can improve her lifestyle and support her children’s education on time.

name: Roxana Carolina
use: to buy an industrial griddle for selling pupusas.
texts:
Roxana studied as far as 3rd grade of basic education. She has a partner and they have a son. Her partner works in agriculture. Roxana has been making a living selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, shredded pork, chicken, or refried beans] for about 5 years. She sells from 3:00 in the afternoon to 7:00 at night. As well as doing this she fattens pigs to sell.

The loan will be used to buy an industrial griddle for selling pupusas. Roxana wants to give her son the best education and hopes he will one day become a professional.

name: Rosali
use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labour for sowing basic grains.
texts:
Rosalí is 45 years old. His partner looks after the domestic tasks and he works in agriculture. He learnt from his father how to work the fields, from a young age. He also fattens pigs to sell. His day starts at 6:00 am and he finishes work at 3:00 pm.

Rosalí needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labour for sowing basic grains. In the past he has been helped by 2 Kiva loans and he paid them off very punctually. He wants to continue working for his family's wellbeing, so that they always have enough to eat.

name: Pablo
use: to buy another mill in order to provide services.
texts:
Pablo, 41 years old, is in a relationship, and his partner helps him around the house and with farming.

Pablo has a lot of experience as a farmer. He also raises cattle to sell. Another one of his jobs is providing services, since he has a mill.

He was supported with a loan in the past and he has almost repaid it. He needs a new loan to buy another mill in order to provide services.

He wants his family to be comfortable and therefore he will carry on with his projects.

name: Facilio
use: Facílio to buy construction material.
texts:
Facílio is 30 years old and an assistant at a railway company. He lives with his partner and is the father of three children ages 8, 6 and 4, of whom two are in the 3rd and 1st grades and the youngest is still too young for school. He also lives with a 16-year-old niece who is in the 8th grade. He lives in a house he owns.
He says that with this loan he intends to continue with the construction of his house, acquiring material like IBR sheet metal, doors, locks, bars, and boards to finish his house.
This is his third loan at Hluvuku; with the first loan he did blocks, and with the second he bought iron and other material and started the construction of his house.
His dream is to improve his living conditions and continue working without difficulties, to advance in his professional career, and to make his relationship official by getting married.

name: Reuben
use: to buy an eco-friendly stove.
texts:
Hello, Kiva Community! Meet Reuben (pictured above in his house), a hardworking dairy and crop-farming father in the heart of Nyahururu. He has a small personal business. He is a devoted father who loves cooking for his family and providing for their basic needs. However, he has not been enjoying his cooking duties due to his old, problematic stove (jiko). His jiko emits a lot of smoke and now takes more than a tin of charcoal, which has become quite costly, as has paraffin.

Reuben is requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly jiko to enjoy cooking for his family and save on costs of charcoal and paraffin. Because it's eco-friendly, the jiko will also keep him from contracting any respiratory diseases that may be caused by the increased fumes emitted by his current stove. Kindly lend to him!

name: Jose Ismael
use: to buy tools for bricklaying work.
texts:
José is 42 years old and is a farmer. He is single and has no children. He makes a living from agriculture and raising pigs. He is also learning the bricklaying trade. He has a building project which is a perimeter septic tank.

His previous Kiva loan helped him with agriculture and he paid the loan off very punctually. He needs a new loan to buy tools for bricklaying work. José wants to be a good bricklayer and to continue supporting his mother, who is of an advanced age.

name: Ann Bernadeth
use: to purchase additional stock of beauty products and other personal care products.
texts:
Ann Bernadeth is a 28-year-old, married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ann Bernadeth has a direct selling business in the Philippines. Ann Bernadeth requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of beauty products and other personal care products.

Ann Bernadeth has been in this business for 9 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Myla
use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.
texts:
Myla is a single 46-year-old woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Myla has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Myla requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Myla has been in this business for three years. In the future, Myla would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Durenagracia
use: to buy items to sell like lotion, shirts, shampoo, etc.
texts:
As a married parent of four children, Durenagracia works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of personal care products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Durenagracia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, shirts, shampoo, etc., for her buy-and-sell personal care products business.

Durenagracia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Vergilia
use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
texts:
Vergilia is 52 years old and a married woman. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Vergilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, toothpaste, etc., to sell in her store.

Vergilia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Vergilia would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Felisberta
use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like milk, soap, canned goods, eggs, etc.
texts:
Felisberta works hard to support her family. Felisberta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like milk, soap, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Felisberta has been in this business for 12 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

name: Elicha
use: Elicha to pay for travel to India.
texts:
Elicha is 30 years old and a teacher. In his spare time he makes a living in retail. He lives with his partner and is the father of a 4-year-old boy who is in preschool. He is responsible for four siblings who live in another neighborhood, and lives in a house he owns.
He says that with this loan he intends to pay the expenses for travel to India, where he he will go in order to buy hair to re-sell.
This is his fifth loan at Hluvuku; with the previous loans he bought merchandise for his business. He plans to continue asking for loans to continue with his business.
His dream is to do a master's degree in psychology and to be a great businessman.

name: Martin Onyango
use: to buy rice and green grams to give a variety of services.
texts:
Martin got married in the year 1996 and they are blessed with four children. He is a cereals seller and he has been doing this business for one year now.

He has been selling rice alone and his business has been doing well. He wants to add varieties of cereals to sell to grow his business income and give diverse services.

This is his second loan and his repayment history is encouraging. His dream is to become a large-scale cereals seller.

name: Engracia Zita
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Engracia Zita works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Engracia Zita requested a PHP 8,700 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Engracia Zita is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Marites
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Marites works hard to support her one child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Marites is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Nazia Bibi
use: to buy tailoring material for her husband's tailoring services to earn more income.
texts:
Nazia Bibi is 36 and is a mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. In the photo, she is sitting with her husband. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market. This is the only source of income for their family. He needs to purchase variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing and pools, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to their lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Nazia Bibi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the items he needs with the help of the loan. Nazia Bibi is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount.

Nazia Bibi is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

name: José Eriberto
use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, poisons etc. for growing basic grains.
texts: José studied as far as third grade at school. He is in a relationship and his partner looks after the domestic tasks and raises pigs, chickens and goats. He has 5 children, 3 of whom live elsewhere. Since he was a boy José has worked in agriculture. This is his main source of income and he needs the loan to buy seeds, fertiliser, poisons etc. for growing basic grains. José dreams of having an established stall where he can sell the grain he grows.

name: Junny Jay
use: to purchase materials needed to provide encoding and printing services.
texts:
Junny Jay is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez. He is 36 years old and living with his common-law wife.

To make a living, Junny Jay owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing encoding and printing services to the local community.

Junny Jay has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2016, Junny Jay joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve the living situation of the family and his ability to engage in business activities. Junny Jay is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Junny Jay from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

name: Merlinda
use: to buy fishing nets and fishing weights.
texts: Merlinda is from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She is married with three teenage children. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him by selling his catch. Like most people, Merlinda found her livelihood of fishing working alongside her husband. She is asking a loan to buy materials for fishing like fishing nets and fishing weights. Merlinda works hard because her children are attending school. Her income is for their education.

name: Gina
use: to buy supplies like sugar, drinks, noodles, salt, and canned goods.
texts:
5 years ago, Gina started a sari-sari (variety) store which she used to manage the economy of her house.

She sold various commodities ranging from noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, soap, and beverages.

She is a 40-year-old, married woman with four dependents between the ages of 7-20 years old.

Her husband engages in catering motorcycle services for a living.

It is her plan to continue to improve their quality of life, but right now she has shortage of funds to do bulk purchases to maintain the inventory of her shop.

Gina has applied for a loan from CEVI and will be using it to buy supplies like sugar, drinks, noodles, salt, and canned goods.

With these, she could start to save and be able to do some expansion.

She is hoping that someday she will become a successful entrepreneur and support the needs of her children as well.

name: Tana's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Tana’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Tana makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Tana safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: En
use: to buy fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee in order to improve her rice farmland.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

texts: En is 60 years old and grows rice as the main source of her income to support the family. She has been doing this for 20 years and it helps her to save about 5 US dollars per day for her future needs. Originally from the Preah Vihear province, she is married with one child. The price of rice has dropped since she's gotten into rice farming. It is her main challenge. This is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund. She has managed to repay her past loans and to improve her living conditions. En will use her loan to buy more fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee in order to support her rice farmland to gain good yield. With this loan, she hopes that she can gain a better yield from her farming than in previous years.

name: Rosemarie
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Rosemarie is 44 years old, married, and has four children.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Rosa
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Rosa works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Rosa is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.

name: Rosemarie
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Rosemarie works hard to support her two children. She is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.
