Rosemarie is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Roslyn
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts: Roslyn works hard to support her three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Roslyn requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.  Roslyn is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.

name: Sopheap's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Sopheap’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Sopheap works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sopheap safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Imrana
use: to purchase furniture for the students.
texts: 32 year old Imrana is a married woman who established a school in a small community. There are 109 students enrolled in the school and 50% of them are female students. The aim of the school is to ensure that children are helped in receiving quality education. These are paramount concerns of the teachers. Moreover in her school, children and teachers are encouraged to act with integrity. Presently, there is a lack of furniture compared to the number of students. She has requested PKR 100,000 for purchasing furniture for the students.

name: Dolores
use: buy items to sell like bread, personal care products, etc., to sell.
texts:
Dolores is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, personal care products, etc., to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

name: Dorothy
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.
texts:
Dorothy is 42 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Dorothy works very hard to provide for them.

Dorothy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Dorothy has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Dorothy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Mariana
use: to buy a quantity of women's clothing, as well as implements to begin offering manicure and pedicure services.
texts:
Mariana is a pretty young woman, 19 years of age, who has a one year old daughter. She is a gentle, carismatic, and simple person who works selling merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, accessories, etc. to generate income and provide quality of life for her child.

Mariana wants to request a loan to buy a quantity of women's clothing, and tools and supplies to offer manicure and pedicure services. She hopes that, with this loan, her sales will improve, and that the manicure service will represent very good income to improve her quality of life.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Amihan
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
Amihan is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amihan is 46 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Amihan has a food vending business in the Philippines. Amihan requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Amihan has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Amihan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Chili
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Chili is 42 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Chili works very hard to provide for them.

Chili runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Chili has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Chili would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Rohana
use: to purchase chips, noodles, canned goods,  beverages, biscuits and shampoo to sell.
texts: Rohana, aged 56, is a separated mother of four children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village and earns a net income of PHP 10,000 to purchase items for her general store to sell. Due to insufficient capital on her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase chips, noodles, canned goods,  beverages, biscuits and shampoo to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

name: Chanthy Group
use: to purchase farming materials to grow more cassava.
texts:
This is a group of three members represented by Chanthy, who appears on the far right. She is 47 years old and living with her husband and only one child in the district in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She and her husband have been cultivating rice and cassava to support their life expenses.

As the group leader, she is going to use her loan share to purchase farming materials to grow more cassava. She believes this purchase will help to increase production as well as her profits. In the future, she wants to enlarge her farmland and to renovate her house.

name: Reem
use: to pay her child's necessary medical operation expenses.
texts: Reem is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She prepares and sells mouneh to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Due to her limited income, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's necessary medical operation expenses. She hopes to stay capable of providing for her family with better living conditions.

name: Ron's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: Ron’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Ron makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Ron safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Farhana
use: to repair the building and construct more classrooms in the school.
texts:
Farhana is a 30-year-old married woman who initiated a school two years ago. There are 99 students enrolled in the school and 53% of them are female students.

Farhana realized that there are many low-performing schools available in the community; therefore she started this school with the aim of providing affordable yet high quality education to students living in her community.

Currently the building of the school needs repair and maintenance. Moreover, construction of additional classrooms is another need. Due to lack of funds, Farhana is unable to fulfil these needs.

She has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 to repair the building repaired and construct more classrooms in the school.

name: Alice
use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.
texts:
Wonderful Kiva lenders,

Get to know Alice! Alice is very hardworking. She hails from a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya. This area has tough living conditions and to survive you must have tough skin. Alice, amongst the women of Kericho, has defied the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past six years. Her primary sources of income are poultry, vegetables, crops and animal farming.

Alice is content with the farming way of life. The Kericho area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming and that is why Alice is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of the good roads, a good climate and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Alice, together with her family, is so grateful for your help and contribution.

name: Asdrubal De Jesus
use: to buy corn to increase production of arepas.
texts:
Asdrubal is an entrepreneur, 34 years old, who makes and sells arepas, a traditional corn pancake that is widely sold and eaten daily in Antioquía.

He has four employees, a developed unit of production, and a defined clientele. He is an entrepreneur who has given his all to increase his business.

Asdrubal's principal dream is to buy a house and live there in tranquility with his family.

He requests a loan to buy corn in large quantities in order to increase production and extend distribution to more locations.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Johalmo Antonio
use: to buy cattle to raise and later sell.
texts:
Johalmo is 36 years old. He is married and has 2 children who attend the community school.

Johalmo works in agriculture, an activity he has done since he was a boy. He learned it from his father. In addition to that, he cares for his cattle for the purpose of selling.

He previously received a Kiva loan for agriculture and paid it on time. He needs a new loan to buy cattle to raise for later sale.

He dreams of having a lot of cattle and giving them good care to they develop well.

name: Randa
use: to pay her necessary medical treatment expenses.
texts: Randa is a 47-year-old married woman who makes crochet and crafts to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her necessary medical treatment expenses. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

name: Vanak's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.
texts:
Vanak’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Vanak works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Vanak safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sajida
use: for construction, purchasing computers and furniture for her students.
texts: Sajida a 43-year-old woman who has been running a school in a low-income community for six years. There are 200 students enrolled in the school and 43% of them are female students. The aim of her school is to help the students to utilize their caliber and skills in the most constructive way. Sajida says that educating the youth means converting them into responsible citizens. She wants her students to make productive use of information technology but there is an absence of computers in the school. Additional rooms and furniture is another unfulfilled need of the school. She has requested an amount of PKR 100,000 for construction, purchasing computers and furniture for her students.

name: Eliyas
use: for the construction of washrooms in the school.
texts: Eliyas is a 23-year-old man who has been running a low-cost private school for four years. There are 134 students enrolled in the school and 40% of them are female students. The primary goal of the school is to provide affordable high-quality education to the under-privileged students. The children are prepared to meet challenges which lie ahead. Currently there is shortage of washrooms. Eliyas has requested an amount of PKR. 100,000 for the construction of washrooms in the school.

name: Zobia
use: pay for the construction of classrooms in the school.
texts:
Zobia is a 34-year-old married woman who has been running a school. The aim of the school is to provide a balanced and creative curriculum to the students, which would help them to achieve sustainable and appropriate academic grounding.

Currently, due to shortage of rooms, the classrooms are quite over-populated, which is a hindrance to effective learning. Zobia has planned to construct more classrooms, but it requires a huge investment, and therefore she has requested a loan of PKR 80,000 for the construction of classrooms in the school.

name: Plinky
use: to purchase assorted ingredients like banana, cooking oil and other materials needed for her business.
texts:
Plinky is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Plinky has a food vending business in the Philippines. Plinky requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase assorted ingredients like banana, cooking oil and other materials needed for her business.

Plinky has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Ramona
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.
texts:
Ramona is 56 years old and is married with three children. Ramona works very hard to provide for them.

Ramona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Ramona has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ramona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Mae
use: to buy fertilizers, a new variety of seeds, and other farm supplies.
texts:
Mae is 56 years old, married, and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, a new variety of seeds, and other farm supplies.

Mae has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Perla
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Perla works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a a sanitary toilet.

Perla is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Mariela Yaneth
use: to buy pigs, and concentrated feed and vitamins for them.
texts:
Mariela studied up to high school. She is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture.

For three years, Mariela has worked raising pigs. She decided to start this business to help her partner with the expenses of the household. She cares for the animals at her house. Previously she worked promoting health in their district.

She needs the loan to buy pigs, and concentrated feed and vitamins for them.

Her dream is that her son will become a professional.

name: Vanieza
use: to purchase more ingredients for fish balls and tempura, cooking oil, and butane.
texts:
Vanieza is a food vendor from the town of Dumanjug. She sells street food like fish balls and tempura (a light batter is made with cold water; sometimes sparkling water is used to keep the batter light), eggs, baking soda or baking powder, starch, oil, and/or spices may also be added.

She is married and has two-school-aged children.

She would like to improve her earnings by purchasing more ingredients for fish balls and tempura, cooking oil, and butane. In this way, she would be able to increase her supplies, thus augment her earnings.

Vanieza is hoping that she could make her business sustainable for the welfare of her growing children.

name: Loeut's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.
texts:
Loeut’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Loeut makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Loeut safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Doreen
use: to pay tuition fees for her children.
texts:
Doreen is an ambitious woman from Chuka, a lush, maize-producing area in the central region of Kenya. She is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and take on new challenges. These qualities have propelled her to become one of the most respected farmers in her village. She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm.

Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to Doreen’s heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has a high nutritional value. She is so keen and close with her cows that she has named them. They make her feel very proud and fulfilled.

Doreen is seeking a loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to pay school fees for her children. She believes that the knowledge and skills her children will get through school will help them have a brighter future.

name: Jimena
use: to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
Jimena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old.

Jimena has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her business.

Jimena has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Marianita
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Marianita is 60 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marianita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marianita has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Merilyn
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Merilyn is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a a sanitary toilet.

Merilyn knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Geraldine
use: to purchase assorted stock like  t-shirts, pants, shorts, and other ready-to-wear to sell.
texts:
Geraldine is a married woman, aged 40 years, with eight children, five of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Geraldine has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase assorted stock like t-shirts, pants, shorts, and other ready-to-wear to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

name: Mercy
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Mercy works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Mercy requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Mercy is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Sreynak Group
use: to purchase vegetable seeds for growing.
texts:
As a resident in the village of Kampong Cham province of Cambodia, Mrs. Sreynak, 37, is a married mother of two school aged children. She is a farmer and has been working in the cassava and vegetable farm with her husband to make profits to support a living.

Sreynak appears on the right in the photo and is representing the group of two members. She is going to use her loan share to purchase vegetable seeds for growing. She sees this purchase will allow her to increase her crop yields as well as her family profits.

With the profits from this season’s harvesting, Sreynak wants to expand her farm, build a bigger house and to help her children go to college.

name: Nadia
use: for purchasing computers and furniture for the computer lab in school.
texts: Nadia is a 31-year-old married woman who established a low-cost school 4 years ago with the help of her husband (shown in the photo). There are 206 students enrolled in the school and 43% of them are female students. The aim of the school is to engage the staff in rigorous self-evaluation which would ultimately bring excellence in their teaching process. Moreover for building children’s confidence they are given chance to be involved in extracurricular activities. Nadia is planning to construct a computer lab for her students. However she is unable to do so due to lack of funds. She has requested an amount of PKR. 150,000 for purchasing computers and furniture for the computer lab in school.

name: Yesica Paola
use: to buy high-end cell phones and accessories like headphones, cases, protectors, screen protectors, and others.
texts:
Yesica is 24 years old and the single mother of two children, ages seven and two. They have given her life an extraordinary turn. Her love and devotion to these children are the driving force that leads her to seek opportunities that allow her to improve her quality of life and guarantee them a promising future.

She started her business of selling cell phones and accessories in the year 2014. An important factor in her business is staying up to date with the technology and accessories. She needs investment capital to back up her projects. That is why she found a Kiva loan, the opportunity to be involved in the financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She does this in order to buy high-end cell phones and accessories such as headphones, cases, protectors, screen protectors, and more.

Her goal is to grow in her business and to open branches. Please support her loan.

name: Maria Astred
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Maria Astred works hard to support her seven children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Astred requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Maria Astred is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Melba
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Melba works hard to support her one child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Melba is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.

name: Julita
use: to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her bicycle transport business.
texts:
As a married woman, Julita works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Julita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her bicycle transport business.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Tomas
use: to purchase organic fertilizer.
texts:
Tomas wants to expand his farm in the future. He helps his wife by working on their own farm in order to earn a living. He has been doing this since he got married.

Recently, Tomas took a new loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy seeds and fertilizer for banana production in order to earn more income.

In the future, Tomas wants to expand their farm as well as improve the general living conditions for the entire family.

name: Sreymom Group
use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.
texts:
Sreymom, 32, is a married mother of three school-aged children residing in the village in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She and her husband are construction workers and have been working in this field for the past seven years to make profits to support the family’s living. This couple typically makes around 15US$ per day.

In order to save money from traveling costs, she is now asking for a loan with a group of four members and would like to use her share of the loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work. In the future, she wants to be a construction foreman, to renovate her house, and help her children to get a collage education to have a good job.

name: Sreypov
use: to renovate her husband's three-wheel motor cab.
texts:
Sreypov is married and lives with her husband and 3 children in Kean Svey District, Kandal Province of Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband has been a three-wheel taxi driver for 5 years.

Sreypov wishes to renovate her husband's three-wheel motor cab and also refill land in front her house. She does not have enough money to do this.

She decided to apply for a loan from Maxima Microfinance Plc. She will use this loan to renovate her huband's three-wheel motor cab.

name: Simon Karanja
use: for adding stock of soft drinks and onions to serve his customers better.
texts: Simon is a happily married man with 2 children. He is a shopkeeper and supports his family very much. He runs a general shop where he sells groceries, foodstuffs and general household goods, and he likes serving people. His clients describe his as a humble honest man who is always cheerful. To expand his business, he is requesting a loan to add stock of onions and soft drinks as they are fast moving. This is his third loan cycle and he pays well in time. His dream is to be a great businessman and educate his children to university.

name: Sohail
use: to purchase an air conditioner and books and uniforms for the students.
texts:
Sohail is a 46-year-old man who started running a school. Due to his vast experience, parents of the students have faith in Sohail’s abilities as a school administrator.

There are 118 students enrolled in the school and 53% of them are female students. The aim of the school is to provide a supportive environment for the students and help them meet the challenges faced by them in all phases of their lives.

Along with providing a better education, Sohail feels that a comfortable environment must be provided to the students and he wishes to purchase an air conditioner for the activity room in the school. He has requested PKR. 100,000 for purchasing the AC and for purchasing books and uniforms for the students.

name: Sobia
use: to purchase furniture for the school.
texts:
Sobia is a 41-year-old married woman who started running a school. There are 136 students enrolled in the school belonging to economically disadvantaged families. 52% of them are female students.

The aim of the school is to give an equal opportunity to students for achieving quality education, irrespective of their social background.

However there are few challenges faced by her, such as the lack of furniture in the school. She has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 for purchasing the furniture for the school.

name: Shamim
use: to purchase furniture and computers for the computer lab.
texts:
Shamim is a 32-year-old woman. She established a school, in a small community having a large number of under-privileged children, with the aim of providing the students quality education irrespective of their family's financial status.

There is a total enrolment of 156 students in the school and 46% are female. Shamim ensures that skills taught in the school help the students to achieve highly in their careers. She hopes her students will gain problem solving skills in order to make their lives easier at every stage.

Furthermore, she is planning to help the students gain computer skills. However, she is short of cash to construct a computer lab in the school. She has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 to purchase furniture and computers for the computer lab.

name: Savy's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Savy’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Savy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Savy safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Diana Marcela
use: to buy fingerling fish and feed for them.
texts:
Diana is a 30 year old farmer. She lives with her spouse and their 6 children in the town of Nariño.

She and her spouse are responsible and loving parents who want the best for their children, to give them an education and a dignified life.

Diana raises fish. Today she is coming to the Kiva community to ask for financial help to buy fingerling fish and concentrate to feed them.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Benard
use: to pay tuition fees for his children.
texts:
Meet Benard, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest father. He hails from the Bomet area of Kenya. He is a proud father. He loves and treasures his children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Benard’s primary sources of income have come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures, he has been able to earn a decent income. He is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for ten years, and throughout, he has never regretted going into farming.

This humble farmer has been making profits, but not everything has been a bed of roses. He still faces financial challenges in educating his children. He is kindly seeking a loan to pay school fees for his children.

Benard has a strong conviction that, through the loan, his children will have a brighter future because education is the key to success.

Support this hardworking farmer by granting him a loan, so that his children can have a proper education. He counts on help from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders.

name: Marcela
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts: Marcela works hard to support her eight children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Marcela requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to invest in a a SANITARY TOILET.  Marcela is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Lelio Andres
use: to buy seeds for 1,000 cacao trees, and chemical and organic fertilizers to maintain them.
texts:
This is Lelio, a young man who wants to succeed as a farmer. He has come to the Kiva community seeking financial support to buy seeds for 1,000 cacao trees, and chemical and organic fertilizers to maintain them.

The reason for the loan is his desire to be financially independent and bring his household a better standard of living.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Elma
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Elma is 36 years old and single with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Elma has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Ma. Lyn
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Ma. Lyn works hard to support her two children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Lyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Ma. Lyn is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.

name: Normalyne
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.
texts:
Normalyne is 61 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Normalyne has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from a fish pond.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

name: Abdullah
use: to pay for construction and getting the walls of the school painted.
texts:
Abdullah is a 44-year-old married man who established a low-cost private school eight years ago. There are 86 students enrolled in the school, and 47% of them are female students.

The aim of his school is to provide students with an exciting and rich curriculum. Students are converted into independent and motivated individuals.

Abdullah wants to construct an additional room in the school to cater to more students and help them achieve education. However, there is a shortage of funds.

He has requested an amount of PKR 200,000 to pay for construction and getting the walls of the school painted.

name: Noeun's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Noeun’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Noeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Noeun safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sopheary's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Sopheary’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sopheary works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sopheary safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Janier
use: to buy the needed agricultural supplies; poultry manure, compost, chemicals, and seed treatment to sustain his crops.
texts:
Janier learned about working in the fields together with his parents. He currently works on family land where he has 'criolla' potatoes and 'capira' potatoes. He is single, and he does not have children. He lives in the Sonson municipality.

He has extensive experience in agriculture. He is honest, diligent, and responsible. He distributes his products to wholesalers.

Janier wants to request a loan to buy the agricultural supplies needed to sustain his crop. He will buy chicken manure, compost, chemicals, and seed treatment.

His objective with this loan is to improve his productivity and to increase his earnings.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Yomar Andres
use: to buy fertilizer and materials for his coffee crop. These will help him sustain and increase the yields on his land.
texts:
Yomar is 19 years old. She is taking his first steps as an entrepreneur in the world of agriculture. He learned this activity from his parents and today he does it with dedication and pride.

He started his activity seeking financial independence. Now he works on a family land parcel and his long term plan is to have his own farm with hectares to grow coffee.

Yomar wants to buy fertilizer and materials for his coffee crop. These will help him to sustain and increase his yields on his land.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Gina
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Gina works hard to support her three children. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Gina is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting protection of the environment .

name: Jennifer
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Jennifer is 33 years old and has two children. She is married, and has two children who are in school.

Jennifer is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jennifer has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Jocelyn
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Jocelyn works hard to support her one child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to invest in a a sanitary toilet.

Jocelyn is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Fausta
use: to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
Fausta is a married woman with five children. She is 62 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fausta has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Fausta requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies needed in her business.

Fausta has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Joma
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Joma is 54 years old, married and has eight children.

Joma is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Joma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Joma has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joma would like to expand her business.

name: Cristy
use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Cristy is 32 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living through a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cristy is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cristy has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Genara
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Genara is 65 years old and widowed with three children. Genara works very hard to provide for them.

Genara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Genara has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Genara would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Joel Sr.
use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor cost.
texts:
Joel is married, 46 years old, has 3 children; 2 were already married and 1 was in school.

Aside for being a private guard, he also engages in vegetable planting. His wife sells different kinds of vegetables and spices in the local market.

He availed a loan in the amount of php18,000 for the purchase of fertilizer and for the labor cost in land preparation.

Joel said that their house is now dilapidated, and he plans to improve it if he has a good harvest.

name: Reman
use: to buy a laptop for her study.
texts: Reman, who appears in the photo, is a 19 year old from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip. She is studying Dental and Oral Surgery at a local university; she tries so hard to excel in her study. Her father works in the public sector where he earns a low income; this income is barely enough for the basic needs and Reman's university costs. For that, Reman went to Palestine for Credit and Development FATEN to request a  US Dollar loan to buy a laptop for her study, to do research and homework. She hopes you will help and fund her loan.

name: Soaphy's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Soaphy’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Soaphy works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Soaphy safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Lydia Nasaka
use: to add used clothing stock to grow her business capital.
texts:
Lydia is a lady, happily married to a man called Erick. They are blessed with 1 child called Lyric, who is 13 years old.

Her husband is a technician, and they both support their parents. She sells used clothing for a living, and has been doing this business for many years. Her clients like her clothes, since they are affordable, classy and durable. She is known to be very respectful as well.

She is requesting a loan to add a stock of used clothing to grow her business capital.

This is her second loan cycle, and she pays on time.

Her dream is to grow her business and build rental houses on her plot.

name: Bornes
use: to pay school fees for her children.
texts:
Bornes (pictured above) is a poor, rural, small-holder crop farmer in the Litein area of Kenya. She produces dairy and poultry products in addition to crops. Bornes has been blessed with six children.

Bornes is seeking a loan to pay school fees for her children. With the borrowed money, she plans to clear the balance she owes so that her children won't be sent away from school due to non-payment of fees.

Bornes’s dream is to be able to give her children a good education and enable them to realize their goals.

You can be part of this dream by giving a loan. Be inspired and support a Kenyan small-holder woman!

name: Rashid
use: to buy additional furniture to expand his school.
texts:
Rashid a 33 year old man is a devoted administrator of the school which was established by him 4 years ago in a low-income community. There are 203 students enrolled in the school and 43% are female students. The aim of his school is to make the students well-prepared for employment and adulthood. Moreover students are encouraged to develop respect for beliefs of others.

At present there is scarcity of furniture and classrooms in the school. He has requested an amount of PKR 100, 000 which would enable him to buy furniture for the school to provide educational services to additional students.

name: Sanin
use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her rice farmland to gain more yields.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chey Sen District

texts:
Sanin is aged 30 years, and living in Preah Vihear province. She is a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is still in school and the other one is too young.

To make a living, she is growing rice and cassava. Moreover, she is working for others for a fee to supplement her income. Sanin has been with her current business for 12 years, and it has allowed her to keep up about 8 USD per day for future needs.

The insects have destroyed her rice, so she could not get a good yield. This is Sanin's first time with VisionFund, and she will spend her loan to purchase more fertilizer and organic pesticide to put into her rice farmland so it will grow well.

She hopes that her rice farming can produce more yield than before, with good income, and she can support her child’s education graduation on time.

name: Salvacion
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other snack foods.
texts:
Salvacion is 47 years old, widowed, with 6 children.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other snack foods.

Salvacion has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Salvacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

name: Eric
use: to buy feed.
texts:
Eric is 34 years old. He lives in Malabuyoc, Cebu. He is married with two children, ages eight and ten.

He support his family by raising hogs. This is how he has spent most of his days for 11 years now.

Eric is asking for a loan to buy more feed.

In the future, he hopes to live in comfort from the income coming from his business.

His profit is also responsible for the education expense of his children.

name: Elba Lilian
use: to buy an industrial iron to make and sell tortillas more efficiently.
texts:
Elba managed to graduate as a teacher from university. She is in a common law relationship and has 3 children.

She works as a teacher and also makes tortillas for sale. When she goes to school she travels more than 4 kilometers on foot.

She needs a loan to buy an industrial iron to make and sell tortillas more efficiently.

She wants to teach her children good values and help them become good professionals.

name: Nuevo Futuro Group
use: to buy oil, chicken and potatoes.
texts: This is the “NUEVO FUTURO” group, made up of 5 members. They want to improve their quality of life. This is the case of Maria, aged 47. She is single. She sells broaster chicken and hamburgers. She has been working at this business for approximately 10 years, and it is going well for her. Her biggest wish is to be able to expand her locale. She has asked for the loan to buy oil, chicken, and potatoes. The members of the “Nuevo Futuro” group are grateful to the Kiva investors for the support given. María is first from the left and she is wearing a white t-shirt.

name: Zarina
use: to buy welding materials for her son's blacksmith shop and earn more income for his entire family.
texts:
Zarina is a 49-year old married woman, living near Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four and equally responsible for all of them. She sits with her son in the picture. She belongs to an ultra poor family, that is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all her children.

Her son owns a blacksmith shop in which he manufactures iron accessories such as door, windows, tables etc. He also provides door to door services to his customers. Due to an increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as welding rods, soldering rods etc to carry on his business. To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise efficiently he needs some capital to buy welding materials.

Zarina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son so that he would be able to buy the kind of iron rods needed to carry on his business.

Zarina is very glad and thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

name: Marites
use: to buy garments and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
Marites is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who is 36 years old with three children who are still in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Needing to buy garments and other supplies for her business, she has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF.

Marites has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

name: Grace
use: to purchase organic fertilizer & cover the cost of motorcycle maintenance.
texts:
Aside from the retail (general store) business, Grace is also engaged in planting & harvesting coconuts for sale. Over many years of running her business, she has been able to improve the living condition of her family.

She has repaid successfully her previous loan used to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store. Now, she is taking a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for the coconuts and to use a portion of the loan proceeds to cover the cost of motor maintenance. She is hopeful for a good harvest in the near future.

name: Saboat
use: for the celebration of the birth of a grandchild.
texts:
This is Saboat who is 47 and lives in Dushanbe town with her husband and three daughters. She is a responsible and hospitable woman who is pleasant to talk to. Her husband is currently working in Russia so he can earn money to feed his family. Saboat works sewing women's clothing to order, a business she has had for more than four years.

She is looking for a loan because she wants to celebrate the birth of grandchild. Saboat wants to host a holiday and invite guests, as this is a tradition in her family.

name: Chhoeuy's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Chhoeuy’s Group members live in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Chhoeuy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Chhoeuy safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Maqsoodan
use: to buy material for making traditional hand made fans.
texts:
Maqsood is 39 and mother of four children. She knows the art of making handicrafts and can make traditional colorful fans that are used for decoration as well as use in Multan to beat the summer heat. She uses wooden sticks, threads and beads to make the fans and embellishes them.

She is happy to have an art that helps her earn bread for her family.

She has approached BRAC Pakistan to get a loan in order to increase production. This way she can have better income.

She is planning to increase her outreach of clients and hopes her art will help her make a name in her community.

name: Rhalene
use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.
texts: Rhalene is a single woman, 30 years old with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Rhalene has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Rhalene requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.  Rhalene has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Florenda
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts: Florenda is 46 years old and has five children. Florenda is married and has two children who are still in school.  Florenda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Florenda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.  Florenda has been in this business for 27 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Florenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Im
use: to spend on plowing fee in order to support her rice farm to grow well.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

texts:
A resident from Preah Vihear province, Im is 35 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. To improve her family’s living, she is growing rice and some kind of vegetables to sell in her village for 10 years. She could not sell her rice on the market with good price because it did not grow well, it is her main challenge.

Im has been with VisionFund for third loan cycles, including this one. She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. She will manage her loan to spend on plowing fee in order to support her rice farmland to grow with good yield. Im hopes that this loan can help her rice farming produce higher yield than before, so she can gain her income to support her children’s education.

name: Chanthy's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Chanthy’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Chanthy works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Chanthy safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Rosaura
use: to buy broiler chickens and foodstuff for them.
texts:
The borrower is Rosaura, a 64-year-old single mother living in the municipality of Nariño who gets her daily sustenance from her poultry breeding business. She is a humble person, living happily with what she has.

Rosaura joins the Kiva community requesting economic support allowing her to buy broiler chickens and foodstuff for them. Her dream is to renovate her home, ensure freedom from want, and be healthy enough to go to work every day.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Jocelyn
use: to buy water filter.
texts: Jocelyn works hard to support her two children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Jocelyn requested a PHP 2200 loan through NWTF to invest in a a WATER FILTER.  She is getting the water filter because she wants to provide her family a clean water to drink.  Jocelyn is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Roteli
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts: Roteli is 52 years old and has three children. Roteli is married woman.  Roteli is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Roteli requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.  Roteli has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Roteli would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Cecelia
use: to buy seasoning, toiletries, food flavorings and canned goods.
texts: Cecelia  is a 54-year-old, married woman from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She sell snacks and she also own a Sari-sari store business in her place. Cecelia is motivated to improve her livelihood because of the presence of demand in the area. She is asking a loan to buy more merchandise like seasoning, toiletries, food flavorings and canned goods. Cecelia is future-oriented and wanted to secure her future needs when she is older. Currently, the income from her business provide her with the need to pay the bills and daily food consumption.

name: Jocelyn
use: to buy bond paper, ink, hard disks and for maintenance of her computers.
texts: Jovelyn is 54 years old, married with four children. To help her husband providing their needs she involve in managing an internet café in their town for 24 years. She’s enjoying managing and to continue improving this business she would like to avail a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy bond paper, ink, hard disk and for maintenance of her computers. Through this loan her computers will work well and she can continue give good service to her customers.

name: Arquímides
use: to buy pigs and foodstuffs to fatten and sell them at a good price.
texts:
Arquímides studied up to high school. His partner is a housewife, and they have a 6-year-old son. He works in farming and breeds pigs, having learned about pet care from his uncle. As for agriculture, Arquímides plants basic grains such as corn, beans, and coffee.

He will invest the loan in buying pigs and also foodstuffs to fatten and sell them at a good price. Arquímides's dream is to become an expert breeder of pigs with a better farm.

name: Karina Luz
use: to buy chairs, tables, cabinets, freezer, improvements to the premises, and other inputs to start running a restaurant.
texts:
Karina is a 39-year-old single mother who joins the Kiva community to request a loan to start a new restaurant business. The loan request is born out of her desire to succeed and give her family of three children a better life and possibilities of higher education studies.

The amount requested will be to buy what Karina is missing to start her business sooner, such as chairs, tables, cabinets, freezer, and improvements to the premises. She will use the rest in inputs to start running it.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

name: Praxede
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.
texts:
Praxede is 63 years old and a widow with four children. She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Praxede has been raising cattle for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Carmela
use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.
texts:
Carmela is 48 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Carmela has operated a motorcycle for hire for many years, which transports passengers to and from the neighboring places. She also engages in cottage renting.

Carmela joined GDMPC in 2015, and has been an active member until this moment. Now she is taking a loan to the amount of only PHP 20,000 for the purchase of spare parts needed for her motorcycle.

She also plans to improve and renovate her cottage.

name: Marivic
use: to buy a pressure pump, faucet, PVC-elbow, bushing and other materials needed in building a water system.
texts:
Marivic is 55 years old and a single mother of two children. When her husband died, she was already involved in managing a grocery store where she offers a variety of groceries to her neighbors. This been their source of everyday food for two years and, as an additional source of income, she is involved in the hog raising business.

To access clean water, Marivic is requesting a loan of PHP 28,000 to buy a pressure pump, faucet, PVC-elbow, bushing and other materials needed in building a water system. She is very grateful for the opportunity to avail this loan.

name: Rath's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Rath’s group live in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Rath makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Rath safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Rosita
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Rosita is 55 years old and married, and she has one child.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

name: Lynlin
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
As a married parent of five children, Lynlin works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lynlin is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Lynlin has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Luningning
use: to buy additional piglets as well as sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Luningning is 40 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are presently in school.

Luningning is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Luningning requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets as well as sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Luningning has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luningning would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Conchita
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Conchita is 25 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Conchita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Conchita has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Yolanda
use: to buy more fresh fish to sell and other materials needed, including plastic bags and boxes for her fish.
texts:
As a married parent of two children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell and other materials needed, including plastic bags and boxes for her fish.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

name: Demetre
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Demetre is 57 years old, married and has nine children.

Demetre is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Demetre requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Demetre has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Demetre would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Rosalita
use: to buy stock for her store, such as soft drinks, cooking oil, canned goods, diapers, and biscuits.
texts:
Rosalita is a sari-sari store owner from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She is a single woman who thinks of her future. She works hard in her store to support her daily needs. Rosalita is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of merchandise for her store, such as bottled water, soft drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits.

Rosalita believes that with financial support through a loan, she can finally purchase the necessary stocks for her business, to improve her inventory. In the future, Rosalita believes that through this opportunity she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her more income.

name: Virginia
use: to buy feed for her pigs.
texts:
From Malabuyoc, Cebu, Virginia is a 63-year-old woman who is engaged in raising hogs. This is her business for 11 years now. She has requested a loan to buy feed so she can be assured of its healthy growth and better profit.

In the future, Virginia would like to make her barn bigger to accommodate more pigs and make it more successful and profitable.

name: Mousa
use: to buy spare parts for his work and goods that are needed.
texts:
Mousa, who appears in the photo, is a 30-year-old man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip. He is a father of two adorable kids; he tries so hard to raise them in the best conditions and cover all their needs. He works in repair of electronics and electrical appliances such as washing machines and refrigerators. It's the only source of income for the family.

He went to Palestine for Credit and Development FATEN to request a US dollar to buy spare parts for his work and goods that he needed. He hopes you will help and fund his loan.

name: Kong
use: to expand her rice farmland in order to get higher yields than before.

location.town: Prey Veng province, Kamchay Mear district

texts:
A widowed mother blessed with six children, Kong is 46 years old and lives with her children in Prey Veng province. Nowadays, she needs to support three children, one of whom is still in school and one of whom has not yet begun. Growing rice is the single main source of her family’s income.

Kong has been involved with farming for many years, and she can save about 5 US dollars per day. This is Kong’s second loan cycle with VisionFund, and she paid her past loan back on time. Her family conditions have improved, due to the previous loan. Kong will use this loan to expand her farmland in order to increase her rice yields. She hopes that she can get a higher yield so she can improve her family's living conditions and support her children’s education.

name: Ie's Group
use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers for his farming.
texts:
Ie is a widower who is living with his one child in Koh Krorlor district, Battambang province, Cambodia.

He is 55 years old and a farmer who has been growing rice for almost eight years. Through this job he can earn about 26,000 KHR each day, and he is able to save about 15,000.

As his crops were threatened by insects and drought, he couldn’t gain a good yield as before. Now he is leading his group to request a loan via VisionFund. He will use this loan to buy more seeds and fertilizers for his farming. He hopes this loan will help him to improve his living conditions.

name: Chanthy's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Chanthy’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Chanthy works as a factory worker and makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Chanthy safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sophath's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Sophath’s group live in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Sophath makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. He has one daughter in her family. In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Sophath safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Cristy
use: to buy more fresh fish to sell, and materials including plastic bags and boxes for her fish.
texts: Cristy is a single woman, 44 years old, with four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cristy requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell, and materials including plastic bag and boxes for her fish. Cristy has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Ritchelle
use: to purchase additional materials to make baskets to sell.
texts:
As a married parent of four children, Ritchelle works hard to support her family.

She has a basket-making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending and a general store.

Ritchelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials to make baskets to sell.

Ritchelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Umeda
use: to pay for her sister's treatment and buy medicines.
texts:
This is Umeda, who was born in 1990. She is a very kind and responsible woman, who is married and has three children: two daughters and a son. Her husband works as an ordinary worker for a low income and she needed to work and earn money for their living.

Umeda is a seamstress. She sews a variety of clothes and she has regular customers. She has been working for eight years in this sphere.

She loves her sister very much. Unfortunately, her sister needed medical treatment and expensive drugs, so Umeda must take care of her. Umeda wants to get a loan so that she can pay for her sister's treatment and buy medicines.

Umeda is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS for this purpose. She is a returning client and has positive credit history. She is asking for a loan for the third time with Kiva’s Field Partner IMON.

She awaits your support and compassion.

name: Las Estrellitas Group
use: to buy materials to make furniture.
texts:
Rosa María, 37 years old, has a 7-year-old son and is a member of the group "Las Estrellitas" [The Little Stars], formed by nine members. A few years ago, she set up a business selling furniture in melamine, glass, and drywall. She works every day for around 9 to 10 hours. Her mother encouraged her in the venture since she has a sister who runs a glassworks studio and is doing very well. Rosa María then got motivated and started the business, feeling very proud of the achievements since she has been able to grow fast and have a fixed income for her family.

Rosa María will invest the loan received in the purchase of materials to make furniture in melamine.

name: Mom's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Mom’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Mom safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Sona's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Sona’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Sona makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sona safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Chariya's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Chariya’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia.

Chariya makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Chariya safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Salomón
use: to purchase more basic grains to continue selling.
texts:
Salomón completed his basic education through 2nd grade, is married, and his wife takes care of the household tasks. His 3 children live with them.

Salomón works selling basic grains. He has been doing this work for 10 years and it is his primary source of income.

Salomón needs a loan to purchase more basic grains to continue selling.

He plans in the future to have a warehouse where he can store a larger quantity of basic grains to meet his customers' demand.

name: Maria Luciana
use: to purchase motorcycle parts and tools with which she does her work.
texts:
Maria is 50 years old, married, has two children, and lives with her family in a sector of La Esperanza. She has a business selling parts and repairing motorcycles and bicycles. This business has been located in a rented space for 28 years and currently she has the help of her children. She asks for her sixth loan cycle with the institution for the amount of 24,000 lempiras to purchase motorcycle parts and tools with which she does her work.

This will help her to have the necessary inventory to be able to give her customers good service. Her goal is to get more earnings from her business to purchase land and improve her house.

name: Armando Antonio
use: to purchase pigs and also concentrated feed to fatten them and later sell them.
texts:
Armando studied up to the 6th grade of basic education, is partnered, and has a 1-year-old child. His life partner works at the household tasks and also sells bread.

Armando works raising pigs and also in agriculture. He fattens the pigs to sell them and sometimes sells them already butchered. As to agriculture, what he plants most are corn and beans.

He needs the financing to purchase pigs and also concentrated feed to fatten them and later sell them.

His dreams are to educate his child well, to improve his pig business and to continue working with his life partner to get ahead.

name: Godofreda
use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
texts:
Godofreda is 48 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by farming root crops in the Philippines.
Godofreda has been farming root crops for five years, and she also earns additional income from raising cattle.

Godofreda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

name: Mylene
use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Mylene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mylene is 35 years old.

Mylene raises pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Mylene requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Jose Edgardo
use: to purchase more products such as cones, popsicles, torbellinos, and others to expand his business's inventory.
texts:
Jose, 42 years old, is in a common-law marriage with his wife, they have a child, and he lives with his family in the municipality of El Progreso, Yoro. Jose worked selling household items and appliances, currently he has a business selling ice creams, a business which he established 5 years ago and does as a street vendor. He sells wrapped cones, popsicles, large, medium and small cones, filled popsicles, torbellinos, and more in the nearby communities.

He is asking for his first loan for the amount of 15,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of more products to increase his inventory and sales. His plan is to have a stronger business and be well-known in the area to improve his income and get his family ahead.

name: Rufina
use: to purchase candies, flour, sugar, drinks, soups, personal hygiene products, etc. to stock her store.
texts:
Rufina is 52 years old, married, and her husband is a farmer.

Rufina has a small store, she learned the work from her father who worked at the same. She sells staple products. She has the store in her house and her children help her to sell.

Her previous loan from Kiva served her for her business and she has already finished paying it off. She needs a new loan to purchase candies, flour, sugar, drinks, soups, personal hygiene products, etc. to stock her store.

She dreams of expanding her store and paying for her family's necessities.

name: Zeddy
use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to start horticultural farming.
texts:
Zeddy hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. She rears cows and poultry, and has a farm where she practices horticulture and also grows trees. To earn her income, Zeddy makes a commission on sales through buying from farmers at a cheaper price and using her knowledge to set market prices for the goods. She has been doing this business for over a decade, so she has developed good customer relationships and most customers in the market prefer her services.

Zeddy has a comparative advantage in the market by avoiding middlemen and the expenses associated with them. She has the ability to organize a sale very easily. Though sales, Zeddy gets profits. These profits are beneficial since her children's educational needs, and the basics of the family, are her sole responsibility. She therefore has little money remaining to save and is sometimes forced to borrow from her friends.

Zeddy has decided to increase her profits by growing and selling her own produce. She has decided to take a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, which she will use to grow different plants in her underutilized piece of land. She believes the venture will earn her enough money to sustain her family. Kindly lend to her and help her turn her dream into reality.

name: Purity
use: to buy seeds and expand her horticultural enterprise.
texts:
Hello Kiva community!

The nice woman pictured in this photo is Purity. She is a hardworking and determined woman who loves to be of service to her community.
