She is 26 years of age and lives with her husband in a humble home in Kericho. Her passion and enthusiasm for farming has helped her to gain much respect in her village and to be treated as a mentor by her village counterparts.

Purity farms the small parcel of land given to her by her husband. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticultural farm, where she grows vegetables. Loans for smallholder women farmers with a low, irregular income are hard to get in Kericho. A few organizations, such as Juhudi Kilimo, support farmers like Purity.

Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Purity because the institution believes that women, too, are good, hardworking farmers. Purity is a woman who truly is worth supporting. Please support this responsible woman and lend now.

name: Nerilyn
use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices and other materials needed for her food production business.
texts:
Nerilyn is a single woman, 49 years old, with ten children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nerilyn has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Nerilyn has been in this business for two years.

Nerilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices and other materials needed for her food production business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Rubelyn
use: to buy eight pieces of pipe, two solvent cements, a pressure tank, a faucet and other materials needed to build a water system.
texts:
Rubelyn is a hardworking mother. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children.

Aside from farming, vegetable vending is another source of their income and sometimes, if she has time, she offers manicure and pedicure services to her customers.

Rubelyn wants to build a water source in their house for her family to access clean water. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy eight pieces of pipe, two solvent cements, a pressure tank, a faucet and other materials needed to build a water system.

She is thankful to Kiva through ASKI for this chance to avail this loan, and her family will live more healthfully with clean water.

name: Ulumba Group
use: to buy sugar, rice, and soap to sell in her store.
texts:
Gladys is 34 years old, married, and has four dependent children. She owns a grocery store and is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar, rice, and soap. Gladys will be able to pay for food, clothes, and school fees for her children with the profits from her business. She started this business so that she would be able to earn a living. Gladys currently has two family members who work with her.

Her goals are to expand her business into a wholesale market and to educate her children.

name: Maria Isabel
use: to purchase products for her store such as basic grains, soft drinks, donuts, candies, bread, sugar, meat, chicken, and more.
texts:
Maria is 59 years old, is in a common-law marriage with her spouse, with whom she has 3 children, and lives with her spouse and a grandson in a sector of the municipality of El Progreso, Yoro.

Maria is the owner of a store located in her house. She established this business 10 years ago and sells a variety of products such as dairy products, juices, soft drinks, meat, chicken, seasonings, rice, corn, beans, sugar, flour, grains, and more. She is asking for her first loan from ODEF for the amount of 35,000 lempiras, which she will use to purchase products for her store such as basic grains, soft drinks, donuts, candies, bread, sugar, meat, chicken, and more.

This will help her to keep her business supplied and improve her sales. Her plan is to continue growing financially to cover her family's needs.

name: Rafael Antonio
use: to buy fertilisers and to pay labour costs to help with his coffee farm.
texts:
Rafael is 58 years old and married. He has 6 children and lives in a town in the region of Gracias, Lempira. He has always earned a living through agriculture, for approximately 35 years. He harvests coffee as his largest source of income. His coffee production is good quality and he sells it in the area to retailers.

He is asking for an ODEF loan of 20,000 Lempiras to buy fertilisers and pay labour costs to help him with his coffee farm. With this investment, he hopes to provide more help to his crops and achieve a greater coffee production.

His plan is to grow more areas of coffee, to have a prosperous family and increase his production and income for his family.

name: Beatrice
use: to install a new green house and grow more vegetables.
texts:
Beatrice is 28 years old. She is married and blessed with children. She provides for her family by working in agriculture together with her husband. She plants vegetables, bananas, and tea, which she sells to make a profit. Beatrice works hard all day to plant their land so they can harvest their crop and sell it in the market. Working in agriculture is a long-time tradition in her family, and she is very happy that with her work she is able to support her family.

To increase her income, Beatrice has requested a loan to install a new greenhouse so she can grow more vegetables. This loan will enable her to generate income for her family all year round and improve her family’s well-being.

Beatrice cannot access a loan from any commercial bank, since she does not have any solid collateral security and her income is irregular. She is therefore seeking this loan from Kiva lenders through one of their field partners, Juhudi. She is grateful for the good will of lenders.

name: Senaida Beatriz
use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, pesticides etc. to grow corn.
texts:
Senaida studied up to high school, she is married and her husband earns a living through agriculture and as a day labourer. She has two children, of which one goes to primary school.

Senaida has earned a living rearing pelibuey sheep for the last 5 years and she learned this business from her aunt. She also works in agriculture during the rainy season.

She will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilisers, pesticides etc. to work on her cornfield.

Senaida dreams of her children studying and being professionals in the future.

name: Leticia Mabel
use: to purchase a stove to continue working in her eatery, since the one she has now is failing.
texts:
Leticia is studying in her third year at university, her partner is employed and they have two children together, who are studying in school.

The business Leticia has is an eatery and she distributes food to people's homes. She has 3 years of experience doing this business and it was her mother who motivated her.

The loan she requests is to purchase a stove to continue working in her eatery, since the one she has now is failing.

She dreams of having a better business where her customers enjoy her dishes.

name: León
use: to purchase cement, concrete blocks, paint, stucco, rods, gravel, and more.
texts:
León, 49 years old, lives in the locality of Bosa in the municipality of Bogotá. He is a hard-working man who has worked in construction his whole life, a trade he learned on the job at age 19, and since then has done it as an independent worker. His family is made up of his spouse, a grocery merchant, who joined forces with León to get their two children ahead. Thanks to this, these two young people managed to get technical degrees and assure a promising future. León does masonry work, finishing walls, floors, plating, floors, installing bathroom fixtures, and other services.

Currently, he needs economic support to purchase construction materials with which he will build an apartment on his property, which he plans to rent out to improve the family income. For this, he asks for his first Kiva financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase cement, concrete blocks, paint, stucco, rods, gravel, and more. Support him in his loan.

name: Felipe
use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to care for his coffee farm.
texts:
Felipe is 56 years old, married, has 2 children, and lives in a village of the municipality of Gracias, Lempira with his wife and children. He has always worked in agriculture and selling basic grains, coffee, plantains, and yucca. He has been growing coffee for approximately 30 years, and he sells this yield in the market in the area, depulped and washed.

He is asking for his first loan cycle, which is for 20,000 lempiras, to purchase manure and fertilizer to care for his coffee farm. With this investment, he hopes to have a better crop and harvest. His plan is to increase his coffee production to meet his customers' demand.

name: Zakia
use: to buy goods such as ice cream and cold beverages for the summer to increase her grocery store's income.
texts:
Zakia has a grocery store. She is 48 years old and is married. She wants to buy goods for her store.

Zakia's eldest son, Munir, died at the age of 24 because of a car accident, and Zakia's psychological state deteriorated after that. Then, when her youngest daughter got married, she began to find solace in her business, which helps improve her income and support her family as well as giving her a place to communicate with neighbors. The grocery store has become her life and a means to forget the tragic death that struck her. She says that a son is very precious and his death is hard to overcome.

name: Noé Reinaldo
use: to purchase hard and soft cheeses, as well as other supplies for the chicken sandwichs and shaved ice he sells.
texts:
Noe has a 6th grade education, is married, and has children who are in school. He and his wife sell shaved ice, cheese, and chicken sandwiches.

Noe started this business 16 years ago, after an uncle gave him the idea. He travels the city by motorcycle, selling his wares wherever he goes.

The funds from this loan will be invested in buying hard and soft cheeses, as well as other supplies for the shaved ice and chicken sandwiches he sells.

His dream is that his children can continue their studies.

name: Teresa
use: to purchase more products of daily use to sell in her store.
texts:
Teresa sadly was not able to go to school since her family had very limited resources. She is a single mother of 7, of whom 3 live with her.

Teresa is a very enterprising woman who works for the good of her children, since she has a business where she sells all sorts of staple products such as corn, beans, oil, rice, etc.

Teresa will use the loan to purchase more products of daily use to sell in her store.

She plans to improve her quality of life with her business and also to have a more secure house since the roof is damaged.

name: Analie
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Analie works hard to support her one child. She is married and has a business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Analie requested a 6,400 PHP loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family. She is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting protection of the environment.

name: Silvestra
use: to buy gasoline and pig feed.
texts:
Silvestra is 57 years old. She is a single woman, who is engaged in several small businesses to earn a living. She sells snacks and gasoline, and owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She also raises hogs.

She is asking for a loan to sustain her businesses. She will use it to buy more gasoline and feed for her pigs. It is also her dream to expand her store business. She is optimistic about the future and she hopes to save enough for her old age.

name: Sokvang's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Sokvang’s group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Sokvang makes a living by cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Sokvang safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Khorn's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: Khorn’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh Province in Cambodia. Khorn is a factory worker and also cultivates rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Khorn to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Oscar Fernando
use: to pay for his eye operation.
texts: Oscar is a single young man, 22 years old, who lives in the home of his parents and two siblings to the west of the city of Monterrey. To help his parents economically, he works at an accounting office as an assistant. Since he was little, he has suffered from vision problems, so he uses glasses all the time. However, his prescription continues getting stronger. He went for an exam with a specialist and is a candidate for an operation to stop using glasses. This operation will be a great benefit for him in his job, it would improve his work performance and in his daily life he would be able to do things that he does not currently do because of his weak vision. To be able to have the operation, Oscar asked for a loan with which to pay for it and, so, improve his quality of life.

name: Rael
use: to buy an eco-friendly stove so she can enjoy cooking for her family and save on costs.
texts:
Hello, Kiva community!

Meet Rael, a hard-working, dairy- and crop-farming mother in the heart of Nandi Hills. She has a small personal business.

She is a devoted mum who loves cooking for her family and providing for their basic needs. However, she has not been enjoying her cooking duties, due to her old, problematic stove (jiko). Her jiko emits a lot of smoke and now takes more than a tin of charcoal, which has become quite costly, as has paraffin.

Rael is requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly jiko, so she can enjoy cooking for her family and save on costs of charcoal and paraffin. Because it's eco-friendly, the jiko will also keep her from contracting any respiratory diseases that may be caused by the increased fumes emitted by her current stove.

Kindly lend to her!

name: Eledina
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Eledina is 42 years old and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Eledina has been in this business for 4 years now, and she has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eledina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: María Del Carmen
use: to purchase corn, quesillo, beans, oil, etc., to sell pupusas and other snacks, in addition she will purchase more clothing to sell.
texts:
María studied up to the 2nd grade, is married, and her husband works in agriculture. Only one of her children lives with her.

María is very hard-working, she sells pupusas, corn cakes, and tortillas and she also sells clothing. She has been in this trade for a long time now and saw the need to carry it out since her children where studying and needed many things. She has her business in the community park.

María will use the loan to purchase corn, quesillo, beans, oil, etc., to sell pupusas and other snacks, in addition she will purchase more clothing to sell.

She plans to have a larger business to sell other types of products apart from what she already sells.

name: Naneth
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
Naneth is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business. Naneth has been in this business for 7 years. Naneth earns extra income from a general store.

Naneth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

name: Rosalina
use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs.
texts:
Rosalina is 40 years old and has three children. She is married and one child of hers is still in school.

Rosalina is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs. Rosalina successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

name: Phon
use: to buy a cow for plowing her rice field.
texts:
Phon, age 52, lives with her family in a rural village in Kampot Province. She is a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in high school.

Phon struggles to earn a living from rice farming, which she has been doing for 25 years. She also sells porridge to earn extra income. Phon was not able to achieve a good yield from her rice farm due to damage caused by insects.

This is her first loan with VisionFund and she will use the money to buy a cow to plow her rice field so that she can obtain a good yield. She hopes this loan will help her achieve a better harvest than last year.

name: Hildegarde
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Hildegarde is 67 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hildegarde runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Hildegarde has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Hildegarde would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Angeline
use: to purchase fishing materials like new fishing net, gasoline for her boat, rope and other materials needed for her business.
texts:
Angeline is a married woman, 48 years old, with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Angeline has a fishing business in the Philippines. Angeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like new fishing net, gasoline for her boat, rope and other materials needed for her business.

Angeline has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Marites
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Marites works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a business buying and selling cows in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 15,400 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family. Marites is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting environmental protection.

name: Glenda
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.
texts:
Glenda is 50 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. Glenda has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Glenda would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Bradyan Stiven
use: to purchase packaged snacks, cases of soft drinks, juices, malts, flour, cheese, meat, and more.
texts:
Bradyan is a hard-working young man who became involved in his mother's business when he was a boy. At 19, he runs one of the family's sales locations, which his mother gave him to undertake another branch of the business.

Inhabitants of Funza come every day to his cafe to enjoy the breakfasts, snacks, drinks, candies, and other foods he offers. These days he has plans for his business and for this he needs an injection of capital to carry out an increase in his inventory, having in mind that the performance of the area where his business is located has increased the influx of his customers.

Bradyan is applying for a loan, his first Kiva financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase packaged snacks, cases of soft drinks, juices, malts, flour, cheese, meat, and more. His goal is to be successful with this financing and to continue supporting his family.

name: Nimra
use: to buy a new sewing machine and material for her brother's sewing business.
texts:
Nimra is a 29-year-old woman, living with her husband and one child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. In the photo, she is sitting with her brother.

Nimra is requesting a loan for her brother’s tailoring business. He sews bike seat covers for his customers. He is an expert in his profession, and people like his covers a lot. Due to increased market demands, he wants to hire a worker to help fulfill the customers’ needs. This is the reason he has decided to purchase a new Juki (sewing) machine and additional material for his shop. This will enhance his business and help him to provide better facilities for his family.

Nimra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her brother can buy a new Juki machine and sewing material for the newly hired worker to help with his business.

Nimra hopes that her brother will easily be able to attract more customers and move his business towards progress. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

name: María Edis
use: to purchase cattle and feed to fatten them and later sell them, so with the earnings it will be possible for her children to continue studying.
texts:
María's education was up to the ninth grade due to where she lived being very far from a secondary school. Her parents advised her to begin to work in agriculture with them until she was partnered. Her husband is a farmer and they have two children who study at the town school.

Three years ago, María began to purchase young cattle to fatten them and then sell them. She decided to do it since, with caring for her children, she could not work in other places and, so, she cares for the cattle at her house. In addition to this, she does agricultural work.

She will use the loan to purchase cattle and feed to fatten them and later sell them, so with the earnings it will be possible for her children to continue studying. She has already paid off her previous Kiva loan and was able to invest in raising animals.

Her dreams are to see her children finish their studies and to have at least ten head of cattle, the earnings will be used in continuing to invest in the business and make it grow.

name: Anna Marie
use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.
texts:
As a married parent of three children, Anna Marie works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and a general store. Anna Marie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Anna Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Reggie
use: to buy more toiletries, rice, sodas, chips, canned goods, charcoal, and other grocery items.
texts:
Reggie's business is continuously growing and expanding. She would like to thank everyone who helped by partnering with her to make this possible. Reggie bought all the grocery items she needed for her variety store and generated a higher income that was used to pay her family's household bills.

Once again, she is requesting financial assistance to use as additional capital for her variety store. She will buy more toiletries, rice, sodas, chips, canned goods, charcoal, and other grocery items. The loan will be a big help to her business and facilitate its expansion. She hopes that all of her children end up having stable jobs.

Reggie is a member of the Center for Community Transformation and meets weekly with her fellowship partners to share her life’s testimony and business experience with her fellowship members. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 20 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships among partners, and repay microfinance loans.

name: Maendeleo Group -Buguruni
use: to buy a new stock of ladies' shoes, handbags and designer dresses, kids' wear and kids' shoes, and men's office wear and wallets.
texts:
Habiba is 26 years old. She is married and blessed with four children who are still in school.

She opened a clothing shop two years ago. She sells ladies' tops, dresses, trousers, T-shirts, and popular, simple ladies' dress called "delah" in Swahili. She normally opens from 7am until 10pm.

This will be Habiba's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She is applying for this loan to buy a new stock of ladies' shoes, handbags and designer dresses, kids' wear and kids' shoes, and men's office wear and wallets. Habiba's dream is to open a boutique in the near future.

She will share a portion of this loan with the other members of Maendeleo Group and they will be responsible for paying back the loan.

name: Eva
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Eva is 61 years old and married with four children. Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Eva has been in this business for 34 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future Eva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Evalyn
use: to buy additional items to sell, such as toothpaste, body soap, body spray and lotion, laundry soap and toilet soap.
texts:
As a married parent of two children, Evalyn works hard to support her family. She has a business direct selling personal products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising cattle.

Evalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items such as toothpaste, body soap, body spray and lotion, laundry soap and toilet soap for her business.

Evalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

name: Cecelia
use: to buy additional items such as toothpaste, body soap, body spray and lotion, laundry soap, and toilet soap.
texts:
Cecelia is a married woman. She is 42 years old and has one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecelia sells personal care products in the Philippines. She has requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her business, such as toothpaste, body soap, body spray and lotion, laundry soap, and toilet soap.

Cecelia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

name: Maya
use: to increase her capacity to produce more handwoven saris to sell.
texts:
Maya is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Nadia District, West Bengal. She wants to help her husband by making saris and selling them. Her husband collects raw thread at the market and she transforms the thread into finished material with the use of a "tana" (handloom) for making the saris. Her household consists of eight members and brings in a monthly income of 8,500 INR, of which 4,000 INR is set aside for savings. Maya wishes to increase her monthly income.

She has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR from Gram Bikash Kendra, one of Milaap's field partners. The loan will enable her to help her husband by making more saris to sell at the local market. Maya and her family are grateful to the lenders.

name: Khusnegul
use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to make more high quality dresses for her customers and earn more income to support her family.
texts:
This woman is Khusnegul. She has been sewing national dresses for more than four years. She runs her business out of her home. According to her, it is comfortable to sew in her home.

Khusnegul is taking out a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine. This way, she can sew more national dresses and correspondingly receive more income. This will allow her to advance her business to a new level.

Khusnegul is a divorced woman and has two children - a son and a daughter. Her goal is to get a loan to improve and expand her business. Khusnegul plans to attract many customers in the future. Khusnegul thanks you in advance.

name: Teodora
use: to buy scrap fabric by the kilo for making cleaning rags to sell.
texts:
Teodora is 60 years old, married, and has two children who now live with their own families. Her husband works as a tricycle driver. Even though she and her husband could have already stopped working, Teodora thinks of their needs if they were unable to work. She recognizes that her children have to provide for the needs of their families, so she does not want to burden them with her own needs when she and her husband retire.

The demand for round cleaning rags has recently increased. This is in anticipation of the rainy season when these rags are most often used by public transport drivers. Teodora is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to buy 100 kilos of scrap fabric in strips and another 50 kilos of additional scrap fabric pieces that she will use to assemble and sew the rags before selling them to buyers.

Teodora aims to generate more income so that she can accumulate enough savings for her and her husband's retirement.

name: Severina
use: the improvement of her motorcycle and renewal of registration.
texts:
Severina is already 56 years old, and all her 6 children are already married. Her husband is a motorcycle operator and also the driver, who transports passengers to and from neighboring cities.

She became a member of GDMPC in 2008, availed herself of a loan, and repaid it on time. Now she is taking another loan for the improvement of her passenger motorcycle and for the renewal of registration.

Her plan is to save money for unexpected sickness.

name: Ma. Grazita
use: to invest in more stock for the store, like canned goods, edible oil, beverages, and condiments.
texts:
Ma. Grazita is a resident of the rural town of Aloguinsan. She is a married woman and has no children yet. To support the economy of her house, she owns a basic goods shop and has been selling basic commodities for more than 10 years now.

She is facing a challenge in managing her current project - the lack of funds to boost its inventory. That is why Ma. Grazita has joined CEVI and applied for a loan, which was used to invest in more stock for the store, like canned goods, edible oil, beverages, and condiments.

In the future, she is looking forward to continuing to become successful in managing her sari-sari (variety) store. In addition, she is hoping to have a child of her own.

name: Hong's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.
texts:
Hong’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Hong makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In Hong's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Hong to safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Karam
use: to pay his educational fees at the university.
texts:
Karam, who appears in the photo, is a 19-year-old from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip. He is studying business administration at the local university, and he dreams of graduating and finding a good job to help his family with their living expenses. Karam's father works in the public sector and earns a low income that is barely enough for the basic needs of the family.

Karam went to Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to request a US Dollar loan to pay the educational fees at his university. He hopes you will help and fund his loan.

name: Samah
use: to buy cameras for her work.
texts: Samah, who appears in the photo, is a 39-year-old from Jabalia, Gaza Strip. She is the mother of one adorable child, and she tries so hard to raise him in the best conditions and cover all his needs. Samah started working in photography, and she is brilliant at her work. She went to Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to request a US Dollar loan to buy cameras for her work. She hopes you will help and fund her loan.

name: Hamed
use: to buy solar cells for his house.
texts:
Hamed, who appears in the photo, is a 21-year-old from the Gaza Strip. He is a married man, who lives with his wife and one adorable child. He tries so hard to make his family live in the best conditions. Hamad works as building guard where he earns a low income; this income is barely enough for the basic needs of his family.

Power outages and restrictions on electricity are common in the blockaded Gaza Strip, which affects the daily life of people living there. Because of that, Hamed went to Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to request a US Dollar loan to buy solar cells for his house, to solve the problem of the power outage. He hopes you will help and fund his loan.

name: Jackline
use: to buy high-quality seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides.
texts:
This is Jackline, a woman who is known for her hard work and enthusiasm. She is very passionate about farming and has seen the fruits of her labor over the past seven years. Jackline loves being able to produce dairy milk, poultry products, and crops on her farm. Her husband helps with the business by transporting her products to market. Together they have managed to send their children to school. However, the output from her farm has started to diminish because of depleted nutrients in the soil and attacks from pests and diseases.

With this loan, Jackline will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizers, and pesticides to improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques. Using high-quality seeds will ensure a bumper crop and higher profit levels.

Jackline is a visionary. Her goal for this season is to boost her crop production and achieve higher output than last year. All of this can be achieved with the help of the Kiva lenders and their goodwill. She believes the loan will help turn her family life around and enable her to provide her children with a solid education. Jackline looks forward to receiving the understanding and help of the lenders. She expresses her thanks in advance.

name: Pilita
use: to purchase groceries, frozen foods, vegetables, fish, and pork meat to sell.
texts:
Pilita, age 46, is married to a contractor, and they're blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a food shop in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 daily. Her net income is spent on their daily expenses at home.

Due to insufficient capital in her business, Pilita would like a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase groceries, frozen foods, vegetables, fish, and pork meat to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow profitably.

name: David
use: to buy an eco-friendly stove.
texts:
Hello, Kiva Community! Meet David (pictured above holding the rope of a cow with his farming neighbour), a hardworking, dairy and crop-farming father in the heart of the Nandi hills. He has a small personal business.

David is a devoted father who loves cooking for his family and providing for their basic needs. However, he has not been enjoying his cooking duties, due to his old, problematic stove (jiko). His jiko emits a lot of smoke and now takes more than a tin of charcoal, which has become quite costly, as has paraffin.

David is requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly jiko to enjoy cooking for his family and save on costs of charcoal and paraffin. Because it's eco-friendly, the jiko will also keep him from contracting any respiratory diseases that may be caused by the increased fumes emitted by his current stove. Kindly lend to him!

name: Resiel
use: to purchase additional boxes of fresh fish to sell.
texts:
As a married parent of four children, Resiel works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Resiel is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fresh fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Resiel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Beverly
use: to purchase additional raw materials for her weaving business.
texts:
Beverly is a married woman, 45 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Beverly has a weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials to maintain her business.

Beverly has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to expand her business.

name: Teresita
use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
texts:
Teresita is 59 years old and is a widow with three children.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as chips, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, and canned goods to sell in her store.

Teresita has been running this business for 2 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

name: Regina
use: to buy cereals to sell in her local market.
texts:
Regina has been equipped with skills, knowledge and outstanding techniques in farming. This is through nine years of experience in crop farming and animal husbandry. She is a quick learner, a high flyer and a woman who is not deterred by the difficulties that come around in her life. She is married to a fellow farmer, and is blessed with children who attend a local public school, thanks to the efforts of their mother.

Like many female farmers in her region, Regina has been experiencing challenges. She sometimes suffers losses due exploitation by middlemen. Sometimes her crops dry up and her animals become emaciated, which results in lower production in times of dry seasons. It is due to these factors that Regina is taking a loan from Juhudi, so that she can buy cereals and start selling them in her local market.

Kenya's Bomet area, being one of the country's most populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Regina could increase her profits in a move to satisfy the demand. Regina believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals.

Regina plans to use the extra income to change her life and increase her business. She will repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children with this income.

Regina and her family are so thankful for this great assistance, and for the impact that this loan will have in their lives.

name: Janice
use: to buy additional piglets as well as sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Janice is 31 years old, is married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school.



Janice is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Janice has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets as well as sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.



Janice has been in this business for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.



In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Merlina
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Merlina is 45 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child still in school.

Merlina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Merlina has been in this business for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Maria De Jesus
use: to pay for her father's eye surgery so that he can regain his vision.
texts:
Since her divorce, Maria de Jesus has taken care of her three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Her oldest child helps with the household expenses but does not have a job at the moment. In order to help her family get ahead, Maria de Jesus works as a nurse at a government hospital in the city of Monterrey. She lives there with her family.

Her father is currently facing a difficult situation. He was diagnosed with a disease that impedes his vision, so he is not able to see well. Her father is a pensioner and this disease is affecting his daily life. He needs an operation that will help to restore his vision, which would enable him to move on with his life.

name: Lilia
use: to buy piglets and feed.
texts:
Lilia is from Dumanjug, Cebu. A woman who is used to earning, she is raising hogs while also looking after her household. She also sells trendy and affordable clothing known as RTW.

Lilia is asking for a loan to increase the number of hogs that she is raising and to buy feed in order to keep them well and healthy. In the future, she wants her business to continue making improvements in sales and income and for her family to have a good life.

name: Lillian
use: to buy cereals to sell in her local market.
texts:
Wonderful Kiva community, Get to know Lillian, a woman with a great magnitude of the things she has changed around her. She has changed herself, her family and her business. This happened after she decided to take on farming. She has never regretted nor thought of engaging in any other business.

She practices mixed farming, and sells her produce on her own. She is smart in business, and that explains why she decided to eliminate the middlemen to make more profit. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other crops.

Although she makes a profit, she is not completely satisfied, and she intends to venture into the business of cereals to increase her income. She has applied for this loan to buy cereals that she will in turn sell at her local market to make more profits. She will enjoy selling to her loyal customers, who like her politeness.

Lillian believes that this loan will be of much benefit to her. In a move to satisfy the market demand for cereals, she will end up making more profits, of which she will plough some back into farming and use the rest for her children's education.

Your contribution will have a lasting impact in her heart and those of her family.

name: Alsebia
use: to buy fertilisers, seedlings and other materials for her ornamental plants.
texts:
Alsebia is 39 years old and has four children, one of whom is still in school. Alsebia is a married woman. Alsebia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.

Alsebia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilisers, seedlings and other materials for her ornamental plants. Alsebia has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alsebia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Gloria
use: to buy additional materials for her manicure and pedicure service.
texts:
A married parent of four children, Gloria works hard to support her family.



She has a service business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Gloria is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials for her manicure and pedicure service business.



Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Peris
use: to buy an eco-friendly stove.
texts:
Hello, Kiva community! Meet Peris, a hard-working, dairy and crop-farming mother, in the heart of Nyahururu. She also has a small personal business.

She is a devoted mum, who loves cooking for her family, and providing for their basic needs. However, she has not been enjoying her cooking duties, due to her old, problematic stove (jiko). Her jiko emits a lot of smoke and now takes more than a tin of charcoal, which has become quite costly, as has paraffin.

Peris is requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly jiko to enjoy cooking for her family, and save on the cost of charcoal and paraffin. Because it's eco-friendly, the new jiko will also keep her from contracting any respiratory diseases that may be caused by the increased fumes emitted by her current stove.

Kindly lend to her!

name: Sokkhan
use: to purchase cashew seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to improve her cashew farming.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

texts:
A local farmer, whose age is 41, Sokkhan is living in Tbaung Khmum province. She is a mother of three children, and two of them are still in need of support from her. She is growing cassava and cashews for her main income, while working as a paid worker as an additional source of income.

This is the third cycle loan for Sokkhan with Visionfund, and she has repaid her past loan well. Her previous loan has helped her to increase her income and support her family’s living. For this new loan, she will use it to purchase cashew seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to improve her cashew farming.

She hopes that her family can live in a better environment, and her business runs smoothly, so she can provide better support to her family.

name: Azimjon
use: to buy compositions for creating an album.
texts:
Azimjon is a positive and cheerful 29-year-old man. He is married and has two dependent sons. He lives in a big family that is amiable and happy. There are ten people in his family - his parents, brothers, and sisters-in-law.

Azimjon has been interested in the musical arts since childhood. From a young age he has been singing songs, and he dreamt of releasing his own musical albums. He is striving towards his own successes. He became a singer, and he offers his services in carrying out ceremonial parties, weddings, and so on.

In order to obtain musical compositions with the goal of releasing a new album, he needs financial support. He has applied to MDO Arvand for support with this problem. He is thankful to the lenders for the cooperation and confidence. He will pay for the compositions with the received loan.

name: Gina
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Gina works hard to support her three children. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gina has requested a 10,400 PHP loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family. Gina is aware that by using a sanitary toilet, she is reducing the health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting environmental protection.

name: Chung's Group
use: to invest in raising pigs.
texts:
Chung is an ethnic Thai woman. She is living with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. The main income of her family is from animal breeding and land cultivation, and just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount.

Chung wants to invest in raising pigs but her saved money is not enough for her to buy food for the pigs. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Chung hopes that the loan will help her family breed the pigs well, and next year her family can sell a herd of pigs to improve the living condition of her family.

name: Islomidin
use: to buy mineral fertilisers in order to increase the harvest and receive more profits.
texts:
44-year-old Islomidin is a true animal breeder and farmer. He has successfully engaged in rearing cows and agricultural crops for 20 years. Islomidin lives in a village in the Khuroson area with his wife and children. Islomidin's wife helps him with the work. They are so accustomed to the profession that they cannot imagine themselves in another line of work.

Islomidin wants to expand his business through increasing his harvests. However, he needs money for this goal. He is hopefully appealing to you for financial support, in order to obtain mineral fertilisers. With the profits from the business, Islomidin wants to save in order to carry out his youngest son's circumcision. Your support is very important to Islomidin!

name: Loda
use: to buy additional piglets, as well as sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.
texts:
Loda is 49 years old, married and has two children. She is in the pig farming business in the Philippines.

Loda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, as well as sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Loda has been in this business for 4 years and previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loans and has now requested another loan to further build her business.

Loda would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

name: Safarmurod
use: to pay for his daughter's treatment.
texts:
Safarmurod is 29 years old. He lives in Pinjikent city. He is married and has two children. Safarmurod works in the Department of Statistics. He has been in this line of work for more than five years. His wife is called Umeda and she works in a school. She teaches the native language.

Currently, Safarmurod is experiencing difficulties. His daughter recently fell ill and had an operation. In order to pay for the operation, they had to sell their home equipment. Now their daughter needs postoperative treatment. In order to pay for this, they need money. Safarmurod has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. He is thankful for the support and cooperation.

name: Zulfiniso
use: to buy more fabric in order to sew as many dresses as possible for the season.
texts:
Zulfiniso is a sweet and calm woman. She is 46 years old and has a wonderful family and two children. Zulfiniso's husband is a taxi driver. She has been engaged in sewing for eight years. Zulfiniso has a lot of clients and she receives a decent income.

Zulfiniso is requesting a loan in order to buy more fabrics in order to sew as many summer dresses as possible. She has thus appealed for help in receiving a loan. She hopes that you will help her to obtain good quality fabric.

name: Gulnaz
use: to help her husband repair his auto rickshaw.
texts:
Gulnaz is a 42-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. He is a rickshaw driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes some income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to repair it, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work.

That is why Gulnaz has availed a loan of 60,000 PKR for her husband for the repair of his rickshaw, so he can provide better facilities to his customers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

name: Robina Kausar
use: to buy additional commodities and easy load services for her husband's general store business.
texts:
Robina Kausar is a 51-year-old married women and the mother of seven children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is standing with her husband. Her husband has been running a general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. His shop is situated in a populated area, and there are a lot of customers available here to buy miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable for daily usage.

Her husband wants to offer stationery items and easyload services to the customers. But the major problem is the shortage of funds. Therefore, Robina Kausar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy the sacks of rice, sugar, flour, and additional stationery items and easyload services for attracting more customers.

She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her husband will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

Robina Kausar is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

name: Abdusamin
use: to buy tires for his vehicle.
texts:
Abdusamin is a village resident. He was born in 1970. He is a loving family man, and a father of three sons. His wife is a housewife, but she is engaged in animal husbandry. She is engaged in processing sour dairy products. Their youngest son is studying in the local village general education school, and their two older sons go to Russia for seasonal work. They work on a private construction site as ancillary workers.

Abdusamin is a driver by profession, and he works as a route minibus driver, which brings in money for the family expenses. His vehicle's tires are worn out, and he must change them and repair some of his vehicle's parts. Since he does not have enough funds, he has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Abdusamin expresses his thanks for the support. With the received loan, he will buy tires.

name: Thav's Group
use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming.
texts:
Thav is living in Banon district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a mother of three children, one of whom she still supports. Thav has been working as a farmer for 5 years and her husband has worked as a paid worker for 4 years. Through sources, she could earn about 19,000KHR and she is able to save about 10,000KHR each day.

As her crops are eaten by insects and the price is also getting lower, she couldn’t support her family well. So she decided to form a group to request a loan via VisionFund. She will use this loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming. She hope this loan will help her farming to grow well and return her better income.

name: Carlos Amilcar
use: to buy farm supplies for his basic grain crops.
texts:
Carlos has a high school education and his partner is a homemaker. He raises grazing, dairy cows which he learned about from his father. He also grows seasonal basic grains. His workplace is half a kilometer from home and sometimes his partner helps him. His workday is from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

He used his previous Kiva loan to invest in his cattle business and has paid back the loan. Now he is in need of a new one to buy farm supplies for his grain crops.

His goal is to have a larger stable and more cattle to continue earning an income and live well with his partner.

name: Analie
use: to buy ingredients like chicken meat, spices, cooking oil, and other materials needed for her food production business.
texts:
Analie is a married woman, 35 years old with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Analie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like chicken meat, spices, cooking oil, and other materials needed for her food production business.

Analie has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Silvia
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cow.
texts:
Silvia is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Silvia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cows.

Silvia has been raising cows for 2 years and also earns additional income from snack vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Jojet
use: to buy feed and pay for tricycle repair.
texts:
Jojet lives in Alcantara, Cebu with his family. He is 40 years old. He has two young children. Jojet has been raising hogs for a few years. This entails waiting and persevering. Aside from hog raising, he also drives a tricycle for supplemental income.

He is asking for a loan to buy feed and pay for tricycle repair. Jojet is determined to work hard to provide for his family.

In the future, Jojet plans to make his business bigger and more sustainable.

name: Sokhon
use: to purchase a motorbike.
texts:
Sokhon was married in 2010. She lives with her husband and two children at Khan Posen Chey, Phnom Penh, in Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows. Sokhon has been a garment factory worker for 4 years.

She wishes to borrow money to purchase a motorbike for transport to work but she does not have enough money to purchase it, so she decided to apply for a loan from Maxima Microfinance Plc. Using this loan she will be able to purchase a motorbike.

name: Qumri
use: to pay for her treatment at the medical clinic.
texts:
Qumri, pictured here, is a very kind and responsible woman. She was born in 1972, is widowed, and has three children. She is a seamstress. She has been working for many years, but her income is low.

The main income of her family is from her sewing business. Qumri works hard to provide her family with necessary things. Sadly, she has become ill and needs treatment. She doesn’t have money to buy the needed medicine. She needs Kiva lenders' support and mercy.

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS for her treatment. Qumri is a returning client and has a positive credit history. She is requesting a loan for the fourth time through Kiva’s field partner IMON International.

name: Maria
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Maria is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Jocelyn
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, spices, and other snack foods.
texts:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with three children. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, spices, and other snack foods.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Maricar
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Maricar works hard to support her three children. She is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maricar requested a PHP 12,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Maricar is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Erelyn
use: to buy additional bananas to sell in her stall.
texts:
Erelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very har working entrepreneur. Erelyn is 40 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Erelyn has a banana selling business in the Philippines. Erelyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her stall.

Erelyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Erelyn would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

name: Guadalupe
use: to buy more piglets to raise and sacks of feed.
texts:
Guadalupe is a piggery owner from the municipality of Ronda, Cebu. From the business of raising pigs, she is able to pay the bills every month and buy food for the family. She is asking a loan to buy more piglets to raise and sacks of feed to keep her animals healthy.

Guadalupe hopes to make her planned expansion possible with the help of the loan. In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful so she can save for old age and live in abundance without financial worries.

name: Reyna Isabel
use: to buy products for her business such as corn, tamales and coal.
texts:
Reyna, 47, is a hard-working woman who earns a living selling coal, corn and tamales. She has been in business for two years and it has gone very well. She is married and has a 13-year-old son.

This is her eighth Kiva loan and she will use it to buy products for her business such as corn, tamales and coal in the hopes that it will improve her income and allow her to achieve her goal of prospering and expanding her business.

name: Adjo Engèle
use: to buy 3 boxes of fish and 21 litres of oil.
texts:
Adjo is thirty-nine years old, divorced and lives in Sanguéra with three children. She sells smoked fish on foot. Twice a month she buys new supplies from the market.

Adjo has requested this loan to buy boxes of fresh fish and oil. Her profits will allow her to provide for the day-to-day needs of her children.

name: Rahamatou
use: to buy 10 dozen sets of hair extensions.
texts:
Married and mother to three children, Rahamatou is forty-five years old and lives in Tokoin. She works as a hairdresser and sells hair extensions from her salon at home. She buys new supplies twice a month from the market.

Rahamatou has requested this loan to buy dozens of packets of hair extensions. Her profits will allow her to arrange for the education of her children.

name: Buvsolia
use: to buy cattle and fodder to increase the herd size.
texts:
Buvsolia is a cheerful woman. She is married and has two children. She and her family live with her husband's retired parents in a rural area.

Her husband works as a private construction worker. Buvsolia is engaged in rearing animals. She buys young animals, and after fattening them up for a few months she resells them for a much higher price and receives a profit. Her husband and in-laws help her around the farm.

In order to expand her business, Buvsolia has decided to increase her livestock numbers by buying a pair of calves. She has applied to Arvand for a loan. Buvsolia thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial support. With the received loan, she will buy a pair of livestock and livestock fodder.

name: Bibisharifa
use: to buy several heads of sheep to increase the herd size.
texts:
Bibsharifa is a young woman. She is 31 years old. She lives in a village. She has two dependent children. Bibisharifa started engaged in animal husbandry after she got married. She has gradually become able to improve her turnover. Bibisharifa's husband works as a builder on a private construction site. He also goes to Russia for seasonal work.

Animal husbandry is the family's main source of income. Since Bibisharifa does not have enough funds at the moment, she wants to take a loan. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders for their support. With the received loan, she will bu a few sheep in order to expand the business.

name: Asmat
use: to restock bedsheets to sell to customers and increase her client base.
texts:
Asmat is 53 and a mother of three children. Life has been challenging for her living in a congested house and with a minimal income. Keeping her spirits high she started to sell bed sheets from her house to the neighborhood ladies to earn some money 4 years ago. Her small investment proved fruitful and she continues to sell bedsheets to this day.

She wants to have more stock in new varieties but with no financial means has come to BRAC Pakistan to provide her with a loan. She will restock bedsheets with new and more varieties and hopes for a fruitful result.

name: Allah Sonny Group
use: to buy 2 sacks of millet, 1 sack of milk and 1 sack of sugar.
texts:
Aissata is the representative of the 'Allah Sonny' Group. She is married and mother to five children. The eldest is thirty-five years old and the youngest is fourteen years old. One of her children still attends school and she is responsibile for a total of five people.

Aissata has been preparing and selling 'dèguet' (a porridge made from millet and yogurt) and patties for six years. She buys her supplies from the surrounding markets. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of millet, one sack of milk and one sack of sugar.

Aissata's profits will be added to her savings which are to be used to buy a plot of land. In the future, she aims to expand her business by building larger premises and be able to provide for the future of her children.

name: Susana
use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.
texts:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a cattle raising business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Susana has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Celia
use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, and other materials needed for her food production business.
texts:
Celia is a single woman, 28 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Celia has a food making business in the Philippines. Celia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, and other materials needed for her food production business.

Celia has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Mary Jane
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Mary Jane works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Mary Jane is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Kidomole Twansi Group
use: to buy out of stock crates of beer and liquors, chairs for customers to sit and decorations for her grocery to attract more customers.
texts:
Mwanahamisi is in her early 40s and a married mother of five school-going children. She is the retailer operating as a cashier at her own grocery store. At the same time, she owns a small shop that sells different ingredients such as tomatoes, onions, carrots and cooking oil. In her grocery, she provides various kinds of drinks like soft drinks such as soda, juice and mineral water, plus beer, wines and spirits. She has been in this business for over 17 years and works usually from 9:00 am to 10:00 Pm.

This will be Mwanahamisi's second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more crates of beer, soda and boxes of juice. Mwanahamisi paid her loan successfully. She is applying for this loan so that she can buy out of stock crates of beer and liquors plus chairs for customers to sit and decorations for her grocery to attract more customers. She has a dream of operating a bar business in the future.

Mwanahamisi will share a portion of this loan with her group members of "Kidomole Twansi" group and promises to cooperate to pay back the loan.

name: Laurincia
use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.
texts:
Laurincia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Laurincia is 38 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Laurincia has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Laurincia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Laurincia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Laurincia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Regina
use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Regina is 67 years old and has two children. Regina is a married woman.

Regina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Regina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Anupam
use: to expand her grocery business by adding more stock of sugar, tea etc. and selling them.
texts:
Anupam is a 39-year-old married woman residing in Balangir district, Odisha. She is engaged in a grocery business. She sells sugar, tea, etc. in her grocery store. She has a household of four members and a monthly income of INR 6,000. She wants to purchase more sugar, rice, tea etc to sell in the local market and to expand her business.

She has applied for a loan of INR 20,000 from Mahashakti Foundation, one of Milaap's field partners. This can enable her to purchase more stock of supplies for her shop such as sugar, tea, etc. and make more profit. Anupam and her family will be thankful for their lenders.

name: Maricel
use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.
texts:
Maricel is 46 years old, married and has five children, four of whom are still in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Maricel has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Marites
use: to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, beverages, edible oil and toiletries.
texts:
Thirty-eight-year-old Marites runs and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, assorted canned goods, and soap.

She is married and has an 18-year-old dependent.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, beverages, edible oil and toiletries. This will enable her to provide a variety of stock and attract buyers to purchase.

Thus, she will continue to monitor the inventory and repay her obligation on time.

Marites is looking forward to continuing to strive hard to boost the family's source of income to become more sustainable.

name: Janeth
use: to buy farming tools and equipment.
texts:
Janeth has wide experience in farming. She has become proficient at farming activities from horticulture, dairy, and poultry. Janeth resides with her family in a humble home in the outskirts of the town of Bomet. She has been in the business of food production for seven years now. She makes a profit selling products from her farm including milk, eggs, and crops.

Janeth plans to buy farm implements to aid her in her work. The current tools and equipment she is using are worn out due to continuous usage. She is confident that she will be able to increase her output, which she will sell to her neighbors and to the local market. Her village has a high demand for food crops, but the biggest problem is that the supply is low.

Through the loan, she will be able to meet the demand. The training she got from Juhudi Kilimo enabled Janeth to learn that she could save and borrow a loan. This loan will go a long way in changing the lives of Janeth and her family.

name: Sharon
use: to buy modern farming tools and equipment.
texts:
Sharon is a smart and sharp farmer who lives in a remote village in Kericho. She is a single and active woman who works in agricultural activities, a skill that she inherited from her parents. She has been engaging in mixed farming activities. Through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of the cows that she really enjoys taking care of. She also sells tomatoes and vegetables. She produces the tomatoes and vegetables in her own farm. In fact, she wants to plant more of these crops to earn more profit. Though Sharon’s idea seems viable, she lacks funds to purchase farm tools and equipment that she will use in her farm.

To excel in farming, there is a need to use the proper farm tools and equipment in order to save time and effort as well as ensure increased productivity. Sharon is therefore seeking a loan that she will use to buy modern farming tools and equipment. This will enhance efficiency on her farm and lead to increased output. Every contribution you make is a step in improving the life of this young woman. Please help her to improve her living conditions.

name: Margie
use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.
texts:
Margie is 24 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Margie also earns additional income from fish vending. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

name: Reab's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Reab’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Reab makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. She has one daughter in her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Reab safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Korn
use: to dig a tube well to get clean water to provide good health for her family.
texts:
An old woman living in Takeo province, Korn is 63 years old and a mother of two dependent children. She earns income to support her family’s living by rice cropping and also by working as a construction worker to get more income. She has been involved with farming for 45 years; it earns her about 3 USD per day for her daily saving.

Kron's rice did not grow well because it was destroyed by insects, which are the main challenge. For Korn, this is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use her loan to dig a tube well to get clean water for her family to use.

With this loan, she hopes that she can provide clean water for her family to use in order to get good health.

name: Zayrin
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Zayrin works hard to support her one child. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Zayrin requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to pay for materials and labor to construct a sanitary toilet for her family.

Zayrin is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.

name: Vilma
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Vilma works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a Internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 5,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a a sanitary toilet.

Vilma is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Vinh's Group
use: to raise pigs to get additional income for the family.
texts:
Mrs. Vinh, 38 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is living with her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

The main income of her family is from her salary as a worker, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to raise pigs to get additional income for the family, but she does not have enough money to buy breeding pigs and food for the pigs. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in breeding so next year when selling the pigs, she can earn a considerable profit.

name: Claire
use: to buy another batch of piglets to grow.
texts:
Claire is from Mialen, Clarin in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is single and lives together with her parents and other siblings. To help her parents, Claire is engaged in a piggery business where she grows piglets for the first 3 months before selling them. She has done this business for many years.

Clarie joined GDMPC to gain financial access so should could raise capital for her business. Previously, she requested cash assistance and repaid successfully. Recently, Claire applied for another new loan amounting of 15,000 PHP to buy another batch of piglets to grow.

For the future, Claire wants to have additional income to save for continued education.

name: Mao's Group
use: to pay the plowing fee to support her rice farming to gain a good yield.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

texts:
Mao is a local farmer living in Preah Vihear province. She is 33 years old and a mother of four children. Nowadays, she needs to support one kid. For her big family, she has earned income via growing rice for nine years and is working for others for a fee to supplement her income.

She has been with VisionFund for three microloan cycles, including this one, with a successful repayment of her past loans that enabled her to improve her condition better than before. Now, she leads a big group consisting of six members, and she is the group leader. For Mao, she will spend her entire loan on the plowing fee in order to improve her rice farmland to grow well.

She wishes that her rice farming can produce more yield than last year.

name: Neoy's Group
use: to buy more fertilizer and pay the plowing fee to support her rice farmland to get a higher yield than before.
texts:
A mother blessed with four children living in Siem Reap province, Neoy is 55 years old. Her main source of income is from rice growing, which she has been doing for many years. To make extra income, she is raising pigs and chickens. Her rice did not grow well in this year because of the drought; it is the main challenge in her farming.

For Neoy, this is her second microloan with VisionFund, and she has paid her past loan well. The previous loan has improved her living conditions more than before.
