She is leading a group of four members to seek a new loan. As the leader, Neoy will use her portion of loan to purchase more fertilizer and pay the plowing fee in order to support her farming to grow well. Her goal is to update her rice farmland so that she can have a higher yield and return more profit.

name: Sambath's Group
use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to improve her rice farming so it grows well.
texts:
Sambath is 30 years old and married. She lives with her family in a village in Preah Vihear province. She is a mother whom is blessed with two children, one of whom is still in school and the other one is too young.

Sambath earns a living through rice growing and also works for others for a small fee to supplement her income. She has been involved with her current business for 8 years, which can help her to keep up about 4 US dollar per day for future needs. Her rice did not grow well this year because it was destroyed by insects.

This is Sambath's third time loan with VisionFund; she has paid back her past loans completely. Via the previous loans, her family’s living has improved. Now, Sambath is leading a group of two members in applying for this new loan. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds to support her farming.

Sambath hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

name: Vorn's Group
use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers for her farming.
texts:
At the age of 50, Vorn is living in Banon district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Vorn is a mother of two children. One of her children is still depending on her.

Vorn has been working as a farmer for almost 30 years and she has a husband who has been working as a paid worker for 15 years. Every day, she can earn income of about 28,000 KHR, and she can save about 13,000 KHR.

This loan will be the fourth loan cycle for her. As she doesn’t gain much crop yield because of a drought problem, she decided to lead her group to request a loan via VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy more seeds and fertilizers for her farming. She hopes that this loan will help her farming business run smoothly.

name: Duclot
use: to pay for maintenance inputs and fungicides for his cacao field.
texts:
DUCLOT is a 55-year-old man who is the married father of six children, and he has a nephew to support. The oldest is 27, and the youngest is 11. Six of them are attending school. DUCLOT is a farmer, and his plantation is located in a village where he lives with his family. Among other things, he grows coffee, although this is not very developed yet.

At this time of the years, farmers encounter many difficulties maintaining their fields. This is due to the switch in work, since they are coming out of the so-called dead season. For this reason, he is requesting this loan to purchase fungicides on time and enough for a 3-hectare field. Through this financing, he will see improved production compared to past years.

With the money from his sales, he would like to fix up his housing and establish other businesses in order to ensure the well-being of his entire family.

name: Adiyatou
use: to buy one bag of peanuts.
texts: Adiyatou is married, 45 years old, and the mother of three children. She lives in Baguida. She prepares and sells peanut-based doughnuts. She stocks up on supplies three times a month at the market. Adiyatou is seeking this loan to buy bags of peanuts. She wants to use the profits to increase her sales and allow her children to thrive.

name: Muon's Group
use: to invest in pig breeding.
texts:
Mrs. Muon, born in 1965, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has five members, including her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and a grandchild. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

The main income of her family is from cultivation and breeding. Her family has over 1 hectare of land for cultivation of sugarcane and corn, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to invest more in pig breeding, but she does not have enough money to buy breeding pigs and foods for the pigs. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family develop the breeding well, and next year her family can sell two pig herds to earn a considerable profit.

name: Nhung's Group
use: to repair her house.
texts:
Mrs. Nhung is a Thai ethnic woman. She is living with her husband and her two children in Son La city, a subsidized unit of Son La province.

The main income of her family is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to repair her house, but she does not have enough money to buy building materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a new spacious house in which to live.

name: Calebasse De Lemergence 30 Group
use: to buy fruit and fabric for resale.
texts:
Calebasse de L'émergence 30 is a group of ten woman who live in the same neighbourhood and who all have businesses. It is represented by Ndeye Fatou (she has her hand raised in the photo). She is married and has been running a business for more than three years. She has two commercial activities - selling fabric (her main business) and selling fruit (her secondary business).
Her working day begins at 9am and she finishes at 6.30pm. She has already successfully repaid an earlier loan and she is now requesting a loan for 500,000 Frs. These funds will be used to buy fabric and fruit for resale.
She assists with the family's daily budgetary needs. Therefore, her goal is to develop her business - increasing her profits to improve the family's diet and to cover the children's schooling costs.
She plans to renovate her canteen in the future.

name: Kossiwa Tassi
use: to buy four dozen baby outfits and four boxes of ointment.
texts: Kossiwa is a married, 32 years old, and the mother of one child. She lives in Baguida. She works selling children’s clothes and accessories. She stocks up on supplies twice a month. Kossiwa is seeking this loan to buy dozens of sets of clothing and ointments for children. With the income earned, she will be able to reorganize her business and take care of her family.

name: Khay's Group
use: to buy fertilizer for her family's coffee field.
texts:
Mrs. Khay, born in 1961, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is living with her husband and her grandchild in Mai Son district, Son La province.

The main income of her family is from her retirement salary, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of her family and save a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for her family's coffee field, but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family tend the coffee field well, and the coming harvest of coffee will reach a productivity as much as double the previous harvest.

name: Gabriel
use: buy a sprayer and a machete.
texts:
Gabriel is 44 years old, married, and has four children who go to school. He has been living in a village with his family for years.

He has been growing cacao for 19 years. At this time of year, he has a hard time maintaining his field as he does not have a lot of liquid assets. The lenders take advantage of this by taking a portion of his yield.

Taking care of his family prevents him from saving. That's why he's asking for a loan for a sprayer and a machete that will help him better maintain his field. These items will help him increase his production and sales. He will then be able to save, start a new plantation, and build in the near future.

name: Saban's Group
use: to pay for digging a well in order to get water to cover the farmland and also for daily living.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

texts:
A mother of four children, Saban is 47 years old. She is living in Tbaung Khmum province with her family. Saban is growing rice as the main source of income. Her rice is harmed by insects and pests and she can’t get enough income to support her family. She also works in a factory to find additional income.

This is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund, and she has repaid her past loans completely. Her previous loans have helped her to have a better income. Now she is leading a group of three members to apply for this new loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan to pay for digging a well in order to get water to use to cover the farmland and also for daily living.

She hopes that she can get a high yield to increase her income to help her family, and she wishes to be able to renovate her old house in the future.

name: Farilahy
use: to pay for a piglet, some feed, potato seeds, fertilizer, and manure.
texts:
Farilahy, aged 31, is from the countryside. He lived there during his youth and is currently married. He chose to remain there with his wife and their 6-year-old daughter. Devoting his time to farming, he earns money by selling his harvests and livestock products. Farilahy is convinced it is necessary to increase the family’s income. He would then be able to provide for his daughter’s needs and education.

He decided to take out loans, and VAHATRA seemed appropriate to him. He is now on his third loan. The previous ones were advantageous. He acquired a steer and a bicycle with the profits from raising pigs.

He needs this loan to grow potatoes and also to continue investing in raising pigs. He plans to pay for a piglet and some feed to ensure its nutrition; he also plans to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer, and manure for his crops. He sells his products at the big market. Later on, he wants to have financial autonomy.

name: Ravaomalala
use: to pay for piglets and some feed for her livestock business, eventually to have a peaceful retirement.
texts:
Ravaomalala, aged 64, is a widow who has two adult daughters. Her entire youth was devoted to farmwork. She was successful in helping her husband to meet family needs with the profits from her livestock. She continues to operate her pig farm at present. She would like to be independent and wants to have financial autonomy for her golden years.

She is a good partner of VAHATRA and is now on her fifth loan. The previous loans were fruitful. She has some savings. She still needs this loan to pay for piglets and some feed for them. She sells the livestock herself to butchers or sometimes to peddlers. Her wish is to have a peaceful retirement.

name: Maglwe
use: to buy twenty piles of yams.
texts:
Maglwe is a 37 year old married woman who lives in Baguida. A mother of four children, Maglwe is a yam seller. She buys what she needs at the market, three times a month.
Maglwe is requesting this loan in order to buy stacks of yams.
With the resulting profit, Maglwe plans to improve her sales environment and to take care of her family.

name: Hien's Group
use: to invest in raising pigs to get additional income for her family.
texts:
Hien, 28 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her son and her daughter, living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

The main income of her family is from the salary of her and her husband as workers, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to invest in raising pigs to get additional income for her family, but she does not have enough money to buy breeding pigs and mash for the pigs. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest well in the breeding, and next year when selling the pigs, she can earn a considerable profit to help improve the living conditions of her family.

name: Nam's Group
use: to buy more seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and pay for plowing fees to improve her farmland.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum District, Tbaung Khmum Province

texts: Nam is 56 years old, married, and has six children. Two children are still depending on her. She is growing rice and cassava as her main income. Her rice was harmed by insect pests, so it can’t grow well. To earn additional income, she mostly uses her spare time to work as a paid worker. She is leading a group of two members to request her first cycle loan from Visionfund. As a group leader, she will spend her loan to buy more seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and pay for plowing fees to improve her farmland. She hopes she can increase her income to give better support to her family, especially her children’s education.

name: Marcelina
use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Marcelina is 58 years old, married woman and has three children.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marcelina has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Margaret
use: to buy high quality seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides.
texts:
Margaret’s natural abilities and her curiosity is what propelled her to start farming 18 years ago. Within that period, not everything has been easy. She has encountered a lot of difficulty but she still perseveres and focuses on success. She is a woman who sacrifices herself for the welfare of her family and thus she has never given up.

Margaret has always had an affinity for farming. She practices crop and animal farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy quality farm inputs.

Through this loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seed,sgood fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to improve crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits. Her dream is to build a modern house.

Make a $25 loan or more and push Margaret’s dream closer to reality. Margaret hopes for your understanding and help. She's very thankful in advance.

name: Arlene
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
Arlene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 59 years old.

Arlene has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arlene has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Resty
use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
texts:
Resty is 31 years old and single with one child.

She earns a living by farming flowers in the Philippines. Resty is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Resty has been farming flowers for three years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

name: Glesy
use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.
texts:
Glesy is 24 years old, married and has two children.

Glesy is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Glesy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Glesy has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Glesy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Arlina
use: to buy feed and pay for tuition.
texts:
Arlina is a piggery owner from the municipality of Dumanjug, Cebu. This is a place where most people thrive through agriculture. She has six children ages 9-26. She is 45 years old and has been raising hogs for 15 years now. From this business, she usually earns PHP 5,000 every four months when it is time to sell her fattened hogs.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed and pay for the tuition of her children. Arlina hopes to make her planned expansion possible with the help of the loan. In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful so she can save for old age and live comfortably.

name: Lilibeth
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
As a married parent of four children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production for her food vending business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Hazel
use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
texts:
Hazel works hard to support her family. Hazel is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Hazel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, toothpaste etc. to sell in her store.

Hazel has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Hazel would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Susan
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, spices and other snack foods.
texts:
Susan is 44 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are still in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, spices and other snack foods.

Susan has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Leah Marie
use: to purchase additional grocery stock.
texts:
Leah Marie is 22 years old, single, and lives with her mother in the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is still in school, taking courses for her Bachelor of Science degree in Education. In her spare time, Leah Marie engages in grocery selling in their neighborhood. Her mother attends her grocery store if Leah Marie is in school.

Leah Marie joined GDMPC in 2015, availed a loan, and fully repaid on time. Now she has availed a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP. She wants to finish her studies and help her parents.

name: Gulchehra
use: to buy more baking supplies to make tastier and fresher desserts, and attract more customers.
texts: Gulchehra is a professional baker, making cakes and pastries. She is 47 years old. She lives in Dushanbe with her 3 children. Her husband is currently working abroad. Gulchehra has been baking cakes for three years, and she takes custom orders from her home. Unfortunately, Gulchehra does not have enough money to buy the supplies she needs for cake baking. She does not want to lose customers and therefore requested a loan. Gulchehra believes in and hopes for your help.

name: Rosalinda
use: to buy additional items such as drinks, chips, biscuits, etc. to sell.
texts:
Rosalinda is 63 years old and married with five children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a snack vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as drinks, chips, biscuits etc to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the snack vending business for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Florence
use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides.
texts:
Florence is an elderly lady, still in the prime days of her life. She is a smallholder farmer. She is strong for her age and is highly motivated. She says the culture of working hard was inculcated in her at a very young age by her parents. Florence is married to a fellow farmer.

Her family's main income source is milk from their dairy farm. However, they are also involved in other agricultural activities such as growing bananas, vegetables, fruits and grains.

The biggest problem that farmers from Nkubu face is the huge deficit in terms of access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya.

Through these financial services, farmers from Nkubu, like Florence, can now buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms. Florence is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides.

Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her meet the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and improve her family's quality of life. She also hopes to improve the conditions of her house.

Florence, her hubby and children highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders so that they can achieve their dreams. Take action and lend now!

name: Jolly
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
The Jolly works hard to support one child. She is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Jolly requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Jolly is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Julia
use: to allow her to venture into other areas of farming, like horticulture, in order to help her family.
texts:
Over time, Julia has been persevering to reach her goal of improving her living conditions and having a better life. She is a loving and unassuming woman who works tirelessly for the welfare of her family. She hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, near Mount Kenya (a major tourist attraction in Africa).

She has been farming for the past five years. Through those years, she gathered much experience, and is considered among the best farmers in her village. Julia practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet.

Julia has always wanted to increase her income by buying horticultural seeds to plant, so that once the crops are ready for harvest, she can sell them. That is why she is seeking this loan.

Kenya's Kerugoya area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for horticulture produce. This means that Julia could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Her greatest dream is to see her family happy, making progress, and avoiding deprivation.

She promises to pay back the loan in full.

name: Jovie
use: to invest in materials for the shop like hair dye, clippers, and scissors.
texts:
Jovie is a hardworking 34-year-old man who earns a living managing a barber shop. He caters to hair cuts and hair coloring, respectively. He has been in that kind of business for more than five years.

He is a married man and and has seven dependents - ages 2 to 12 years old respectively.

He wants to continue improving his quality of life, which is why he is requesting a loan with CEVI to invest in materials for the shop like hair dye, clippers, and scissors. He is striving hard to manage his current project to continue to support the schooling of his children for a brighter future.

name: Eva Mari San
use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.
texts:
Eva Mari San is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eva Mari San is 43 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Eva Mari San has a vending of vegetables business in the Philippines. Eva Mari San requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Eva Mari San has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Eva Mari San would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Nasreen
use: to buy embroidery items for making intricate embroidery designs on formal clothing.
texts:
Nasreen is 40 years old and lives in a small house with her family. Her family is comprised of her husband and four children. Nasreen put up a small embroidery workshop five years ago as her husband was unable to fully financially support them. Though she works on a small scale, she has managed to earn some money to cover the family expenses. Along with that she also looks after her household. She is thankful for the skill she has as it has helped her in really difficult times.

Currently, she wants to make a few orders and needs to buy embroidery items. Having no capital, she has asked BRAC Pakistan to provide her with a loan to complete the orders timely. She has previously taken loans as well and hopes that this loan will help her increase her sales.

She dreams of having a bigger boutique in the future.

name: Nadia Bb
use: to buy embroidery raw material for her husband's embroidery business.
texts:
Nadia Bb is a 33-year-old is lady, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family, and he has been running an embroidery business for two years. Her husband's embroidery business is very famous in the market, and that is the reason her husband's business runs well. Due to good relations, her husband's business has increased. He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance, to have in stock. He requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand. The challenge her husband is facing is having sufficient capital to run the business and to be able to support the family in its present form.

Therefore, Nadia Bb humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, her husband will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors that he needs.

Nadia Bb and her family will be thankful to Kiva, its lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

name: Teresita
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
STeresita is 49 years old and has three children. Teresita is married and all three of the children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Anna Be
use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
texts:
Anna Be is 46 years old and married with nine children.

Anna Be works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, toothpaste, etc., to sell in her store.

Anna Be has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Anna Be aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Perla
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Perla works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Perla requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Perla is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting environment protection.

name: Susana
use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
texts:
Susana is 29 years old and married with one child.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell in her store.

Susana has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from retailing rice.

Susana aspires to save money to expand her business.

name: Hezekiah
use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.
texts:
Born in the ghetto but promising himself that he would not die there and that he would be successful: this is Hezekiah. He is a father from a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya.

He is a very hardworking person. Thanks to his daily efforts, he has managed to give his children a good start by providing them with a good-quality education.

Hezekiah’s primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. He also earns some income from a personal business. He never had any formal education and is content with the farming lifestyle. The Thika area is a favorable area for farming, so he is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers to enable him to grow more crops, reap maximum profits, and also increase his farming business.

Being a smallholder farmer, accessing funds in Kenya, especially the Thika area, is very challenging, but Hezekiah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help hardworking farmers like him. Through the loan, he will sell his farm produce to his neighbors and local market.

His goal is to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His biggest dreams are to be able to support his family by himself, to become independent, and to buy a home.

name: Francisco
use: to buy materials like paper, paint, wire, plastic, glue, etc. to make and sell floral arrangements.
texts:
Francisco was able to go to school until fifth grade. His partner earns a living selling flowers and they have three children, of whom only their daughter lives with them.

Francisco earns a living selling floral arrangements for all types of events. He has 10 years of experience and learned from his family. He also makes trips in his vehicle, which also serves him to sell the flowers. He works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. and his daughter helps him.

He needs the loan to buy materials like paper, paint, wire, plastic, glue, etc. to make and sell floral arrangements.

Francisco dreams of having a better business in the future and his loan will help him to start achieving his dream.

name: Mirian Noemy
use: to buy flour, yeast, butter, eggs and sugar to make bread.
texts:
Mirian never went to school. She's partnered and her partner works in artisanal fishing. They live in a house they take care of which does not belong to them. Her children are in primary school and depend on both of them.

Mirian earns a living making bread. Before, she worked selling seafood. Currently, her partner helps her make bread.

She's been supported with two Kiva loans in the past and has already paid them off. She needs a new loan to buy flour, yeast, butter, eggs and sugar to make bread.

She dreams of having an industrial oven and making her business more efficient.

name: Nkhon's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Nkhon’s group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Nkhon makes a living by cultivating rice to support her family, which includes one young daughter. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Nkhon safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Bahrombek
use: to expand his tea house/canteen.
texts: Bahrombek is a hardworking man who was born in 1956. He lives in the country with his family, which has six members. He has worked as a cook for several years. He makes a living by running a chaikhana (tea house/canteen). He is always at the chaikhana making delicious pilaf. His tasty food brings in many customers. He prepares 60 servings of pilaf a day. When work on the communal farms begins in the spring, many farm workers order pilaf from him for lunch. Since he has so many customers, he would like to expand his chaikhana and stock up on ingredients (rice, oil) in order to increase the amount of pilaf he makes. He applied for a loan at the microfinance organization Arvand. He would like to use this loan to stock up on foodstuffs and to create a comfortable space for his customers by expanding his workplace and buying several traditional couches. He would like to thank all of his coworkers for their support.

name: Roselyn
use: to buy additional buckets of fish to sell.
texts:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional buckets of fish to sell for her fish-vending business. Roselyn has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

name: Manuela
use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
texts:
Manuela is 44 years old and has two children. She is married and one child of hers is in school.

Manuela is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Manuela has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Later on, Manuela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Reuy's Group
use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers for her farming.
texts:
Reuy is a married woman who has three children, all of whom are school age. Reuy lives in the Banon district of Battambang province, Cambodia.

Reuy is a farmer who has been farming rice for almost ten years, and her husband has been working as a paid worker for almost six years. Each day she can earn about 23,000 KHR, and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

As a mother of six children, Reuy is working very hard to support the family. This is her seventh loan cycle with VisionFund. She has used the past loan in very smart ways to grow her farming successfully.

To make more income, Reuy is leading this group to request a loan via VisionFund. She will use this loan portion in order to buy more seeds and fertilizers for her farming. She hopes this year she can get more yields from her farming.

name: Shabana
use: to buy commodities for her husband's general store to enhance his business.
texts:
Shabana is a 41-year-old married women and the mother of six children who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is standing with her husband.

Her husband has been running a general store for many years near his house, and the business is operating very well. He has been running a small general store for five years. His shop is situated in a populated area, and there are a lot of customers available here to buy miscellaneous general store items.

He wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable for daily use. He wants to offer stationery items such as copies, pencil, pens, led pencils, erasers, etc., but the major problem is the shortage of funds. Therefore, Shabana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could buy sacks of rice, sugar, and flour and additional stationery items. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that she will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

name: Ratna Kartika
use: to build a clean water source facility in her home.
texts:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KSPPS BMI’s clients, Ratna Kartika. She is 30 years old, married, and has two sons and one daughter. Ratna Kartika is a housewife who stays at home to look after her daughter who is still too young. Her husband has been working very hard as a parking attendant in the Tangerang District for the past 10 years. He is the only breadwinner in the family. Her husband’s income is barely enough for their basic needs. She and her husband would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their children.

Ratna Kartika has requested a loan of 10,000,000 IDR from KSPPS BMI. The loan will be used to build a clean water source facility in her home in order to improve access to water for her family. Today her family has no access to a water source in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a water source, but Ratna Kartika will be able to pay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean water. Ratna Kartika is extremely grateful for this opportunity and would like to thank all of the lenders.

name: Seun's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Seun’s Group lives in a rural village in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Seun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. She has one son in her family. Her village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Seun safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save the time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Marissa
use: to buy potatoes, garlic, bitter gourds and different varieties of sweet potatoes and beans to sell.
texts:
Marissa is a single parent of a sixteen-year-old daughter. To support her child, she previously worked for wages, then went into business. She had different businesses in the past, anywhere from selling ready-to-wear clothes to food supplements.

Three years ago Marissa was finally able to find her niche in business by selling vegetables. It has gone well, and she is able to rent a stall on a continuing basis in the town's public market.

In anticipation of the rainy season, Marissa wants to keep stocks of vegetables that have a long shelf life. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner SEED Center to buy potatoes, garlic, bitter gourds and different varieties of sweet potatoes and beans to sell from her stall.

Marissa says buying these vegetables in bulk will save her time and money, since otherwise she must make frequent trips to the large markets in Manila to buy them. She deems that this would get her more in income and savings at the same time.

name: Dalerjon
use: to expand his livestock activities by increasing his livestock count.
texts:
This young man is Dalerjon. He is 22 years old and resides with his family in the Vaksh region. He has a small family, consisting of his parents, sister, and brother.

Dalerjon raises cattle. His father helps him in his work. He wants to expand his livestock activities by increasing his livestock count. To complete this operation, he needs a certain sum of money. Since does not have sufficient money, Dalerjon applied for a loan.

Income from raising cattle supports his family. Dalerjon intends to save the business and does not want to lose the income source.

name: Mary June
use: to buy school bags, lunch bags, undergarments, foot socks, lanyards, and ID casing to sell to her customers.
texts:
Mary June is married and has three children, all of whom are studying. She and her husband jointly own and manage a stall selling different items such as watches, ladies accessories, bags, stuffed toys and novelty items.

Four years ago, when the business started, Mary June was the only one who managed the business. However, with increased sales and orders coming in, Mary June found it hard to run the business on her own. It was a year ago when her husband decided to stop working so that he could help manage the business and personally attend to purchasing inventory.

With the school opening coming soon, Mary June sees this as an opportunity for increased sales. She is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan to buy school bags, lunch bags, undergarments, foot socks, lanyards, and ID casing to sell to her customers.

Mary June is hopeful that with this new inventory, she can earn more and save more in preparation for her three children's expenses when they go to college by next year.

name: Ey's Group
use: to buy a ceramic water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Ey and her two group members live in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In Ey’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Because of this the three group members have applied for a 504,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner iDE Cambodia to buy a ceramic water filter for each. Having a water filter at home will help them to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Walyoba United Group
use: to buy more fuel to sell.
texts:
Grace is the woman in the photograph with her hand raised. She is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Masindi, Uganda. Grace is a hardworking woman who has been in the business of selling fuel for the past 10 years. She says that she has been able to look after her family because of her business.

Grace hopes for her business to be self-sustaining, but she doesn’t have enough capital. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fuel to sell.

name: Quenna
use: to purchase sacks of feed, additional piglets, and other supplies for raising her pigs.
texts:
Quenna is a married woman who is 22 years old and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Quenna has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, additional piglets, and other supplies for raising her pigs. Quenna has been in this business for two years.

She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

name: Marlyn
use: to purchase additional raw materials to make nipa roofing to sell.
texts:
Marlyn, 53, is married with two children, both of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marlyn has a nipa roof-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Marlyn has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional raw materials to make nipa roofing to sell. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

name: Sayohat
use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to modernize her sewing processes and make more dresses in less time.
texts:
Sayohat, 31, is proud to be a wife and mother. She lives with her family in a town called Nurek and she works at home as a seamstress. She has not been doing this for long, but she has already mastered the job.

Her income from this business is an absolute necessity for Sayohat, and now she has a big problem. She broke her sewing machine and, to keep making money, she urgently needs to buy a new sewing machine. She has no money to buy a sewing machine. So, filled with hope, she has asked for this loan.

Support Sayohat!

name: Sang's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Sang’s Group lives in a rural village in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Sang makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. Her village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Sang safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save the time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Expedito
use: to build his house.
texts:
Expedito is a 42-year-old man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a school teacher and has been in this profession for 10 years. Expedito is a hardworking man who is responsible for looking after his dependents. His main challenge is dealing with delayed salaries.

Expedito hopes to build a farmhouse, so he is requesting a loan to pay the construction costs.

name: Rubina
use: to buy a new Juki sewing machine and sewing materials to continue operating her tailoring business and make it more efficient.
texts:
Rubina, 41, is married and the mother of four children. She is pictured here with her husband. They live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Rubina is a hardworking, independent mother who helps her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past 10 years. She is very knowledgeable in the techniques of stitching. Her husband brings her cloths to sew garments for nearby factories. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operating her business, she has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine (her previous Juki sewing machine is out of order due to its continuous use) as well as sewing materials, i.e., needles, spools, threads and cotton. She also wants to purchase the new sewing machine and sewing materials to provide fast and more efficient stitching work.

In addition to repaying the loan, Rubina wishes to thank Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

name: Ream
use: Ream to buy a cow.
texts:
Aged 59 years, Ream is married and lives with her family in a rural area of Kampot Province. Ream has been farming for thirty years, and that, plus extra income as a schoolteacher, are the family’s main sources of income. She is able to save about 3 US dollars a day. The main challenge to her farming is destruction by insects.

Ream has applied for a 2,500,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia. With it she will buy a cow to add to her rice farming as a way to gain good profits. She hopes with a good income she can improve her family’s lifestyle.

name: Charity
use: to buy farm supplies and seeds in order to improve her harvest.
texts:
This is Charity -- a polite, devoted, responsible, and hardworking woman. She works by raising animals and horticultural crops, which she started doing out of economic necessity. Charity started practicing mixed farming five years ago. This means she grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. She has gained so much experience throughout the time she has been farming.

Although Charity has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mother. Her farm has not been producing much of a harvest lately due to a lack of fertilizer and good seeds, as well as the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm supplies and seeds in order to improve her farm.

With this loan, Charity will be assured of a good harvest, which will translate into more profits and income. She wants what any mother would want, which is a bright future for her children. You can support Charity in making her dreams come true by making a loan.

Charity really hopes to receive the support of the lenders and is looking forward to a warm response. She expresses her thanks in advance.

name: Thuong's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Thuong’s Group lives in a rural village in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Thuong makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Thuong safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Heak's Group
use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and to renovate a latrine.
texts:
Heak lives in Battambang Province. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children who are dependent on her. Heak has been growing rice for the past 10 years to support her family. In addition, she works as a paid laborer to supplement her income. Since crop prices have decreased at the market, she is not able to earn as much income as before.

Heak has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. She successfully repaid her previous loans, which helped to increase her income so that she can better support her family. Heak is now leading a two-member group in order to obtain her fourth loan. She will use her portion of this group loan to buy more seeds and fertilizers so that she can improve her farmland. Part of the money will also be used to renovate her latrine. She wants her family to have good sanitation and a better living environment.

name: Lisa
use: to renovate her store.
texts:
Lisa lives with her husband in Kean Svay District, in the Kandal Province of Cambodia. Her husband is a construction worker, and she is a grocery seller who has been operating her grocery store for two years. She purchases all products such as shampoo, beverages, and so on to sell from local markets.

Lisa is in need of some working capital to renovate her store from small to big. The rest of the money will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband's transport to work. She decided to apply for a loan from Maxima Microfinance PLC using this loan. She will be able to renovate her store and purchase a motorbike for her husband.

name: Violette
use: to buy read-to-wear clothing such as stockings, coats, gloves, and other winter accessories.
texts: Violette is 32 years old and lives in the town center. She has three children. For eight years she has had a stall selling ready-to-wear clothing in the town’s main market. She is a good partner with Vahatra. Since partnering with them she has been able to considerably augment her merchandise. Her business is stable. She needs to borrow money to further increase and diversify her merchandise. Violette travels to the Capital to stock up on supplies; she strives to offer the latest clothing trends to her customers. She needs this loan to buy stockings, coats, gloves, and other winter accessories. She uses her earnings to raise animals and to buy things for her home. She wants to achieve total financial independence in the near future.

name: Oanh's Group
use: to build a new sanitation system for her house for all members to use.
texts:
Oanh is of a Thai ethnic background. She lives with her husband, her son and her daughter in So'n La city, a subsidized unit of So'n La province.

Her family's main income is her husband's meager retirement salary, which is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and save a small amount.

Oanh wants to build a new sanitation system for her house for all members to use but she does not have enough money to buy the building materials. Therefore, she wants a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that this loan from M7 Microfinance will help her family have a new, convenient sanitation system to use and protect their health. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time.

name: Xuan's Group
use: to cover her cost of learning for her son.
texts:
Xuan, born in 1983, is from the Kinh ethnic group in Vietnam. She lives with her husband and son in the district of Muong La, in So'n La province.

The family's main sources of income are from the salaries that she and her husband earn as civil servants, but they earn just enough to cover the family's living expenses and save a small amount. Xuan's son is in primary school, and Xuan wants a loan to cover the cost of his learning because she does not have enough money to do that now.

Xuan hopes that this loan will help her son have better conditions for learning and a good future.

name: San Cayetano Group
use: to buy eggs, flour, butter, candy, sugar, and other ingredients for making cakes.
texts:
This is a new group that was established in the city of Coronel Oviedo. The members are participating in the poverty elimination program so that they can overcome their poverty situation with the help of Fundación Paraguaya, training, and follow-up.

One of the members is Hildes, who also serves as president of the group. She earns her living by selling cakes that she prepares herself. Hildes says this type of work allows her to make a decent and honest living. She has an established clientele who buy her delicious cakes and always place many orders.

Hildes is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making cakes such as eggs, flour, butter, candy, sugar, and other ingredients. She appreciates the opportunity to receive training so that she can grow and provide the best for her family.

name: Thiem's Group
use: to invest in his son's education.
texts:
Thiem is 30 years old. His family comprises three members, himself, his wife and his son. The family lives in Mai So'n district, in So'n La province.

The family's main sources of income are cultivation and breeding but they provide just enough to cover the family's living expenses and save a small amount. Thiem wants to invest in his son's education but does not have enough money to pay for his son's school fees. Therefore, he wants to take out a loan with M7 Microfinance for this purpose.

Thiem will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time. He hopes this loan will help his son have better conditions for learning and give his son a brighter future.

name: Manantiales Group
use: to buy a variety of cosmetics to sell.
texts:
Manantiales Group is in its twenty-second loan cycle. They have been working as a group for many cycles now. They're known in their neighborhoods for being persevering and enterprising women who work hard for their families. They're in the poverty-elimination program, each one looking to overcome her poverty.

One of the members is Agustina, who sells cosmetics to earn a living. She said she has steady customers because she always tries to have all types of products to sell to her customers as a way to generate the income to be able to help support her household.

She's requesting this loan so she can buy a variety of cosmetics as a way to cover her customer demand.

She's grateful for this chance to to be able to continue working to give her family the best.

name: Gneta Group
use: to buy sheep for later resale in order to grow her business.
texts: Natieni is standing among the members of her group holding the sheep’s rope in her right hand. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of eight children ranging in age from 10 to 25 years old. Two of the children have been to school; she herself is illiterate. Her husband is a farmer and is also involved in raising animals to provide for the family. Natieni has been raising animals for ten years. She buys her inventory in the local market. She is appealing to RMCR to improve the state of her business as well as her children’s way of life. Natieni has a very good reputation in her village. Thanks to the profits from this business, she is able to meet her family’s needs. She currently owns two sheep. She makes 10,000 to 15,000 FCFA per sale. In the future she plans to take out another loan to grow her business.

name: Phong's Group
use: to build a new house.
texts:
Phong, 28, is Thai. She lives with her husband and her two daughters in the Mai So'n district of So'n La province in Vietnam.

Her family's main income comes from cultivation and breeding, but the family earns just enough to cover living expenses and save a small amount. Phong wants to build a new house, but the family's savings are not enough for building materials. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan for this purpose.

She hopes this loan from M7-Microfinance will help her family have a new house. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time.

name: Nab
use: to buy more land in order to expand rice farmland to gain more yields.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Peam Ror District

texts:
Living in a rural area of Prey Veng province, Nab is 62 years old and a mother of four children. She provides for the needs of her family via rice-growing and cow-raising. She has been involved in the current businesses for many years and they have allowed her to keep about 6 USD per day as her daily saving. The rice’s price was drop while she is getting the rice crop and it is her main challenge.

She has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles, including this one, with a successful repayment of her past loans, which enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. Nab will spend her loan to buy more land in order to expand her rice farmland to gain more yields. With this loan, she hopes that her farming can produce higher yield than last year.

name: Thanh's Group
use: to repair her house.
texts:
Mrs. Thanh, who is 34 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is living with her husband, her son, and her daughter in Sơn La City, a subsidized unit of Sơn La province.

The main income of her family is from cultivation and breeding, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family in addition to saving a small amount. She wants to repair her house, but she does not have enough money to buy building materials. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family repair their house to make it newer and more spacious to live in. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

name: Savoeun
use: to renovate her old house to get better than before.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Peam Ror District

texts:
Savoeun is a 37-year-old living in Prey Veng province and a mother of three children. One of her children is still studying in high school and youngest two are still underage for school. For many years, she has been growing rice and raising cows as the main sources of her family’s income. Because of the rice’s price drop while she got the yield crop, it is the main challenge of her family’s business.

Savoeun is requesting a loan with VisionFund as her first-time loan to renovate her old house to get better than before. She hopes this loan can help her and her family live in a nice house in the future time.

name: Nagina Begum
use: to buy food items, crockery and plastic furniture for her husband's restaurant business to enhance it more.
texts:
Nagina Begum is a 29-year-old married lady and the mother of three children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods. She cooks some dishes for the restaurant and the people like to eat from the restaurant of her husband. Her husband hired a worker for his restaurant; he has to pay salary to that worker.

He has been running his restaurant for many years. This is the reason why most of the chairs, utensils and crockery have broken. This is the reason why her husband wants to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and crockery but his major income spend over household expenses. Therefore, Nagina Begum has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils and crockery.

Nagina Begum thanks Kiva and appreciates the warmth support for her.

name: Nga's Group
use: to buy organic fertilizer for her garden of vegetables.
texts:
Nga, 31 years old, is a Thai woman. She is living with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

The main income of her family is from cultivation and breeding, so it is just enough to cover the living expense of her family and allow a small amount of saving. She wants to buy organic fertilizer for her garden of vegetables but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her tend the vegetable garden well, and the coming harvest of vegetables will bring her family a considerable profit.

name: Phong's Group
use: to invest in raising pigs to get additional income for her family.
texts:
Mrs. Phong, 40 years old, is a Thai woman. She is living with her husband, her son and her daughter-in-law in Mai Son district, Son La province.

The main income of her family is from farming, so it is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and allow a small amount of saving. She wants to invest in raising pigs to get additional income for her family but she does not have enough money to buy food for the pigs. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and next year when selling the pigs, her family can earn tens of millions Vietnamese dong as profit.

name: Samoeung's Group
use: to buy more seed, fertilizer and pesticide to improve her farmland.
texts:
Samoeung is a married woman, 63, living in Mondulkiri province. She has five children, two of whom are still in school. She is growing rice as her main income to support her family, but her rice got lower yields. It’s her main challenge.

This is will be her first cycle loan from VisionFund. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for this loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy more seed, fertilizer and pesticide to improve her farmland. She hopes she can get high yields and increase her income to provide a better support for her family.

name: Chom's Group
use: to buy fertilizer for her family coffee field.
texts:
Chom, born in 1987, is a Thai woman. She has joined the program of M7-MFI (its forerunner) since 2008. She is living with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on the occupation of breeding and cultivation, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and a small amount of saving. She wants to buy fertilizer for her family coffee field but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family tend the coffee field well, and next year the harvest of coffee will be abundant to help improve the living condition of her family.

name: Bona's Group
use: to buy more fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farming to get higher yield.
texts:
Bona, 33, lives with family members in a rural area located in Battambang province. She is a mother blessed with three children, two of whom are studying in high school, and the other one is too young. She struggles for a living via rice farming and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in her farming for 10 years and it has enabled her to keep up about 6 USD per day for saving.

This is her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund, as she has fully repaid her past loans. Her living condition has improved from before via the previous loans. In a group of three members, she is the group leader. Bona will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and rice seed in order to support her rice farming. She hopes that her farming can produce more yields than last year via this loan.

name: Khanh's Group
use: to pay for her daughter's education fees.
texts:
Mrs. Khanh, 45 years old, is a Thai woman. She is living with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

The main income of her family is from cultivation and breeding, so it is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and give a small amount of saving. Her eldest daughter is studying at a university with a major in pre-school teaching, so Khanh wants to borrow a loan to pay for her daughter's education fees because right now she does not have enough money to pay for it.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her daughter have better condition for studying, and when she graduates, she will have a good job with stable income.

name: Gilbert Pablo
use: to buy construction materials in order to provide a safe home for his family.
texts:
Gilbert is a hardworking 50-year-old man. He lives with his partner and 3 children in the town of Quishuarani, which is located in Ayacucho. He raises cattle for a living. He always puts great attention into the care and feed that he provides them. He also works in construction.

He is requesting a small loan so that he can buy construction materials provide a safe home for his family. Gilbert hopes in the future to be able to improve his family's quality of life. He also makes great efforts so that his children receive a good education and become people of great principle.

name: Ana Ytolia
use: to buy more carao fruit and tamarindo to continue selling.
texts:
Ana went to school up to the first grade, because she is from a low income family. She is married, and her spouse works in agriculture and her children live on their own.

Ana sells carao fruit and tamarind. She has approximately 25 years' experience in this area and she learned it from her husband. She also grows corn and beans in season.

Ana will use the loan to buy more carao fruit and tamarind to continue selling.

She has always dreamed of buying a pick-up truck to transport the merchandise she sells.

name: Narcelinda
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts:
Narcelinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Narcelinda is 54 years old.

Narcelinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Narcelinda has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Narcelinda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Narcelinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Srey
use: to buy more piglets in order to expand her pig-raising business.
texts:
A resident of Kampot province, Srey is 38 years old and a mother of two dependent children. Growing rice and raising pigs are the main sources of her income with which she can support her living condition. Drought and insect infestation are the main challenges of her farming. She has been with the current businesses for ages and it has allowed her to save from the daily income about 6 USD per day for future need.

For Srey, this is her second microloan with VisionFund and she has already paid her past loan on time. Her family’s living has improved from before via the previous loan. Srey will spend her loan on buying more piglets to expand her pig raising business. She dreams that her family’s business will run smooth and earn her with more income to upgrade her standard of living.

name: Sophorn's Group
use: to purchase more fertilizer to improve on her rice farmland to gain good yield.
texts:
A villager living in Battambang province, Sophorn is 42 years old and married. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are still in school, and the other ones are too young.

For the last 10 years, she earns income to improve on her family’s living via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to supplement income. She did not get good yield from her farming because it was destroyed by insects. It is her main challenge.

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund and she has repaid back her past loan. Via the previous loan, she can update her family with a decent home appliance for using in her house. Now, she is leading a group of three members to seek this new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan to buy more fertilizer to support on her rice farmland to gain good yield. She hopes that this loan can help on her farming grow with higher yield, so she can gain more income to update her lifestyle and support her children’s studies.

name: Procesa
use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Procesa is 66 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Procesa is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Procesa has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Maria
use: to pay her program fees.
texts:
María is still in her accounting program. She said that now she's in her third year of the program, striving to be a professional who can be of help, not only to herself but also to others. She's someone who fights for her loved ones to have everything they need.

With her previous loan she was able to pay her program fees, which was a big help to her.

She's requesting this loan so she can pay her program fees and that way be able to continue with her studies.

name: Maria
use: Maria to buy staple products to re-sell.
texts:
Maria is 35 years old and lives with her partner. She is a retailer and does not play a role in the community. She lives in a house she owns and is the mother of two children ages 14 and 9 who are in the 7th and 4th grades, respectively.
With this loan she intends to increase the volume of merchandise, buying oil, rice, a variety of drinks, and preserves.
This is her fourth loan at Hluvuku, and she used the previous loans in her store, increasing the volume of merchandise. With her profits, she is going to do construction on her house.
Her dream is to buy a car.

name: Cruz Rolando
use: to buy agricultural supplies for his corn and bean crops, and to pay for manual labor.
texts:
Cruz only went to school until 2nd grade. He is single and lives with his parents, whom he supports financially.

Cruz is a day laborer. Ever since he was young, his father would take him along to work in the fields. His day starts very early at 5 a.m. He also grows his own corn and bean crops.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies for the corn and bean crops. He also will pay for manual labor.

Above all, Cruz hopes that this growing season is good and yields an excellent harvest. He also hopes to improve his home, and he would like to go back to school.

name: Boots
use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
Boots is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Boots is 45 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Boots has a buy-and-sell fire wood business in the Philippines. Boots has requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

Boots has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Boots would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Julieta
use: Julieta to buy staple products to re-sell.
texts:
Julieta is 60 years old, a retailer, and single. She is the mother of five children, all of whom live in houses of their own. She lives with just her 20-year-old grandson who works at a banana producer. She does not play a role in the community. She lives in a house she owns.
She says that with this loan she intends to increase her business's merchandise with items like peanuts, beans, oil, broth and spices. She also wants to increase the volume of her sales.
This is her second loan at Hluvuku; with the last loan she invested in her business, and she still plans to come back and ask to buy a car.
Her dream is to buy a car.

name: Erica
use: to pay tuition costs.
texts:
Erica continues her studies in accounting. She says she strives to be a useful professional, not only for herself but also fro others.

Through her earlier loan, she said she was able to pay tuition costs, which was very helpful.

She's seeking this new loan to be able to continue with her sales and thus continue her schooling as she's been doing.

name: Noé
use: to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land and plant corn.
texts:
Noé is 34 years old and partnered, and his partner is a housewife. They have two children and a stepson who he raised as his son who appears in the photo with him.

Noé earns a living growing and selling corn, which he learned from his father. He works from 6:30 to 10:30 a.m. and walks two kilometers from his house to the land he now plants. His partner helps him in her free time.

His earlier Kiva loan helped him a lot with his agriculture, and he paid the debt promptly. He needs a new loan to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the land and plant corn.

He hopes to have good results from his crops and support his children so have have the education they deserve.

name: Marco Tulio
use: to buy agricultural inputs for farming corn.
texts:
Marco is fifty four years old. He studied through second grade. He is married and has three children, all of whom are grown.

Marco raises cattle. He has been working in this business for more than twenty years. He also farms corn, which he does with his wife’s help.

He needs the loan to buy inputs for farming corn. This way he’ll have a good harvest and forage for his cattle.

His dreams are to improve his cattle business and that his corn will be productive.

name: Amélida
use: to buy basic goods to stock her store.
texts:
Amélida is 39 years old. She had to leave school in order to support herself and cover her household's basic needs, as she is also a single mother.

Amélida has a small store where she sells candy, basic grains, drinks, and other products. Before she had the business, she used to sell traditional plates of food such as meat-filled pastries and tamales.

She greatly needs the help of this loan to buy basic goods to stock her store. She has been supported by three prior Kiva loans, and has repayed them all on time.

Her dreams are that her business keep prospering and that her children become professionals.

name: Maria
use: to pay tuition costs.
texts:
Maria is married and formed a partnership from a young age. She is also continuing her education. She finished an accounting degree and is now studying teaching. Both of them work.

She hopes to be able to be someone in life so her loved ones don't have to pass up necessities. She's seeking this loan to be able to pay tuition costs.

name: Benkadi Group
use: to buy rams to resell.
texts: Assana is the one holding the ram by its horns among the group members. He is 28 years old, married and has three children ages 2 to 9, none of whom are in school. His wife is a homemaker and also works in a small shop to help the family. He has been working livestock farming for ten years. He is illiterate. He gets his animals at the Fatinè market. He has asked RMCR for help to improve his business and his children's quality of life. Thanks to the profits from his business, Assana manages to meet his family's needs. Right now, he has three sheep. He has a revenue of 15,000 to 20,000 CFA francs per sale. In the coming days, he wants to increase his next loan and grow his business.

name: Jean Michel
use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides for his cocoa field.
texts:
Jean Michel is a 49-year-old. He is married and has three children, between the ages of 5 and 14. All three of the children are in school. By education, he is a bricklayer, but he lives in an area village with his family where he runs a 3-hectare, 40-year-old cocoa plantation which he inherited from his family.
In this time of year, he has difficulties maintaining his field because he lacks financial liquidity. He has asked for a loan to buy 42 bags of Ridomil (fungicide), ammonium sulfate and other fertilizers to cover the needs of his fields. This will increase his production and thus his sales. The additional revenue will allow him to buy the materials he needs to build a house. Jean Michel would like to further expand his business and improve his quality of life.

name: María Magdalena
use: to buy agricultural inputs for growing corn and caring for it so the harvest will be good.
texts:
María lives with her husband and their two young children. Her husband works at a farm in the area and he's also a farmer. Their children go to school.

María works in agriculture and decided to do this in order to help her husband. She needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs to grow corn and care for it so the harvest will be good.

María wants to plant beans next time so she can have more income.

name: Nelson
use: to pay his university fees.
texts:
Nelson is from the city of Carapeguá. He provides electrical services to earn a living and generate an income to continue with his studies in the business administration program. He said that this is how he wants to earn a living and be able to help his family.

His goal is to be able to graduate in his field and be a useful professional for other people and his family.

He's requesting this loan so he can pay his program fees and that way continue with his studies.

name: Patricia
use: to buy cooking utensils.
texts:
Patricia is a woman who lives at the home of her parents. She is the mother of two children.

Patricia is a seamstress, but at the moment, she secured a concession stand at a sports complex. In other words, she has a kiosk where she sells food. She says that this new business is generating more profit than sewing, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy cooking utensils to expand her business.

name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group
use: to buy a variety of clothing for sale, such as shorts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, tops, jeans, and other items.
texts:
The name of the group is Mujeres Trabajadoras [Hardworking Women]. They are in their 2nd loan cycle, and are participating in the poverty elimination survey, where all of them attempt to improve their living conditions. They work to overcome their situation of poverty.

One of the members is Gabriela, who, through her continuous hard work and selling clothes, is able to contribute to her family’s income. She works in this business because she saw in it a way to earn income for her family, so they won’t want for any necessities.

She is requesting this loan so she can purchase shorts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, tops, jeans, and other items, so she can continue with her sales. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing in her business and also help her family.

name: Sreynich's Group
use: to pay a plowing fee to improve her farmland.
texts: Sreynich is living in Mondulkiri province. She has two children. One is still in school and the other one is too young for school. She is growing rice as her main income to support her family. Her rice didn’t grow well and she got lower yields. She needed to find another income by working for others. She has been with Visionfund for seventeen loan cycles already.
