She has paid her past loans well and her previous loans have helped her live in a better environment. Now she is leading a group of two members to apply for this eighteenth loan cycle. As a group leader, she will use her loan to pay a plowing fee to improve her farmland. She hopes she can get more income to support her family.

name: Balbina Rosario
use: to buy sugar, soap, lard, eggs, rice, soft drinks, bread, snack foods, and other basic household products.
texts:
Doña Balbina is 44 years old and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Intibuca.

Balbina established a business in her home 11 years ago. At her business she sells sugar, bread, coffee, eggs, candy, snack foods, soft drinks, condiments, soap, and other grocery products. She is requesting her ninth loan from ODEF in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of sugar, soap, lard, eggs, rice, soft drinks, bread, snack foods, and other basic household products. The loan will give her the ability to buy more products so that she can improve her sales and have a better quality of life.

name: Alejandra
use: pay for tuition expenses.
texts:
Alejandra continues with her bachelor’s studies in audiovisual communication. She explains that her greatest wish is to be a useful professional in society, so she can provide good service to those who need it. With her previous loan she paid for living costs, which allowed her to continue studying.

She is now requesting a new loan so she can cover her tuition expenses, so she can continue studying. She is grateful for this new opportunity that she has to continue with her studies, she can advance closer to her goals.

name: Kuña Mbarete Group
use: to buy a variety of perfume to sell.
texts:
The group called “Kuña Mbarete” is in the Poverty Elimination program. The group carries this name which means Strong Women as this is what they are, strong and determined women who are searching to better the living conditions of their families.

One member who stands out in the group for being very self-sacrificing and hard-working is Luz. She sells all types and brands of perfume. She comments that in spite of her day-to-day problems she doesn't give up and strives each day to get ahead as she is the support for her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of perfume of all kinds and brands. In this manner she can continue with her work satisfying her customers.

name: Yim Group
use: to buy natural fertilizers for her cassava farm.
texts:
Yim is a 58-year-old widow and a mother of seven children. She resides in a village in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. Yim is a farmer who has been growing cassava since 1995 in order to earn income to support her family. Five of her children contribute to the family income by working either as a security guard or as a farmer. Her other two children are students.

In the photo, Yim is the person on the right. Due to low production last year, she decided to form a two-member group in order to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy natural fertilizers for her cassava farm. Yim believes this will help to increase her crop yields and improve her way of life. With the profit she earns from this season’s harvest, she plans to enlarge her farm and help her children obtain a higher education.

name: Cha
use: to buy more cows to expand her business of raising cows so that her business will be larger than before.
texts:
A widowed mother blessed with two children and living in Kampot province, Cha is 35 years old. She earns income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and raising cows. Besides this, she is working as a construction worker to earn more income.

She has been with her business for 17 years, and it has allowed her to save from the daily income about 4 USD per day. The drought that made her rice not grow well this year is her main challenge.

This is Cha’s first loan with VisionFund. She will spend her loan to buy more cows to support her business of raising cows. She hopes that this loan can help her family’s income increase more than before, so she can update her lifestyle better in the future.

name: Marissa
use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.
texts:
Marissa is a married woman who is 48 years old and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marissa has a business of selling rice in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Marissa has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Mirna
use: to pay her Business Administration course fees.
texts:
Mirna is studying a degree in Business Administration. She comments that she has many goals and objectives to attain. She is a very dedicated person who in spite of difficulties doesn't give up and strives to become somebody in life.

She is requesting this loan in order to pay for her course fees and in this manner be able to continue her studies.

name: Francisca
use: to pay her degree fees for her studies in Criminology.
texts:
Francisca comes from a modest and hardworking family. She is studying for a degree in Criminology and seeks to make something out of her life. With her knowledge, she wants to open doors into the workplace.

Francisca is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees, which will enable her to continue her studies as before.

name: Nhanh
use: to pay for plowing fees in order to prepare her farmland for growing summer rice.
texts:
Nhanh is 23 years old and has one child still dependent on her. She lives in Mondulkiri province with her family. To get her main income to support her family, she grows rice, but her rice didn’t grow well and brought her lower yields. She decided to work for others to get more income.

This is her second cycle loan from VisionFund, and she has repaid her past loan well. Her previous loan helped her to increase her income to support her family’s living. She will spends this new loan to pay for plowing fees in order to prepare her farmland for growing summer rice.

She hopes that her business will grow smoothly and that she can increase her income to help her family.

name: Felisa
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Felisa is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Felisa has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Eugenia
use: to buy beverages, cooking oil, sugar, and toiletries to sell.
texts:
A year ago, Eugenia opened a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various commodities such as noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, soap, and beverages. She is 48 years old and has eight children, three of whom are still attending school.

To improve her current business, she approached Kiva to request a loan in order to buy assorted products such as beverages, cooking oil, sugar, and toiletries. As a result, her earning will start to improve and she will be able to provide her family with a nutritious diet and continue sending her children to school. Eugenia will also be able to begin saving and do some expansions.

name: Calebasse De L Emergence 7 Group
use: to buy vegetables to resell.
texts: "Calebasse de L Emergence 7" is a group made up of ten women who live in the same neighborhood and work in commerce. Aissatou is the representative (the person with her hand raised in the photo). She is married and works in commerce. Her business is selling vegetables. Her work day begins at 6:30 in the morning until 12:30 pm. She is requesting a loan for 500,000 XOF. Her financing will be used to buy vegetables to resell. She is responsible for the family expenses of her household. Consequently she would like to expand her business and increase the earnings she obtains. She intends to save money and make improvements on her house in order to improve her family's living conditions.

name: Arminda
use: to buy a dairy cow so that she can produce milk and cheese to sell.
texts:
Sra. Arminda sells milk, cheese, eggs, egg-laying hens, and other products that she raises herself. She is an enterprising woman who never gives up and works hard on behalf of her family, despite the problems she has faced. Arminda wants her family to have a better quality of life and avoid having to endure hardships.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in a dairy cow, which will enable her to continue producing milk and cheese.

name: Wilma
use: to buy beverages, meat, baked goods, vegetables, fruit, and other products.
texts:
Wilma's from the city of Concepción. She has a store where she works every day from early in the morning. She has steady customers who always shop with her. This is why it's going very well for her and she has been growing little by little through her work.

She dreams of continuing to grow so she can continue to help her loved ones through her work.

She's requesting this loan to buy beverages, meat, baked goods, vegetables, fruit, and other products. She's grateful for the chance to be able to improve and grow.

name: Vanesa
use: to pay tuition costs.
texts:
Vanesa is a student majoring in commercial engineering. Her dream is to become a professional, well-trained and successful.

She works hard and gives her all so that she can achieve her goals and give something better to her family.

She is requesting the loan so she can pay her tuition payments, so that she can continue with her studies.

name: Enid
use: to pay school fees in order to become a nurse.
texts:
Enid is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her children in Masindi, Uganda. She is a nursing assistant at a health center and works very hard to look after her family, even though she complains of delayed salaries.

Enid hopes to become an enrolled nurse in the future and is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

name: Debora
use: to buy a vehicle.
texts:
Debora is a teacher in several schools. She explains that she has had her degree in sciences and sports 5 years and she also offers [tutoring] services in her house. Thanks to her work, she has been growing little by little and helps out with providing for her household.

She dreams of having a rehabilitation center and providing jobs to others. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy a vehicle, which she needs so she can keep her commitments to her clients.

name: Teresa
use: to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pig.
texts:
Teresa is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. Teresa is borrowing 8000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pig.

Teresa has been in this business for 10 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Theun Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts: Theun’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Theun works as a farmer and factory worker to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Theun safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Ma Esperanza
use: to pay for eye surgery.
texts:
Ma. Esperanza was born in the city of San Luis Potosí, but she now lives to the north of the city of Monterrey. She moved to this place in search of better opportunities. Ma. Esperanza is 46 years old and married to Jesús. They have two children, a 25-year-old daughter who has her own family and an 18-year-old son who is a preparatory student and still a dependent. In order to help her husband with paying for their son’s education, Ma. Esperanza has been working the past four years as a domestic employee.

She recently began having problems with her vision, which affects her daily life and her ability to work. Ma. Esperanza needs surgical treatment to help restore her vision, which will enable her to continue working without difficulty so that she can support her child.

name: Josefina
use: to buy flour in bulk.
texts:
Sra. Josefina is married to Sr. Derlis. They have two young children for whom they strive to provide a decent quality of life.

She has a small bakery in her home where she works with her husband. They work in order to help their family get ahead and be able to cover the day-to-day expenses.

Josefina is requesting a loan in order to buy flour in bulk. This will enable her to keep her bakery running and produce quality products for her customers.

name: Saturnina
use: to buy soaps, wines, cooking oil, laundry softeners, coffee, and other products for resale.
texts:
Saturina is a very hardworking person. She continues her work buying and selling a variety of products that she brings from Clorinda. She explains that she has a good client base and, through her business, she has the means to give her family a better quality of life. She is grateful for the support she receives, enabling her to continue her work.

She is requesting this new loan in order to buy soaps, wines, cooking oil, laundry softeners, coffee, and other products, so that she can continue with her business.

name: Anne Jeannette
use: to stock up on bags of food like macabo (new cocoyam), yams and cassava.
texts: Jeannette is a married woman with five dependent children. She has been selling fresh foods for 8 years in a local market. She would like to stock up on bags of food like macabo (new cocoyam), yams and cassava in order to have a large stock to better secure her customers' loyalty. She would like to expand in her area of business to be able to improve her well-being and that of her family.

name: Marelly Del Rocio
use: to invest in raising chickens.
texts: Marelly is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children, Sebastian, who is 12 years old, Carlos, who is 10 years old, and Estiben, who is 8 years old. They are studying, thanks to the work and effort of their parents, who work hard to give them the necessities. Marelly farms and raises animals. She is requesting the loan to invest in raising chickens. Thanks to this business, she obtains additional income to cover occasional urgent needs in the household. She sells the chickens and then has what she needs to cover those needs. She aspires to improve the quality of life for her humble family.

name: Meng Sorn's Group
use: to buy more goats to raise.
texts:
Meng Sorn is a married woman, living in Kampong Cham province. She has two children who are too young for schooling. She is raising goats for her main source of income. Her goats can sell at a low price and this is her main challenge. Meng Sorn's husband works as a construction worker to get more income to support her family.

This is her second cycle loan from Visionfund and she has repaid her previous loan successfully. Due to lacking of working capital, she is leading a group of two members to apply for this loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy more goats to raise. She hopes she can improve her business as well as increase her income to supplement her family’s need.

name: Rogelia
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care product, and other groceries.
texts:
Rogelia is 42 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rogelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care product, and other groceries.

Rogelia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rogelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Sheryl
use: to buy more fish to sell.
texts:
Sheryl is a 38-year-old woman with six children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Sheryl has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Sheryl has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Marilyn
use: to buy toiletries, rice, sodas, chips, canned goods, charcoal, and other grocery items to sell.
texts:
Marilyn finished high school and entered college, but for some reason she didn’t finish her degree. She worked as an employee for a few years, but she eventually started her own small business. Marilyn has a variety store where she sells different grocery items by the unit. She is 54 years old and lives with her family in Tandang Sora, Quezon City, Philippines. Marilyn is married to her husband Ranilo, who is 59 years old and works as a security guard.

In order to expand her business, Marilyn is requesting financial assistance in order to buy more quantities of toiletries, rice, sodas, chips, canned goods, charcoal, and other grocery items. This loan will be a big help to her business and aid with its expansion. She hopes that her family will achieve a better way of living someday.

Marilyn is a member of the Center for Community Transformation and meets weekly with her fellowship partners to share her life’s testimony and business experience with her fellowship members. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 20 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships among partners, and repay microfinance loans.

name: Sophana's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: Sophana’s Group lives in a rural village in Preah Sihanouk Province in Cambodia. Sophana does work as a fisherman to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sophana safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Rorn's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Rorn’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Rorn works as a farmer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Rorn safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Kheang's Group
use: to purchase more seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to improve her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

texts:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Kheang, is 55 years old. She has seven children, only two children still need her support. She has been growing rice for many years to get the main income for her family’s living. On the other hand, she mostly works as a paid worker to earn an additional income.

This is her second cycle loan from Visionfund. She repaid her past loan well and it has helped her to increase her income and she can live in a better house. Now she is leading a group of three members to request this loan.

As a group leader, she will use her loan to purchase more seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to improve her farmland. She hopes she can increase her income to support her family’s living.

name: Nenita
use: to buy more sacks of rice, vaccines, and additional piglets.
texts:
Nenita is 51 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice, vaccines, and additional piglets.

Nenita has been pig fattening for 4 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

name: Marissa
use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.
texts:
Marissa is 40 years old and married.

Marissa is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Marissa has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Gena
use: to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pig.
texts:
Gena is a married woman. She is 32 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gena has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccines, additional piglets and other supplies needed to raise her pig.

Gena has been in this business for 9 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

name: Arcebon
use: to buy sacks of fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.
texts:
Arcebon is 37 years old, married and has two children.

Arcebon is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Arcebon requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Arcebon has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arcebon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Neicy
use: to buy fertilizers, vegetables seeds and other farm supplies.
texts:
Neicy is 48 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are still in school.

Neicy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Neicy requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetables seeds and other farm supplies.

Neicy has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Neicy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Susan
use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.
texts:
Susan is 59 years old, widowed and has two children.

Susan is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Susan has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Diego Mauricio
use: to buy pigs, potatoes, vitamins, deparasitizers and balanced animal feed.
texts:
Diego is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings. He has been working as a day laborer since he finished school. He also raises pigs with his mother. This way he contributes towards the household expenses. He is known to be a quiet young man who likes to play soccer.

He will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of pigs, potatoes, vitamins, deparasitizers and balanced animal feed so they grow rapidly and thus he can sell them in the local market.

He aspires to continue working and growing his capital to buy cattle.

name: Marcia Cecilia
use: to buy chickens and pigs.
texts:
Marcia is 52 and widowed. She lives with her five-year-old granddaughter. She's Marcia's companion who brightens the house with her smiles and antics.

Marcia is known for being a calm and hardworking woman. She earns a living raising animals, including livestock, pigs and chicken. Her work is very important to her because thank to the income, she can pay for some household expenses and get ahead.

Maria wants to invest a little more in pigs and chickens. In the future, she wants to continue with her activity to be able to get ahead well in old age.

name: Catherine
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts:
Catherine is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Catherine is 25 years old.

Catherine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Catherine requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Catherine has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Catherine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Marianita
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care items, and other groceries.
texts:
Marianita is 57 years old and married with seven children. Marianita works very hard to provide for them.

Marianita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care items, and other groceries.

Marianita has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Jelly
use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
texts:
Jelly is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

Jelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as chips, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, canned goods, etc, to sell in her store.

Jelly has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Jelly aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Judith
use: to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.
texts:
Judith is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Judith has a vegetable-selling business in the Philippines. Judith requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

Judith has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Anania
use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.
texts:
Anania is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anania is 54 years old.

Anania has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anania requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anania has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Anania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Mary Sharon
use: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.
texts:
Mary Sharon works hard to support two children. She is married and has a farming business in the Philippines.

Mary Sharon requested a 3450 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Mary Sharon is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

name: Mary
use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, and other snack foods.
texts:
Mary is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school, Mary works very hard to provide for them.

Mary runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, and other snack foods.

Mary has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Mary would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Romel
use: to buy grocery items such as snack foods, toiletries, noodles, canned goods, food seasonings, powdered drinks and soft drinks.
texts:
Romel is a single man who lives in Baybay, Leyte with his family. They earn a living by running a small grocery store. He and his family have been in this business for five years now. Romel wants to improve this business and have it become sustainable.

Therefore, he needs additional capital to make it possible; this is why he is asking for a loan. With this loan he will buy grocery items such as snack foods, toiletries, noodles, canned goods, food seasonings and powdered drinks. He will also buy soft drinks. These items will improve his inventory of stocks, thus, allowing him to become productive.

name: Florentina
use: to buy grocery items such as toiletries, snack foods, candies, chocolate bars, noodles, canned goods and other basic commodities; and soft drinks.
texts:
Florentina is a 60-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with two children who are now adult. To earn a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Meanwhile, her husband does driving.

Florentina aspires to improve her business. With this, she asks for a loan to buy additional stock. Specifically, she will buy grocery items such as toiletries, snack foods, candies, chocolate bars, noodles, canned goods and other basic commodities. She will also buy soft drinks.

name: Laysim's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts:
Laysim’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Laysim works as a farmer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Laysim safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Theary's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: Theary’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Theary works as a farmer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Theary safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Juanita
use: to buy cases of soft drinks of different brands, trays of eggs, biscuits, sugar, and milk which are in high demand during the school season.
texts:
Juanita is 54 years old and married. Throughout their marriage, Juanita and her husband never had the opportunity to have their own child. However, Juanita supports a niece who is studying.

For years now Juanita's husband has operated a tricycle while Juanita owns and manages a small store. As the school season is fast approaching, Juanita sees it as a good opportunity to earn money. She is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy cases of soft drinks of different brands, trays of eggs, biscuits, sugar, and milk which are in high demand during the school season.

Juanita hopes that through the increased inventory, she will be able to continue to support her niece while at the same time save for her and her husband's retirement needs.

name: An's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
texts: An’s Group lives in a rural village in Preah Sihanouk Province in Cambodia. An does work fishing to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help An safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Evelyn
use: to buy assorted canned goods, 2 sacks of rice, 3 dozen bottles of cooking oil, 5 trays of eggs and assorted bath soap and shampoo to sell to her customers.
texts:
Evelyn works hard to help her husband earn for their family. Her husband works as an employee in a government office and his salary hardly covers the needs of their family, especially now that their two children are already studying in college.

To help, Evelyn has engaged in different income-generating activities. She owns and manages a small store, operates a tricycle that she uses for transporting student-neighbors to and from the school, and sews round cleaning rugs on the side.

Currently Evelyn is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to buy assorted canned goods, 2 sacks of rice, 3 dozen bottles of cooking oil, 5 trays of eggs and assorted bath soap and shampoo to sell to her customers. The upcoming school opening would see an increased demand for these items, especially for those families who prepare packed lunches for students. In addition, Evelyn would also want to buy 2 new sets of tires for her tricycle so it would be in good condition for the upcoming school opening.

name: Margie
use: to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies needed to raise her pig.
texts:
Margie is 51 years old, married and has four children.

Margie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies needed to raise her pig.

Margie has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

name: Liberata
use: to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc. and other supplies needed in her business.
texts:
As a married parent of two children, Liberata works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Liberata is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc. and other supplies needed in her buy-and-sell personal care product business.

Liberata has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Joy
use: to buy materials needed for her business like needles, thread, cloth, and other materials needed make dresses to sell.
texts:
Joy is a single woman, 29 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Joy has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like needles, thread, cloth, and other materials needed make dresses to sell.

Joy has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Hildamae
use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.
texts:
Hildamae is a 41-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are still in school.

Hildamae has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Hildamae has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Ellen
use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, and other items for her food vending business.
texts:
Ellen is a single woman, 34 years old with five children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ellen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, and other items for her food vending business.

Ellen has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Merceditha
use: to buy additional ready-to-wear items such as shorts, pants, shirts, etc. to sell.
texts:
As a married parent of three children, Merceditha works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Merceditha is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear items such as shorts, pants, shirts, etc. to sell for her business buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Merceditha has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

name: Marelyn
use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.
texts:
Marelyn is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Marelyn has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Lucia
use: to buy materials needed for her beauty salon business.
texts:
Lucia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucia is 53 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Lucia has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed in her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Juanita
use: to buy fishs nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts:
Juanita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanita is 60 years old.

Juanita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Juanita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Gracela
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts:
Gracela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gracela is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Gracela has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gracela requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Gracela has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Gracela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Jacklyn
use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.
texts:
As a parent of three children, Jacklyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Jacklyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Jacklyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Wilfreda
use: to purchased additional goods for the store.
texts:
Wilfreda, is 56 years old and a married mother of two. She owns a grocery store in her village to help her husband support their family.

She became a member of GDMPC since 2013 and recently requested a new loan to purchased additional goods for her store. Her future plan is to expand her business with a small eatery.

name: Alfredo
use: to pay for more recycled materials like bottles and old newspapers for his junk shop.
texts:
At 52 years old, Alfredo has six children and he has worked hard so all of them will have a better future. Today, only two of his children are left studying and he can say that all his hard work was worth it. He is married to Lourdita, 53 who stays at home as a housewife to do the home chores. He has a junk shop that he started three years ago and he is glad that there are organizations willing to partner with him in improving his business.

He would like to ask for financial assistance that will be used in buying more recycled materials like bottles and old newspapers for his junk shop. The loan to be borrowed will be a big help to his business and will play a big part in its expansion. He hopes to have a vehicle and prays that his business will grow bigger.

Alfredo is a member of the Center for Community Transformation and meets weekly with his fellowship partners to share his life’s testimony and business experience with his fellowship members. He also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 20 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships among partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

name: Phoun's Group
use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
texts:
Phoun’s Group lives in a rural village in Preah Sihanouk Province in Cambodia. Phoun does work as a fisherman to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Phoun safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

name: Lorelie
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Lorelie is 39 years old and has seven children. Lorelie is married and has three children who are still in school.

Lorelie is in the agricultural business of raising poultry in the Philippines. Lorelie requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lorelie has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Helen
use: to purchase fishing materials like a new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials needed for her business.
texts:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Helen is borrowing 9000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like a new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

name: Rosa
use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Rosa is 48 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Rosa works very hard to provide for them.



Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

Rosa has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

name: Flor
use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.
texts:
Flor is 53 years old and has two children. She is a married woman.

Flor is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Flor requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Flor has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flor would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Pacencia
use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
texts:
Pacencia is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Pacencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, toothpaste etc to sell in her store.

Pacencia has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

name: Gelyn
use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.
texts:
Gelyn is 41 years old and has three children. With two of her children still in school, Gelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Gelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Gelyn has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Gelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Eusebia
use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
texts:
Eusebia is 48 years old, married, and has five children.

Eusebia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Eusebia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eusebia has been in this business for 12 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eusebia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

name: Ian
use: to buy nail polish and other supplies needed in her manicure and pedicure business.
texts:
Ian is a married woman and has three children, all of whom who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and she is 37 years old.

Ian has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Ian requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy nail polish and other supplies needed in her business.

Ian has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ian would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

name: Silvina
use: to buy more fruit to sell.
texts:
Silvina is a 62-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Silvina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Silvina has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
